title: Great 3 filter system but you have to replace each filer often - costly to maintain.
text: Not quite sure how to change a filter yet - I guess I'll figure it out in a week when I need to change the charcoal filter (once per month)  the sponge filter (every two months) and the biofilter (every three months).  I just know you never want to change more than 1 filter at a time so you don't lose all that good bacteria you built up during your tank cycling.  I'm a little hesitant to change my biofilter but I assume they know what there doing when they tell you all will be OK.  This is a very quiet filter with adjustable speeds - so depending on the fish you can slow that current down.  A betta would be happy.  My fish don't seem to care - I place it in about the middle because right now my fish are very young and probably don't enjoy being tossed around by a current.  This come with two filter tubes - so you don't need to buy any extra unless you have a super tall tank.  I have real plants in my tank and they are determined to clog up my tubes - I have to remove them from the filter tubes every day and wash them out to get rid of plant debris.  Not the filters fault.  I love it actually other than being hesitant to change filters and knowing that it's going to get pretty costly in the long run because the filters are not cheap.  Remember to turn off your filter during a big water change.  You'll also need to re-prime the filter when you re-start it by pouring some aquarium water in the filter. No big deal, no exact amount - you'll know you've got it right when the filter starts working smoothly again.  Overall a great design, just costly to replace the filters.  Too bad you can't just clean some of the filters and reuse - this seems expensive and wasteful.  As far as keeping the water clean - no.  Again, I think this is due to using real plants and some of my fish food (dried worms) come in a cube that disintegrates all over the place.  I don't know if it's a cube of all worms or some kind of binding material but the fish won't eat it so a few days ago I gave them 2 cubes and I'm still fighting the mess of all those strings in the water - and the filter doesn't seem to be helping.  BUT I know as soon as I do a 50% water change - probably in a few days - the water will go back to being crystal clear - so I think this food and plant debris has just overloaded my filter. - it all floats on the top and is a mess to try to suction out or strain out.  I guess I would have expected the filters to pick  up a lot of this gunk - I guess I'll find out when I do a filter change.  I'm hoping I don't see all three filters clogged up since I can't replace all of them at once.  Also they tell you to temporarily remove the charcoal filter if you have to add any medication - or the charcoal will just absorb it all.  I was intimidated by this filter when I first got it (I'm a newbie) but I figured it out in a flash.  UPDATE:6 weeks later:  I really hate this filter.  I refuse to toss out a biofilter and sponge filter that has been growing all my bacteria - when they could be rinsed off and reused.  Also small piece under the filter is supposed to keep this thing level and it falls out CONSTANTLY making the filter unable to get water. I changed the charcoal filter after dumping water on the floor from the filter 3 times so GET YOUR ELECTRICAL out of the way.  This thing is dangerous, hard to use and expensive to maintain. Changing my stars.  A YEAR LATER Amazon tells me I've purched 5 units like that should make me happy (I have 3 aquariums).  The flow rate is awesome - when you have a flow.  My biggest problem is getting the tubing to fit together - on some units it does, on other units it does notl  I've even used a small hammer to pound in the tubing without any luck.  Right now the impeller is not pulling strong enough to suction any water through it;  Took me over an hour to get the tubing to together and it still doesn't work because the impeller is fading away,  I've sent one back for it's lifetime warranty but have since lost the address.  Any sugestions?  EVEN LATER: this is a disaster of engineering I only love it for the three levels of filtration.  But I think what happens is the sponge clogs, water pressure pushes the sponge upwards, which in turn push the carbon and biofilter upward, then it pushes of the lid makes a horrible noise until you take everything out and rinse the sponge out (which is washing good bacteria away) and getting the sponge clean,  After a month or so I put in a new sponge and the same thing happens day 1.  So about 4 out of 7 days a week I fuss with this thing ALL DAY (and I have 4 aqauariums and they all have different sizes and all but the smallest size does this.  Now I set something REALLY HEAVY on the lid to prevent this only to find that since the filter is clogged that no water goes through it.  One day I woke up and the water kept going, overflowed the filer and poured water all over the floor covering about 1/4 of a 9x12 room.  I have no idea how it accomplished that.  The intake tubes are impossible to get in place until you really get the hang of it.  That said, it's lovely to look at, and has 3 levels of filtration.  The cost to replace all our filters isn't in the budget and I haven't seen any I like except external canister filters which are super expensive.

title: Great for getting weed seeds out of fur! text: I'm not sure why it doesn't take hair off of every pet--maybe it depends on the thin/thickness of the hair?

I have an English Springer Spaniel and it works wonderfully on his fur. It's not the fluffiest fur but it is pretty long and can be thick. Every swipe of the brush is full of fur and my dog is never uncomfortable with it (he loves to be brushed now!). The only time he doesn't like it is when there are knots in his fur, but it's not hard to get the knots out with this brush.

The best use for it that I've found is getting weed seeds out of my dog's fur. We take him behind our housing development and let him run free, and every time he comes back with burs and houndstongue seeds all over his fur--on/in his ears, his belly, armpits, rear-end. This brush makes it so efficient to get the seeds out! If you know how to brush hair and hold it or press it at the skin so that it doesn't pull or yank (women with long hair know how this goes), it won't hurt your pet to get the seeds out. I've come to the suspicion that my dog now seeks out the weed patches just so that he'll get a good brushing all over after we get home!

title: Works fine for small dog with light duty use. Feels light and a bit flimsy text: With 7 dogs in various sizes here, we have a ridiculous collection of leashes and harnesses in every size, length and style. When it comes to retractable leashes, I only buy the original, real Flexi Leads because I know they are made to withstand hard use for years. This one is ok, but not as good as the real Flexi Leads.

This one is essentially the same size as our small dog Flexi, but this has a larger handle and slightly more oval shape. See the photos - the blue one is the Flexi Lead and this one is the black unit. The Flexi is heavier and made of thicker materials than this one. I prefer the catch on the Flexi with the two button stop - I can pause the leash extension without locking it on the Flexi, hut this one is straight to lock with one push.

I've used this daily for a week with our newest rescue dog. Mighty Mouse just weighs 33lbs and is incredibly polite on leash - not a puller. This has been fine for him on regular walks through our neighborhood, but it's not the retractable I would choose for hikes or in town because it's not as sturdy as the Flexi brand.

title: Finally! No soy, no corn, no trash ingredients. Just real food. text: I'm so proud of Cesar for this new line. Finally they are getting it together and realizing that smart dog owners demand simple, healthy, high quality ingredients for our dogs rather than the cheap fillers like soy, wheat, corn and wood cellulose.

These pods are just big enough to use as toppers over the dry kibble for my large breed dogs and that's perfectly ok as far as I'm concerned. A tiny, toy breed might make a meal out of a pod though. You can clearly see each pea, piece of carrot and shredded piece of actual chicken in each serving. My dogs like this a lot and none have shown any digestive distress after two meals with these pods. These pods are also easy to travel with - no can opener required.

title: Only one of my three cats will eat this food; ingredients are good text: There are 24 3-ounce cans in this package in 3 flavors (chicken entree, turkey dinner, and turkey and salmon entree).

I had my three cats try all three. My cat Stephen refused to even attempt to eat this. My cat Jake took a bite of one and walked. My cat Ricky liked all three.

The ingredients are good.

The first 10 ingredients of the chicken entree are chicken, chicken liver, turkey, chicken broth, carrots, natural flavor, guar gum, cranberries, ground flaxseed, potassium choloride, etc.

The first 10 ingredients of the turkey dinner are turkey, chicken liver, chicken, chicken broth, carrots, natural flavor, guar gum, cranberries, ground flaxseed, potassium choloride, etc.

The first 10 ingredients of the turkey and salmon entree are turkey, chicken liver, whitefish, chicken broth, salmon, carrots, natural flavor, guar gum, cranberries, ground flaxseed, etc.

The current price of $28.89 comes to $1.20 for each 3 ounce can, which is expensive. However, I will not be buying this for my cats because only one cat will eat this. If my three cats ate this, it would have gotten 4 stars as it is still too expensive for such a small quantity.

title: Finally, after 4 harnesses, one that works!
text: My Tigger is a 17-pound Chihuahua/Jack Russell mix (yes, he is a spaz from both sides of the genetic line, but I love him).  He also has a collapsing trachea.  I tried 3 different harnesses before this one.  Each one either didn't fit, even though I followed the size chart specifically, or he could wiggle out of it or he choked.  This is my 4th attempt and I am very pleased.  I got him a large and it fits great.  He doesn't choke and he holds steady in it.  As with other posters here, I would not leave this on when you are not walking your pet, as the hooks where the leash attach are situated oddly and rattle and hit Tiggie in the back of the head, but this is an amazing solution to all my issues.

title: Three paws down from my four cats text: I wanted my cats to try this grain free salmon cat food. However, even after mixing it with their own food and a 12-hour standoff, only two of them sampled it and two others were not interested. One of my cats actually tried to bury the food. What is really interesting is that I have begun to feed my cats [[ASIN:B000634CO6 Purina One Cat Adult Urinary Tract Formula Cat Food, 16-Pound]] that has a low ash content. In general, most cats avoid such low ash foods and my cats would not eat any other low ash food but this. However, when putting down both foods side-by-side, they picked the Purina One.

This kibble has a mediocre fishy smell which I do not care for. However, the aroma slowly dissipates. The package claims it's made of highly digestible protein from fresh salmon; nourishes a radiant and lustrous skin and coat; supports healthy kidney's, immune system and good vision; and has 100% complete nutrition. The first four ingredients are salmon, potatoes, pea protein concentrate, and yellow peas. The guaranteed analysis is:

Crude Protein Minimum 29.0%
Crude Fat Minimum 18.0%
Crude Fiber Maximum 2.0%
Moisture Maximum 9.0%
Vitamin E Minimum 500 IU/kg
Taurine Minimum 0.2%
Ascorbic Acid (Vitamin C) Minimum 85 mg/kg
Omega-3 Fatty Acids Minimum 0.5%
Omega-6 Fatty Acids Minimum 3.0%

Calorie Content (calculated) is 4102 kcal ME/kg; 12 kcal ME/cup

This food is obviously very expensive at the current price of $18.56 for a 2 pound bag; however, it appears to be high quality nutrition. Nevertheless, it is no good to me if my cats won't eat it. I will continue to try to sneak it to them with their regular food. It appears like my cats do not like Science Diet (see the link to my other Science Diet review in the comments section), as they didn't like [[ASIN:B00DURIQ0G Hills Science Diet Adult Grain Free Cat Food, 11-Pound Bag]] (not salmon flavored) either.

March 8, 2014 UPDATE - It's been almost a week that I have been mixing this food in with their regular food. My one cat still wants to bury it. The food is being eaten slowly and only as a last resort when not much else is left. This morning I put out the last of the 2 pound bag for the four of them; this time with less of their food and they are avoiding it completely. However, I know they will eventually eat it when they get hungry enough and after I add in some of their food. On another note, the package Hill's Science comes in is 5 stars. I really like the Velcro-like closure which provides for easy access to the food and allows me to seal the bag easily.

title: All six dogs absolutely love these! Easy for seniors to chew & free of soy, corn and wheat text: Wow! These are easily the best dog treats I've given my pack of Heathens in years. Every single dog loves these. All six line up and push each other out of the way for these and given a choice between these rabbit treats and any others in our pantry, all of them snatch the rabbit treat up first. The ingredients are excellent and with zero corn, soy or wheat I don't have to worry about my allergy prone boys eating a couple every day.

The round shape is easy hold and break in half - there's no oily or greasy residue on my fingers or in my pockets after a training session either. The price is a bit steep,but considering the prime ingredients and overall quality of the treats, I am willing to continue buying these on a regular basis.

Regardless, the smell is noticeably lesser than before.

title: Use this wisely with backup plan..!!! text: I needed these to work for our newer puppy‚Ä¶ Or, maybe, I so desperately wanted them to work. But, unfortunately.. we could not make that happen! I‚Äôm not certain if it‚Äôs to blame on the size/shape/breed of the pug puppy we have? Or.. product itself?

Getting this on was NoT the easiest task‚Ä¶ And then, getting the puppy not to try and eat/attack this once we had it in place was even harder!

Situation: we have X1 gap ea. week with a 2‚Äô spot in this one day- where the overlap to take puppy out to potty is 2hrs. too long‚Ä¶ Out of a desperate idea- hope that this product would cover gap till our pup could start puppy school (waiting for shots to take effect!!) a a product to keep puppy from an accident and a need to be locked in tiny kennel. The results have been much less then, stellar.. as mentioned, unsure if dog/product is the problem?!!

Let‚Äôs be honest- this concept is just not a natural solution and so, not very conducive to success.. it‚Äôs not meant to be in leui of potty training.. I know that..!!! if it all was that easy of a fix, puppies/dogs everywhere would be adorning diapers! I do realize now, this is best used for emergent scenarios ie. plane ride/dr visit/hotel moments- any place with zero access to let them go potty...

We did test a total of four times- 3 out 4 tries of putting wrap on and leaving house with him that way- only x1 had the wrap still been in place When coming back!! And- the x1 time this stayed in place on the pup -it did not end well! Upon return.. Not a dry outcome! In fact, it had the bedding puppy was laying on- damp, not soaked but, quite damp. So, the ability to absorb wasn‚Äôt as much as expected? Since, It appeared the puppy kept wrap on and left it alone (it was still ‚Äúin position‚Äú when removing.) we had damp bedding- So, either it filled up or, had leakage..?? I was surprised it leaked- especially with the size of the little puppy- I thought wrap could contain more or guard better? But, this didn‚Äôt hold up and have dry results- So, is it odd shape of the pug?? Hard to say?! I just know this won‚Äôt meet the particular need with any peace of mind.
**note- Yes!! we ceased all food/h20 for puppy and took him out to potty- 30min. after he ate and he went to the bathroom. We curved all drinking h2o to all but eliminated While gone- (we have ability of a drip line) Just for dire thirst/anxiety issues.

Overall, it may not help our situation and maybe it is due to an unrealistic expectation.. ?? I do see this having the best benefit on a flight or, a place where NO other option may exist... But, I suggest staying with your dog at all time while using it and also, have backup wraps and bedding in case it doesn‚Äôt hold and you‚Äôre left Up a creek without a paddle‚Ä¶ Or on a plane with a puddle ha ha!
Size reference- pug is 16‚Äù girth and 8.7lb.. it is male and he is naughty!!

title: Great box but very fragile text: I ordered 4 of these online at Petco and they are wonderful except for one major issue.

First, the litter pans come with a litter scoop, some bags, and a filter. The scoop is really useless so I use metal scoops I purchased separately instead and I don't bother with the litter pan liners at all. The negative of using my own scoop is that since the litter pan bottom has rounded corners, it is a bit difficult to scoop around those corners should some litter be clumped there.

Second, what I really like is the swinging door that cats can easily enter and exit and its large design. One of my four cats is fat, a little over 16 pounds, and he fits easily into the box because it is huge. He also has a problem that he'll pee outside the litter pan if there's no door in the way which is why the door is very important to me.

Finally, I have a love / hate relationship with the fact that it is made of hard plastic. The hard plastic makes the box sturdy and also easy to wipe clean with Clorox wipes or a wet paper towel if a cat pees on the sides. The big negative is that the plastic cracks so easily. I knew that before I purchased it but I figured I would handle them with kid gloves and not have too much of a problem with breakage. Well I was wrong.

Before I even purchased them online, I looked at them in two Petco's. Each of the Petco's I visited had one of these litter pans (at a much higher price than you can purchase from Petco online) and all those litter pans were broken in one spot or another. I thought it was just bad customers so I took the risk and purchased online. Of the 4 litter pans shipped, I had to return one because one arrived cracked. They really didn't pack the 4th litter pan right, so this was expected. Petco has an easy return to store policy if you order from their online site, so that wasn't too much of a hassle. Nevetheless, I continued to love these litter pans for one month until today.

Today, I had to clean one fully. I do this every time I change the litter completely. Well the litter pan broke in two places. First as I was gentley removing the swinging door the tiny plastic insert that holds it in place in the top broke on one side. Then, I was trying to remove the filter before washing and didn't realize I needed to put the handle down all the way. As a result, when lifting the top off the filter section, that cracked almost in two. That crack was my fault obviously but if it was not such a brittle pan, I would have noticed my error before it cracked. I finally washed the entire litter pan but from now on I will only wipe down the top and wash the bottom part only. This hard plastic is just too fragile.

I absolutley loved everything about these litter pans until this point and my cats love them too. However, I definitely would not purchase them again unless they use a more pliable plastic.

My recommendation is to look at it in the Petco store before you order it online. The online price is usually cheaper by $10 to $20 anyway. Also, the online dimensions are listed in centimeters instead of inches so don't think it's small because it really is MEGA. Decide if you are willing to take the risk of breakage. If you don't clean or move around the litter pan, except take the top off to scoop (which I do twice per day), then perhaps you won't have breakage immediately.

The design is 5 stars but the durability is two stars - hence the 3-star ratiing. Had I not had the breakage today I might have still rated this 5 stars.

We tried to do his annual vet checkup three times, with three adults  trying to get him into a carrier.  Suffice it to say that metal doors were broken, seams ripped from linens, and liberal flesh wounds were experienced  by all the ‚Äúhandlers.‚Äô  This toy, which arrived promptly and needed no special handling or packaging, when combined with feliway spray, did the trick!  The spray mimics the pheromones of a mother cat, and the little purple soft kitty toy purrs as Rudy embraces it!  Yay!  We were able to successfully transport him to the veterinarian at last!  He looks pretty cute sleeping with it, too.  It may at some time contribute to saving his life.  I recommend it heartily. Our little Sophie (4.5 lb Siamese mix) started spraying and attacking her "brother", same parents, different litter. She hated all 3 boys and wasn't afraid to show it. She was constantly spraying everything & driving us crazy. We all adore our little girl but were at our wits end. Over the last 2 weeks she has completely stopped spraying, has become very confident in this zoo (2 Border Collie, 2 Chihuahua's and 3 other cats). Which is why I know that two of my five dogs don't like it and actually prefer their Avoderm food..... they are eating around the Natural Balance kibble & leaving it in their bowls.

My other three dogs seem not notice any difference and none have had any intestinal distress. I do appreciate that this food is free of corn, wheat and especially no soy. But in straight comparison with the two versions of Avoderm that we feed, the ingredients in the Avoderm Lamb and Sweet Potato is just a bit better. title: For small dogs or cats only; high quality, sturdy, and safe harness text: This review is for the [[ASIN:B07KP1FLM6 DOG STORY ENZO Harness B-Orange-Large]].

title: Large Size
text: This is my first time with a stainless steel litter pan. This is larger than I expected. I was able to replace 2 smaller plastic ones with this one. I have 4 senior cats. Most of them don't have any difficulties stepping in and out of the litter boxes, but the oldest one had a stroke a few months ago. He's getting better, but he does have problems climbing in and out of the regular ones at times. He spends most of his time upstairs, so this is the one he uses the most now. The height is high enough to keep most of the litter inside, but easy enough for him to get in and out. Wet litter does stick a bit to the surface, but it is easier to scoop out than the plastic ones. The material doesn't absorb the smell like the plastic ones either. So far, we are pleased with it.

title: Well made, but both cats ignored it text: This is essentially another pet licking mat, which have appeared to be all the rage the last few months. These are also used as feeders for the scarf-and-barf pets, who need help to slow down while eating.

The mat is bright orange. It is much stiffer than any other silicone mat I own. It will take a brush to clean it once you've let your pets lick it.

So far, neither of our cats will use it, but I'll give it some time and a few more washings to get the "new plastic" smell out, and try it again.

title: easy to 'apply'
text: Lily loves her new bikini!  With limited bladder control, Lily can now have the run-of-the-house and sit in our laps.... drip-free! These dog diapers are well designed, easy to 'apply', and repeated washing leaves a bright and lasting color. Strong Velcro attachments supplement fit and growth. A blessing for piddle-free indoor dog care and easily removed for outside adventures. Lily thinks she is the 'Belle of the Ball' in her new outfit.

title: Flexible Wire Bristles Remove Mats and Tangles text: My long-haired pets never liked to be brushed with this type of flexible wire bristle brush. Use it on yourself, and you can understand why. Used gently, the bristles won't break the skin or make marks, but they do scrape the skin and leave a mild burning sensation. The brush is primarily intended to remove mats and tangles from short-haired dogs, and dead hair from dogs that have long flowing coats or harsh outer coats with wooly undercoats.

I use one of these brushes to fluff up a sheepskin wheelchair cushion cover, particularly after washing, as suggested by the manufacturer. With use, a sheepskin seat cover can get lumpy or matted, just as it does on the sheep! Gentle brushing with this wire dog brush is effective at realigning the long fibers of the sheepskin.

The rectangular portion of this "Medium" brush measures 2-1/2" x 5", and the wire bristle portion measures 1-1/2" x 4". The bristles are firmly attached to a soft "rubber" backing. The heavy-duty handle has a molded grip, and feels very comfortable in the hand.

title: Lightweight and disposable; holds almost two cups of food; will slide around easily if pushed text: There are 25 bowls to this package and each bowl holds almost two cups of food. I was able to get a full two cups of dry food in this bowl when piled to the very top in a mound.

These are lightweight and although the food weighs down the bowl, it can easily be pushed around by an energetic eater. I had my cats try these and it was fine even if I left wet food in this overnight. It also holds water as well. I did not experience leaks, although I did not leave water in these bowls overnight.

These are perfect for travel or for animal agencies that transport pets from place to place for adoption. This small bowl would be suitable for up to a medium-sized dog. I would size up to the [[ASIN:B07ZPN2C23 large]] if using with a Saint Bernard, Great Dane, Mastiff, or similarly-sized dog.

At the current price of $9.99 for 25 bowls, this comes to about $.40 cents per bowl.

title: Really cute Wonder Woman cape for people and pets (Extra Large size) text: This cape is really cute, it is high quality except for the velcro fastener.

The neck size even fits kids and women with smaller necks. So if you don't want to spend $25+ on the full size woman's cape, go for this mini version for dogs.

The should have made the fastener better, even strings would have been better than a shrimpy tiny piece of velcro. The fastener needs to be upgraded to secure better on who ever wears this (human or dog). So plan on securing it better if you don't want to lose it in transit. Use a small safety pin, or sew on strings to the ends, or sew on a larger piece of velcro to both ends ... that would be my suggestion.

title: Dog Vitamin / Treat
text: We have used this product for years.  Amazon had best price this time.  Our dogs have loved these and we use them as a treat opportunity.  Great for overall health and hips on our larger breed dogs, our smaller dogs love them too.

title: His New Fave Treat...
text: As you can see in the photo (apologies for the quality of the photo...my cell camera stinks!), Mac loves Pur Luv's K9 Rawhide Free Chicken Dog Treats! He runs through the house when he hears us get the bag out and open it...that's how excited he gets! lol.  Mac is a bichon frise, so these treats are an excellent size for him. They're also fairly soft so he's able to chew without any kind of issue. (Well, there is one issue...our cat Miss Piggy tries to sneak a bite out of the treat as Mac eats it! lol. Don't worry, we don't let her eat so much as a crumb!)  I especially love that chicken is the first ingredient, there is a limited amount of ingredients in the treats AND...they're rawhide free!  I love to spoil my my sweet boy and that's precisely what happens when he gets a Pur Luv treat.  I find the price to be reasonable and fair.  Mac and I both recommend Pur Luv treats...your furbaby will love them!

title: The Perfect Dog Treat (except for the scent...lol)
text: About 10 seconds after I brought the mail in, our bichon Mac went bonkers. Nature Gnaws thin bully sticks had just been delivered and he wanted one immediately! lol.  He was so impatient waiting for me to open the package! lol. In the instant I gave him one, he immediately tore into it and didn't stop until he finished every bite.  Wait...that's not quite true. He did pause to growl at our cat, Miss Piggy who wanted a bite of the bully stick.  (I didn't let her have any) Thing is, Mac and Miss Piggy are BFFs.  They're always together.  For him to growl at her is HUGE! Just goes to show how much he loves Nature Gnaws!  Bully sticks are made from ONE ingredient. ONE. And that one ingredient is the pizzle tendon(penis )  of a bull.  They are thin and the perfect size for Mac.  He has no issues chewing/swallowing the bully stick. Not only does Mac LOVE bully sticks, the chewing motion helps  remove plaque and tartar build up. The one and only downside is the scent. Its awful.  I breathe through my mouth when I handle them so I don't have to smell them. lol.  I love to spoil Mac and giving him Nature Gnaws is one way to do that. And the best part is, they're healthy and consist of one ingredient.  Definitely recommended!

My only complaint is the leash in this set. I just don't like the design  without a real, padded handle. It's harder to grip this leash if you have arthritis.

title: Working well in a F150 Super Crew cab. Paisley design is fun and bright text: I almost always have a dog or three in my truck and my doors are constantly assailed with wet noses, muddy paws, loose dog hair and general dust after being out at the horse barn with me. My main reason for getting these covers is to keep the dust and hair from getting into the window and locking mechanisms.

I got the color splash covers with the paisley design on top and they really look fresh and fun. They slip in along the edge of the rolled up window with thin plastic tabs, but my set did not come with the alternate Velcro attachments. I'm using these in an F150 Super Crew cab and the covers are a little too wide for my back doors. I had to fold each one a bit and then they fit fine.

I use a lot of the Kurgo brand products because they are well made and high quality - I have their harnesses, seat covers and travel bowls. These covers seem to be up to the usual quality of my other Kurgo stuff and are working fine for my needs.

title: Soy free. Dogs like it, but expect flatulence text: The ingredient quality here is solid and free of junk like soy. The little tetrapacks are shed stable until opened and there's more food in each one than expected. However, once you open these, the smell will knock you back. The food definitely smells bad. 6 of our 7 dogs each got a half a box mixed with their kibble last night.

All 6 dogs seem to like this food, it's a grayish mush and mixed well. This morning everyone had unusual flatulence. Our dogs don't typically have gas so this was unwelcome. My primary complaint is the value. I just don't see the high price point being worth it when you have multiple large dogs.

It also feels like I am just skimming the surface instead of grabbing the undercoat as I would expect with a comb like this. To remove the comb, just press the button at the top of the handle. However, there is no need to remove the head unless one is putting this back in the box.

The current price of $2.99 must be a mistake because it is a steal for this. However, I don't like it even¬†though it¬†comes at a cheap price.

title: How to Spoil a Cat text: We have two cats that generally sleep apart though occasionally they curl up with one another (unsual as they tend to compete instead of cooperate). They spend the night in the finished part of the basement, and typically one ends up on the couch while the other sleeps on the floor in the hallway. I laid out a blanket for the one who sleeps in the hallway but this is not ideal ‚Äì the blanket gets rumpled and wadded up and she ends up on the floor anyway. I looked to this bed as a solution and it has worked out exceptionally well.

This is a plush bed, with four padded inserts for the sides and a soft and extra padded bottom. There is some assembly involved but it's easy ‚Äì the pads insert into the outer shell of the bed and zip in securely. The shell is a suede-like material that should hold up for a good while. When completely assembled the bed is of good size and it takes up a substantial part of the hallway.

I laid out the bed and put in a fleece blanket. The blanket is probably unnecessary but I wanted to make sure the cat was doing as little damage to the bed as possible as she loves to sharpen her claws. It took her less than an hour to find the bed and she immediately set up camp. I was a bit surprised to find her and her sister in the bed, and since the first night I have seen them together several times, though usually the one is on the couch anyway.

There are two sizes of pet bed here, and I have the Large, not the XL. This pet bed is larger than I would normally suggest for a cat, but it is in a low-traffic area of the house so it is not a problem where it is. It is large enough and substantial enough to comfortably sleep a golden retriever or similarly sized dog.

In one fell swoop we have totally spoiled the cat by putting this bed down where she normally sleeps. The bed is comfortable and large enough that both of our cats often sleep next to one another on this bed, which says a lot as they are usually competitors. This is a large, plush pet bed and both of our spoiled rotten cats approve.

Disclosure: I was provided a sample of this product in exchange for a fair, honest and thorough review. Even though I received this product at no cost I have rated and reviewed this product without bias, based solely on my experience with it.

title: Good quality, weird fit text: Potentially nice raincoat BUT fits weird. I have a Bichon who weighs 16 lbs and her length is 14‚Äù so I got a Medium. It seemed like a good choice BUT the NECK was too tight. It kind of works if we don‚Äôt close it all the way but I don‚Äôt know if it will stay shut.

title: Contains soy. Four of six dog ate these. No change in coat conditions text: This is one of those products that probably takes a couple of months to fully evaluate and know for sure if it will truly cut down on the quantity of hair being consistently shed by your dog. Many things contribute to shedding - general health, the diet, the weather, the breed of dog and the type of coat the dog has. For my six dogs it's not terribly difficult to notice a change as a rule. My guys are slick coated and short haired with one exception and 5 of 6 are healthy (1 has an auto immune condition).

Ten days with this Shed No More and I have observed the following : Dog #1 will not eat these tablets. He refuses them even when wrapped in actual bacon. He pulls the bacon off and leaves the Shed No More on the floor. Dog #2 can't take these tablets at all because they are loaded with soy lecithin and he is allergic to soy.

Dogs #3 & #4 like these tablets and are happy to chew them as treats. Both are short hair Rhodesian Ridgebacks who shed a bit, but not profusely. I haven't noticed any real difference in their coats in the ten days - same amount of loose hair and their coats are no softer than before. Dogs #5 & #6 will eat these tablets only when I mix them up with their food - when offered free hand, they just sniff and walk away. Again, no difference whatsoever in the condition of their coats or quantity of loose hair laying around the house or dog beds.

I think the ingredients are probably a good idea in general for helping keep a healthier coat or encouraging a rescue dog's regrowth of healthy hair and skin overall. But to slow excessive shedding in an otherwise healthy dog, go back to the basics of grooming and a super healthy diet, exercise and weight.

title: Tetra Filter text: Setup was easy enough, and the filter's only moving parts are the energy well and the magnetic thing that goes inside. And the hood that pops up, if you count that as a significant moving part. At first, I didn't know how far down to push the carbon filter since the manual didn't specify, so I pushed it all the way down until it couldn't move anymore. Seems to be the right way. It's easy to remove and easy to replace. There's no water flowing over the carbon filter and the black mesh for bacteria cultivation is big enough to not restrict the flow.

There's a plastic lip where the filtered water comes out that helps dampen the impact of the water when it flows out, and it works to not stir up the water in my aquarium too much. My water level is pretty high, just touching the lip, so that helps as well. I have a lot of big spiral shells, a hollow castle, and some irregularly-shaped decorations, so the problem others had regarding the suction of the filter doesn't seem to apply to me. My fish are short-finned, active and nervous enough to fight the suction and they can hide easily if they want to. If it ever becomes a problem, I'll just put a piece of black mesh from my old filter into the intake part or wrap it around the openings in the intake piece.

Overall, seems like a good deal for 15 bucks or whatever. You can even open up the white filter pouches to replace the carbon without throwing the filter mesh away. And you can reverse the filter mesh if you know what you're doing and make it last that much longer. A decent buy for my 5 gallon aquarium. It makes an audible humming noise if I let the plastic tab on the main filter body make direct contact with the glass, but this is due to the vibrations going through the glass. I placed a small piece of fabric between the glass and the plastic support tab and it makes almost no noise now aside from the faint trickling sound of filtered water coming out and hitting the lip.

There are a few flaws, as can be seen above, but nothing serious or deal-breaking, especially for a filter that works as well as something you're likely to get for 30% more (maybe even more than that). I'm satisfied with the performance. If it holds up after a year, I'll definitely buy another one if I need a replacement.

title: lightweight ceramic, sturdy elevation stand, works well for our needs text: Lightweight ceramic bowls in sturdy elevated stand. Small bowls, but work well for smaller heads. Stand seems to stay in place (I have it on a vinyl tablecloth).

I had a very specific need for this style of bowl, and it surprisingly met that need. I have two young adult cats that I recently adopted. We already have 2 dogs and a cat and we knew that the transition would be slow. I set the new cats up in my office with all their needs. Door closed so the resident fur balls can sniff through door with new furballs. Then, at some point every day I close off the resident animals in part of the house and let the new kitties roam the other part of the house. This includes a sunroom with a screen door. After roaming around awhile, I close them off in the sunroom (had lots of windows, and totally outfitted with floor to ceiling climbers. Cat dream house!). When I do this, I make sure they have some food and water out there with them. I need the food and water containers to be easy to handle, and preferably something I can grab all at once to empty/clean/refill. That is where this set of elevated bowls come in.

The bowls are ceramic but light weight. I needed this. I did not want heavy for my very specific use. The bowls are small but effective-- again, exactly what I needed for my specific use. The framework holds the bowls securely and is easy to grab the whole thing-- perfect for my needs. So.. so far it has met and exceeded my expectations.

I use much larger, heavier bowls as the main food bowls any other time-- especially in a multi cat household (prior to adopting these cats, we had recently lost our 2 geriatric babies at 18+ years old.). This would not be something I would use as sole feeding station unless I had one small cat. Basically, know what you need, the size that you need, and the degree of weight you prefer for your bowls.

I am pleased with this.

title: Versatile, strong and can take serious abuse. Perfect for West Texas Trek. 6 months update text: I took a chance on using this 50 foot leash with our Traveler dog for a ten day road trip out the Big Bend area of Texas. We needed him to be controlled, but still have the freedom to explore and play.

This is really well made and the snap is strong enough to keep our bouncy 60lb Plott Hound connected on a chase in the desert or swimming in a creek out in the wilderness of deep West Texas. The padded handle was definitely a welcome change from the usual Flexi leads. This leash took some serious abuse - it was wet, dragged through the mud, cactus, mesquite tree thorns, boulders, used to tie up a kayak in a pinch, used to tie up a horse when a bridle strap broke, and our big old hound dog tangled it up in all sorts of stuff. There are no frayed places and all of the stitching is tight. I'm keeping this in my truck from now on - you never know when a 50 foot nylon lead will come in handy.

******* UPDATE December 9 2016 ******

We've been using this lead for about 6 months now on a fairly regular basis and it's holding up just fine. I take Traveler the Plott Hound out to the farm with it so he can hang out safely with me when I am working horses. We also use it with our heavier & stouter Rhodesian Ridgebacks walking through the trails & woods. (You don't do off leash with Ridgebacks in a National forest - they will hunt stuff for real!) I have had tons of folks stop me and ask where I got this lead because of the length and padded handle.

title: Ingredient Perfection, but They Are Quite Small text: Dogs love treats but as dog owners, we want to make sure our furry family members eat only those treats that pass our minimum nutritional and other standards. Most treats fall short, but one that easily exceeds expectations is Adirondack Grain Free Dog Treats Pure Chicken Breast.

Let me start by stating what makes these treats stand out among others: The ingredients. Take a look at the ingredient list and you will see exactly one! Yes, chicken is the only ingredient. There are no preservatives of any kind, no artificial colors, nothing bad at all. Folks, you can‚Äôt get any purer than this. Adirondack dog treats are worth buying and serving to your dog for this reason alone.

But, as a reviewer and critic, I must point out one issue I have with this dog treat, and that is the small size. My dogs inhale these small, cube- shaped treats in about 2 seconds. They are far too small for any dog, really. Even small breeds will chomp these down seconds after they are fed. Larger size would be better. And they are so light and lacking substance. The package only weighs 1.8 ounces so you can imagine how light each treat is. They are not chewy and thus take no time to eat.

Dog parents like me want what is best for their dog. We know that all dogs love food and love treats, but we know that many treats are not the best quality. Adirondack Grain Free Dog Treats Pure Chicken Breast are the ultimate in quality based on ingredients and other than the inadequate size, there is no good reason not to feed these to your dog.

title: Easy clean brush and the tines on this one are stronger than typical; for long-haired pets text: I actually tried several of these brushes previously and was disappointed in all but one because the tines were thin, highly malleable, and bent easily.

This brush's best feature is that it is a cinch to clean. I brush my long-haired cats, then retract the bristles with the button. The hair remains on top and can be slid off. It is a cinch to use.

Also, the tines on this brush are not as soft as several others I tried and the surface area of the brush is decently sized. As can be seen, I brushed one of my cats hard and got some of their hair (see photo) and the tines barely bent.

Note that this is for long-haired pets only; I would not use this with a pet with short hair.

In summary, this one's tines are stronger than other brushes I tried but will still bend. The surface area of the brush is a good size and I love the bumble bee design. I definitely like this brush and the current price of 9.99 is cheaper than some others of similar or lesser quality and function.

title: Hard pass on the tuna flavor, but others are better. text: We have long used this sort of hairball gel for our cats. We have tried a few flavors - well, THEY have tried a few flavors!
The malt was accepted well, and the catnip had them actually willingly eating it from the tube without issues.

But the tuna?
They love regular tuna flavored foods, both wet and treats. But they REFUSE to eat this flavor of the gel! I pick up the tube, and they scatter like I declared war!
I've tried smearing some on their front paws, but I become their Least Favorite Person for a while, until they have licked themselves clean and forgotten about their paw violations.

I'm not sure what the scoop is, as I refuse to taste-test it myself. However, based on decades of cat ownership, I trust them.
I'd avoid this tuna flavored stuff (apparently, the rest of the ingredients
clash with the fishy flavor), and stick with the other flavors.

Eight paws down from our hoard.

title: Works As Well As Name Brand Topical Treatments But Costs FAR Less! text: We live in a valley, surrounded by woods and mountains. Until a few years ago, I didn't think ticks were active during the cold winter months. I was proven to be very wrong one winter when our dog Mac had a tick engorged on his back in mid December! Lesson learned! He now receives flea/tick medicine monthly, year round. We've always used a rather expensive name brand flea/tick topical medication on Mac and its always worked VERY well, thankfully! When I received Solimo Flea and Tick Topical Treatment For Dogs, I compared the ingredients to his name brand topical we've been using. The ingredients are the same but Solimo is FAR cheaper. Talk about a win-win situation! I know he's getting medicine that WILL keep the fleas and ticks away and now its costing us less money for the same great protection!

Solimo is simple to administer. Simply open the tube and apply it to your dog's dry skin on the back, between shoulder blades. This needs to be done every 30 days so I make sure to make a note on the calendar immediately following an application so I don't forget the following month. The topical is waterproof. It has never caused our dog to have ANY kind of negative reaction after we've applied it. (I'm referring to the name brand we used to use as well as Solimo brand) This topical kills fleas, ticks, larvae for up to 30 days and that includes deer ticks, carrier of Lyme Disease. ( My sister's dog had Lyme Disease and it wasn't pleasant for him. I certainly don't want my furbaby to go through that so I'm super fussy about making sure Mac gets his meds every 30 days!)

I was impressed to see that Solimo (an Amazon brand) stands by this medicine and will refund your money for ANY reason within one year of purchase! After seeing the ingredients in this topical as well as seeing firsthand how it protects our dog, I doubt I'll never need to inquire about a refund with Solimo Flea and Tick Topical Treatment but its good to know that money back guarantee is in place just in case!

Solimo Flea and Tick Topical Treatment will take wonderful care of your furbaby and kill those nasty fleas, ticks and larvae! (Solimo does have a treatment for cats as well!) I absolutely recommend it!

title: My cat won't touch these treats text: Well, I had high hopes for these after all the good words about them.
However, our cat will not even touch them.
He has a very stiff hip and knee, and we thought these would make a perfect treat
for him. We thought - he didn't!!

He loves chicken, so what could be so wrong?
These are a little big for him, so we also tried pinching them in half.
Neither he nor his 'sister' will even consider eating these treats.

I know that cats are finicky, but both our cats love to get treats, and about knock
each other down to get them. These just lay there untouched.
We have tried tossing them (both love to catch treats), letting them eat from our
hands, and putting them in a dish. Nope. Nothing. Refused, rejected and ignored.

So, I hope they work well for someone. The idea behind them is a good one, if only
you can get them INSIDE your cat!
That wasn't the case for us.

title: Nice dog bed but not orthopedic
text: I have only had this bed for a few days, but my 14 year old dog seems to like it, but still seems to prefer his orthopedic bed.  This bed is not truly not an orthopedic bed and this company should correctly describe the bed.  For dogs with arthritis it is very helpful to find the right bed for their comfort.  When a maker says it is orthopedic, it should be orthopedic, not just a soft bed as there is a difference.  It is a nice, soft bed, so just advertise it as that and be honest.  I think most dogs without arthritis would like it very much.  My neighbor has a young dog and I will give it to her and keep looking for a true orthopedic bed.

title: Small, holds 2 cups of my 3 cats‚Äô kibble, but is CHEAP, CHEAP, CHEAP ‚Äì 2.5 stars text: I ordered this for my three cats and when I first opened the box my reaction was "You've got to be kidding me!" This looked like the size of a hamster bowl. However, it does fit two cups of my cats' kibble if I fill it to the tippy top.

The stainless steel bowl is so thin and light that I almost feel like I can bend it with my hands. The plastic base is super cheap as well with only rubberized feet in the four corners that prevents some slippage.

The bowl can be seated in two positions; either flush with the base or titled at a 15 degree angle. Just insert the base end into the track at the appropriate angle and twist clockwise to lock in place and counter clockwise to remove.

The base will move around on the floor with an energetic pet as those rubberized feet do almost nothing to keep this in place.

I like the design (bowl tilted in a track), but the execution is SUPER CHEAP. I doubt it costs more than $2 to make this. The current price of $15.99 is outrageous. Yes it is functional, but for that price I expect a larger bowl with more heft and not so thin. This gets 2.5 stars from me rounded up to 3 stars.

title: Limited Ingredient Diets blend is the grain-free diet text: MADE IN THE USA The final report comes from our 15 year old, ten pound, miniature fox terrier - she loves it. . If my money can go to something made in the USA and my dog scarfs it down you know I will pay a couple extra dollars.

Good news - In an email I received from Natural Balance Pet Foods (in response to my question), "Please know that all of the plants which manufacture the Natural Balance Dry, Canned, Treats, Rolls, Pouches are located in the United States: California, Arizona, Utah, South Carolina, Kansas, Nebraska, Missouri, Georgia, Pennsylvania, and Colorado. Please also know that Natural Balance tests every lot of our products for nine potential contaminants that have been implicated in pet food recalls in the past. In a Test and Hold Program, our products are held in the warehouse and not available for sale until all the tests for those products come back with a passing result. We enter the results on our website so that you can view the results for your product. Go to the NBPF and follow the instructions about entering product name and date code to view the testing report for you product. Also please review the video on that page that describes our lab and testing."

title: 3,5 stars, use enough to cover the source of the odor text: "Try POOPH for 30 days and if you aren‚Äôt happy, simply return it for a 100% no-hassle refund."

OK, now That's reassuring! I saw one review that said this stuff is a scam. I wish they would have elaborated. I personally think this is worth the try, and I think they may not have used it correctly? who knows. All I can do is share my thoughts. I will explain my situation, and then maybe that will help you decide. But first, I am/was really excited to try this. I had planned on it before the opportunity to try it out came up. I see the commercials on tv (they include it as a video here), and have been curious about the brand. I also like the name, Pooph! My MAIN draw to it is that it is safe for use around animals. Does me no good if the product isnt 100% safe around my sweet babies.

My household has 2 large dogs, and 3 cats. We have a 2 story house, and I abide by the "1 litter box per cat" guideline of cat ownership (er, being owned by cats--get it right! lol). I go a step further, and have 2 boxes out in my sunroom, 1 box in my office, 1 box in a mid way point of the house, then 2 boxes side by side upstairs in a room with a dog gate with cat door. The combo of different cat personalities and ages, makes me want to make sure that they are all comfortable with where they do their business. This keeps me busy!

I use clumping, scoopable cat litter. I find this works best in controlling odor by far over regular clay. I can just grab a dog poop bag and go around sifting litter every day. Not too stinky, but hey-- indoor bathroom creates a little odor, right? No biggie.

UNTIL is is 100000 degrees out with full humidity, NO air conditioning, and any left over bits of urine or poops get a strong baked aroma emanating through the house (really just the boxes in the sunroom, omg). I can only clean it out so much, right? But a lot of sprays just mask. Baking soda isnt going to cut it. I really didnt even think this POOPH would help..

BUT IT DOES.
BOOM!
NOT A SCAM. yeesh

This is meant for litter box use, and so I have relegated it just for litter box use. I spray the box, and all around, and I lightly spray the litter too. I was reticent to try that on clumping litter because that kind clumps wetness, right? But, "POOPH Kitty Litter Deodorizer instantly dismantles odors on contact and can be used on any type of litter" ie, it is designed not to clump. YAY! No problems using a light sweeping spray. I noticed IMPROVEMENT. I dont work too hard at it. THOUGH, my first time with it, I initially noticed a burst of worst (worse, but gotta rhyme). It was like it all got more concentrated smelling. But then it went away. Maybe this stuff exorcises the demons from the odor source before disappearing? haha.

I feel like I am still in the learning curve of what this product can do. "As long as Pooph can reach the source of the odor and there‚Äôs as much Pooph as there is stink, Pooph will get it and dismantle the odor". THAT is what I need to focus on-- spraying the source of the ORGANIC odor, and being sure to use enough.

early impression rating of 3.5-4 stars. AS I use is more, and put it through its paces, I will likely come back to update. I am hoping to give their Pet Odor and Stain remover a whirl, and their laundry additive. With a furry household, can use all all the help I can get--safely, of course.

I recommend giving it a try--follow directions, read through all the info on the this page.

And if you want a sure fire way to see if it works or not, rub a cloth on your stinky dog or cat, and then give it a really good spray down. Something akin to what is shown in the video where he puts a stink on a card and has everyone smell it, then uses Pooph on it, and has them smell it again. OOH, I am going to do that with the litter box, and I will report back my findings. Sometimes a true before and after helps

title: Long Lasting Treats text: I have two dogs and both are aggressive chewers. They love to exercise their jaw muscles but the problem with most dog treats is that they don‚Äôt last long at all. But there are some dog treats that outlast others, and I have found a long-lasting option with this, Best Bully Sticks Peanut Butter Stuffed Cow Hooves.

Stuffed with dried peanut butter, my dogs took an immediate liking to these chews. They adore peanut butter- what dog doesn‚Äôt?- and they loved eating out the filling. But they didn‚Äôt walk away once the peanut butter was gone. They continued to chew, and chew, and chew. More than an hour later, they were still preoccupied! It‚Äôs rare to find any dog treat with staying power like that.

Once the filling is consumed, you can fill the hooves with something else and give it back to your dog for additional enjoyment. I didn‚Äôt really need to, as my dogs took such an immediate liking to these hooves. I‚Äôm not sure if they loved the peanut butter more or the chewing more. Whatever the reason, it kept them busy and happy for a long time.

Because these treats are so chewy, they are good for cleaning a dog‚Äôs teeth, since they help scrape away tartar. They are safer than rawhide, too. My only slight issue is that there are only four per pack, but you know what? They are so long lasting, I don‚Äôt mind the limited quantity. Buy them if you have dogs that can‚Äôt get enough chewing action. They will love you for this!

title: easy level snuffle mat, just add treats or kibble and present to dog, cat. text: If you have a dog (or cat), then snuffle mats are fun, interesting way to allow a dog to do some nose work. It can be enriching to allow them to sniff through a bunch of material to find some treats or kibble. I make my own snuffle mats using cut up fleece (of various lengths) tied to dish mats or other similarly styled mats. Last one I made was 4 years ago. It was fun to make them, but they take time, effort, money, super sharp scissors, & patience. I didnt exactly need another snuffle mat, but I figured this size and style may be of interest to my cats, so I figured I would try it out. They seem amused by it.

The style reminds me of a bath mat. It is the same sort of material, but a little longer material. The material isnt as long and interesting as the snuffle mats I make (or see for sale), but this is a nice option for dogs that havent tried something like this before, or may not want to work too hard, or maybe for tiny dog with tiny kibble. Totally cool for cats too. They can snuffle around for some treats, maybe even use it to sprinkle some cat nip. They'll likely take a nap on it too.

For doggos who havent use this before, be sure to use an interesting food item. Tuck it down into the the material. Also sprinkle some on top so they know what to do. Keep eye on them so they dont start biting, tearing, destroying the material to get to the buried kibble.

It's a good size, so really any sized dog can use it. It just needs enough space to sprinkle, hide some treats or kibble. This works fine.

There are suction cups; I havent felt compelled to use them.. but I like that they are included.

For whatever reason, the material can be taken off as there is a zipper. There is a thin frame of foam tube which I assume would need to come out. Personally, I will be keeping it all together and tossing in wash as is, as needed. As with my other mats, I just wash on cool or cold, and use minimal laundry soap. Could be lightly hand washed, wiped too.

As with any toy, puzzle, or other item.. keep eye on your pet, especially if they are the type to want to destroy something. They should be guided into how to use this.

4 stars. So far so good.. I just want them all to have more time with it so I can determine durability. will be back to update if I learn anything more.

title: SO Soft and Well Made
text: Our cat, Squeaky, used to jump on top of a kitchen cabinet where a heating vent was located and lay there for hours every single day during the winter.  He LOVES being next to the heating vent. We put a blanket up there for him to lay on.  We turned the heat on in the house a few weeks ago when the weather got cold. Squeaky no longer makes the jump to the top of that cabinet.  He's found a new favorite spot-laying on the bottom shelf of a night table in the bedroom which is right aside of a heating vent.  I was going to place a blanket for him there but instead, I ordered him the Katoggy plush donut bed.  It fits perfectly on the table shelf. For the first week or so, he had no interest in it. (Neither did our dog Mac or our other cat, Miss Piggy) I actually went as far as to ask a neighbor if she wanted the bed for her dog, but she didn't. I was thinking about taking it to the local Animal Rescue League when Squeaky suddenly decided he WAS interested in the bed! lol.  Now, he loves it.  Its a great bed. SO soft , plush and fluffy.  I know he's nice and warm curled up inside of it.  The bottom of the bed has a non-slip surface so the bed doesn't move around on the shelf when he gets in and out of it, it stays in place. The bed is made well. I've not had any issues with tearing , holes or material falling off.  It is machine washable. I've not yet washed it in the machine but I did wash it by hand and allowed it to air dry (it can go in the dryer as well-low heat)  per the instructions so it stays soft and fluffy.  I love this bed and more importantly, so does Squeaky! Makes an excellent gift for pets and pet owners!

title: Very well made, strong and warm. Has two small zippered pockets for treats text: We don't get really cold weather for more than a few weeks here in East Texas and we might see two inches of snow for 36 hours. A dog coat is rarely needed at home, but we do travel with a few dogs and run into ugly winter habitats now and then. Our fat Beagle mis gets a pretty thick coat, but she's still a short hair dog and at the ranch in the Chinati Mountains of deep West Texas she gets cold.

This coat is really well made and will definitely keep Pudge comfortable in high winds on the trails at the top of the mesas. It covers her chest, the underbelly and has an adjustable collar. The coat attaches with one leg hole and a zipper on both sides of the rib cage. In an emergency, you should be able to remove this without a huge problem.

The interior is lined with soft, warm fabric and the top is a thick, water resistant material. Sort of like a puffy jacket that can be removed if it's not cold enough for both layers. The tail piece covers the back hips and base of the tail. There are two zippered pockets that hold poo bags and dog treats or your car keys if you're so inclined. Pudge took offense to being used as a pack mule, so her coat pockets will remain reserved for cookies only. She seems to like this coat and was able to roll in it without it getting twisty or having to redo it.

title: durable container, prepping item for dogs & cats (<--but will need sep taurine supplement) text: Bought this as part of prepping. I have vitamins that I give my labs already, and I dont usually give vitamins to my cats, but I always keep a container of vitamin powder on hand that can be used for any of them in case the food situation is bad. I buy 1-2 containers per year, then resupply as needed. We were fine during the beginning of the pandemic in 2020, but the issues with products and transport has made an impact in the pet food availability, especially cat food. We've been making due, but it is just a reminder that things can go south real quick, and I want to make sure my babies have provisions. They have plenty of food, but if there comes a time when I have to put together people food scraps for them, I want to make sure they are getting their vitamins and minerals. This does NOT contain taurine, so if you are at all using this in the manner I am, then if you have cats you will want to make sure they have a taurine source. Very important.

While I normally wouldn't bother opening this given the reason why I buy it, I have been considering replacing their current vitamin (very very pricy) with something more reasonable. So I opened this up, and sprinkled it on their food. So far so good.

BTW, if you are reading reviews, I recommend sorting them by "most recent" as it appears that earlier reviews are down rating based on the inclusion of garlic. This page now offers both a supplement with garlic, and one without.

title: Quality All- Around Dog Food text: Our dog eats only the finest dog foods. We are particular about what goes into his dish and insist the food is made from quality ingredients. Blue Earth‚Äôs Essentials Dry Dog Food passes the quality test, with chicken, lamb, or salmon as the main ingredient, for a good dose of protein.

With this dog food, your adult dog can be assured of meeting nutritional needs. The food is comprised of small kibbles also, which is good for smaller breeds. My dog is medium in size and devours the kibbles with no problem. He seems to like the taste, but to encourage him, I will often top this dry dog food with an equally high quality wet food. He doesn‚Äôt seem thrilled with the taste, but he will eventually eat and that is what matters.

About the only small issue dog owners may have with this dog food is that the lamb version does include barley. Grain- free dog food is ultimately best, as grains have no useful place in a dog‚Äôs diet. But a little bit of barley should be fine. The added vegetables like sweet potatoes, carrots, and potatoes should also suit your pet‚Äôs body well.

Blue Earth‚Äôs Essentials Dry Dog Food is not cheap, and this fact may discourage some people from buying. But this is a very good dog food all- around and it has more than enough positive qualities to recommend.

title: Cat is happy, and that matters a lot text: This is the first time I have tried a hooded litter box, and I am moderately to very happy with this one. We have one cat, a very large feral rescue who wants to be a Maine Coon cat, and my one fear was that she would not adapt to the box and would have accidents all over the house. (She is definitely a creature of habit.) Well, I needn't have worried: she adapted immediately with no problem at all. So my main concern was satisfied.

Now, as to the box itself. The plastic is very thin, and the box seems inexpensively made. You attach the lid on both sides with a latch, which is difficult to attach (but easy to detach). I simply place the lid on the box in a corner and hope it doesn't fall off. The swinging door "catches" occasionally, but this does not seem to bother the cat, so it doesn't bother me. The cat simply muscles her way through the door. I use liners for the box itself, so clean up is easy. And my major previous problem, litter all over the floor surrounding the box, is greatly diminished (but not completely eliminated).

I have no idea how much this cat box costs, but if it is reasonably priced, I can recommend it, if you keep the points above in mind and can live with them.

title: You can do without it.
text: A couple of problems for those just starting out keeping an aquarium.  First, there is no included color chart to compare the test strip with, so you have no idea of what your Ammonia level is after the test... you just have a blue spot on the test strip, which doesn't tell you a thing.  Secondly, most treatments for ammonia work by converting the ammonia into a non-dangerous version of the same chemical... which means that the test strip will STILL show positive for ammonia, even though it isn't dangerous after treatment.  So, what's the point?

title: Two senior citizen dogs absolutely love this flamingo for tug text: My pack of 6 dogs tend to share toys well and have varying opinions as to which toys are awesome or not worth messing with. Three of them have decided this flamingo is no fun because it doesn't squeak when bitten. Dog four ignores it because it doesn't really bounce when he tosses it around. But Nora and Pudge are absolutely delighted with this!

These are my senior girls at 14 and almost 15 years old and they have been romping around with the flamingo and playing tug with the stretchy legs and shaking the beejeesus out of it to get it to squawk. It makes me immensely happy to see them having so much fun together with a toy. For the right dog, this thing is a terrific toy.

title: flat bits of tender food in gravy, easy to open pouch, liked by my 2 cats text: My picky 18 years old ancient fella likes this food. He enjoys the bits of food almost as much as he likes the juicy gravy. He seems to tolerate it well- he has some digestive issues. My 8 year old boy likes it too. He was never into wet food, but recently he has taken to taking laps at the wet food plate. They are both indoor kitties (save for occasional trips out on a harness to walk the yard, eat grass, hork up grass).

Food comes in a sturdy, easy to tear off pouch. Food slides out easily, with little left behind. I do add a little warm water and scrape the sides to get all the juices- then I add it to the food. Almost like extra extra gravy.
62 calories per pouch

Ingredients
Water sufficient for processing, chicken by-products, chicken by-product meal, pork liver, corn flour, pork digest, pork plasma, powdered cellulose, natural flavors, fish oil, calcium sulfate, sodium silico aluminate, potassium chloride, taurine, carrageenan, vitamins [cholecalciferol (source of vitamin D3), DL-alpha tocopherol acetate (source of vitamin E), thiamine mononitrate (vitamin B1), ascorbic acid, niacin supplement, riboflavin supplement, D-calcium pantothenate, pyridoxine hydrochloride (vitamin B6), folic acid, biotin, vitamin B12 supplement], choline chloride, caramel, marigold extract (Tagetes erecta L.), glucosamine hydrochloride, sodium tripolyphosphate, L-carnitine, trace minerals [zinc sulfate, ferrous sulfate, copper sulfate, zinc proteinate, manganese sulfate, copper proteinate, calcium iodate, manganese proteinate], chondroitin sulfate.

Guaranteed Analysis
Crude Protein (min.) 8.9%, Crude Fat (min.) 1.9%, Crude Fiber (max.) 1.8%, Moisture (max.) 82.7%, Eicosapentaenoic + Docosahexaenoic acid (EPA + DHA) (min.) 0.05%, Phosphorus (max.) 0.24%, Vitamin E (min.) 64 IU/kg, Ascorbic acid* (min.) 30 mg/kg, Glucosamine* (min.) 88 mg/kg, Chondroitin sulfate* (min.) 10 mg/kg. *Not recognized as an essential nutrient by the AAFCO Cat Food Nutrient Profiles.

Directions
We recommend at least a 7 day transition before you begin feeding the new food exclusively. Start by mixing 75% of the old diet with 25% of the new diet on Day 1 and Day 2. On Day 3 and Day 4, mix 50% of the old diet with 50% of the new diet. On Day 5 and Day 6, mix 25% of the old diet with 75% of the new diet. On the 7th day, you can feed the new food exclusively. This allows your pet‚Äôs digestive system to smoothly adapt to the new food.

title: Fit is pretty decent, good protection for thorns text: My stallion is sound as a brick house, but I do like to add some additional support if we're moving cattle in bad country. The cactus and mesquite thorns are a serious problem out here in the border country of West Texas. A 4 inch thorn in a foreleg can be a bad problem quickly. I use boots to stop that and to give additional leg support on shale, steep arroyos and stone trails on mountainsides.

These fit pretty well and stay on even after 18 miles of the conditions explained above. None of the boots slipped or had loose velcro. Two of them had nasty chollo pieces stuck in them and not in my horse's legs. Plus the red is striking against my grey horse.

title: Sorry -- none of us like it ... text: I hate to give this product a low star rating because I've always liked Tidy Cats. But this lightweight litter needs some serious rework before I'd be willing to purchase it.

First, the positives:
-- it's lightweight. Seriously. I'm older with osteoarthritis, and I've had issues in the past with overweight cat stuff (litter, bags of food, etc.). This isn't a problem.
-- the scent is pleasant, maybe a bit overpowering, but not *too* bad.
-- it clumps OK. Not the best I've seen, but not the worst, either.

Now the not-so-good:
-- it's VERY dusty. I have respiratory issues (asthma and COPD), so I have to be VERY careful with stuff like this. My cats also don't need to be breathing the dust, either. The dust is at an unacceptable level, far worse than other brands. This is almost a deal-breaker for me.
-- the odor control is not great. I've had unscented litters that control odor better than this. I scoop the box 2-3 times a day, and it still got really nasty between scooping.
-- the litter sticks to my cats' feet, so they end up tracking it all over the house. I have a large "astroturf"-like mat under the box that extends 2 feet in all directions, and the litter still shows up all over the house.

There are much better choices out there, some cheaper, a few more expensive. I would be unwilling to pay the premium price for this product in its current form. Sorry, Tidy Cats.

title: Very satisfied with this harness
text: I like this no-pull harness very much.  I was afraid at first that it would be too large for our 22-pound dog, the harness turned out to fit her very well.  She is a wire haired terrier/beagle mix, so by nature she is very stubborn and determined.  And I am one who just hates to see a dog straining and pulling on a collar and leash.  So this harness looked like an ideal solution, and it was.  It was very easy to adjust and to get onto the dog, and she does not seem to mind it at all.  And there is less chance of my being thrown off balance by her when she sees a fascinating mole or just has to sniff yet another tree trunk.  I recommend this harness despite the fact that it is a little pricey.  Your dog will thank you.

title: Bags are typical size and strong but are a hard to unravel and open text: These are exactly like the dog poop bags almost every dog owner carries on a leash. There are 8 rolls of 15 bags each for a total of 120 bags.

The bags fit easily into a typical poop bag dispenser. These are easy to tear off but are hard to unravel and difficult to open. They hold enough. I was able to scoop two litter pans for three cats worth of debris and some food debris as well and the bag held both the waste, food, and litter without leaks or holes. These are strong for being biodegradable. However, since they are biodegradable, there's usually a 2-year shelf life for bags like these but there is nothing saying so on the package.

These are supposed to be lemon flavored but they smell like oily potato chips when I hold them close to my nose. The scent is utterly useless.

I also dislike the Amazon photo which leads the user to believe they are getting more than one box. All eight rolls come in only one box.

The current price of $11.04 ($12.99 minus 15%) is $.09 cents per bag which is expensive but the typical price.

title: Definitely helping with dry, itchy summer skin on a draft horse text: We have a Percheron draft horse with a tendency towards extremely dry, flakey skin in summer. She's deep black, but her poor face and head turn grey and she can end up with bald spots from rubbing if we aren't on top of it. I've used ointments, creams, lotions, hair conditioner and sunscreen over the years to help keep her comfortable.

This time I'm using this Vetricyn Skin care spray twice a day. I spray it on a paper towel and rub it in around her eyes and ears so it won't drip. I just spray it around her cheeks, neck and tail base. It's been three days and this morning I realized that she wasn't rubbing her face on the fence. She still has the dry spots, but they aren't enlarging and she's not looking or acting itchy. I'm willing to use this daily until winter if it makes her comfortable again. I am adding a bit of sunscreen around her muzzle and eyes after the Vetricyn dries because I do not want her sunburned.

title: Sturdy harness but IMPOSSIBLE to adjust; the small barely fits my 9-pound cat text: This is a sturdy and well-made harness. Unfortunately, I find it IMPOSSIBLE to adjust. I was not able to adjust¬†the neck area at all. It took me about 15 minutes to loosen the straps in the waist area. As a result of being unable to adjust the neck, I had to force this on my cat (pictured) but I could tell it was not comfortable because the neck area needed to be looser to match with the waist. In fact, I originally put this on him wrong the first time. I then changed the position so that the D ring faced front, but the fit was no different (see photo).

If the adjustments were easy, I would have rated this 5 stars. It has a sturdy D ring in the middle of the chest and a clasp for either side of the waist area. It just slides over the neck and gets fastened around the waist.¬† The handle is supposed to be on top and the D ring is supposed to be in the chest area. A leash can be attached to both the front D ring and the smaller one on the back.

As a result of the difficulty with this harness, I cannot use it. A size small is also smaller than I expected. The current price of $19.99 is reasonable for this if it adjusted easily.

title: This is okay, but releases too much food text: This looked adorable. Like most feline "moms", I buy a lot of treats and toys for our furbabies.

We tried two different sizes of treats in this ball.
The way it rolls down the middle helix is interesting, and makes a little noise.
The cats enjoyed that.

BUT... it is weird to fill, and you cannot adjust the size of the opening where the treats come out.
That means you get what you get, and you cannot tighten it up at all, to make it a little more challenging.

Our boys played with it until they had eaten every last piece in it, then threw up!
They have no self-control, sort of like me around chocolate.

So, this is okay, as long as you don't put a lot of food/treats into it at the same time.
Overall, it wasn't worth buying, and it is just so-so. Results may vary by cat. Nice looking, but function leaves a lot to be desired.

title: Excellent nail grinder
text: Love this thing. I have used a dremel and bought some of those nail grinders for dogs that are weak and totally useless. Dremels are the best really if you get the 2 speed to use the slow speed on the dog until now. This is the bomb. Grinds the nail in seconds so watch out!! So quiet the dogs are even amazed!! No dremel battery to pop out and recharge and possibly misplace like I always did. If you want your fur kid to have great looking toenails without the hassle then here is the answer.

title: Great Product! text: This crate cover was a life saver for two different reasons. Firstly I had a dog that would only go in their crate if it was covered. I used blankets to cover it previously but the dog would pull them through and chew them overnight. Then I found this cover! Dog was happy going into the crate as it was covered and also they could not pull it through and chew. Win, win situation!

Second cover I used for a dog that I used to look after for a friend and the dog would spray pee out through the side of the crate. I used this cover thinking that at least if he did do that with the cover on then it wouldn't be spraying the wall as the cover would stop it. Well the cover did stop it when the dog sprayed in the crate but what me and my friend were most astonished by was that he never tried it again after the pee splashed back off the cover the one time he tried it. Subsequently he has never tried it again! Again a win, win situation.
