title: It's that good! text: Who knew this could be so helpful in so many ways??? This bowl has resolved many food issues in our multi-pet home!! It has taken meal time from about 1.5 mins up to 10 mins for one dog, and more for the other. It has ended food aggression issues in our house. And best of all - my dogs are enjoying a meal and seeming completely satisfied after.
Steve is a senior husky shepherd mix, Reece is a young boxer pitty mix - and food was turning into a thing... When Steve was an only he ate slowly, a little at a time, throughout the day. I was able to keep kibble out around the clock. Since Reece came to live with us, he started eating when the food was put out - and at first she did too. The she decided to save her food and growl if he tried to eat it. It was getting weirder and uglier and Steve was starting to eat crazy fast and never seem satisfied. I bought each dog a large teal fun feeder bowl and mealtime is now a calm and happy part of our mornings and evenings again!!

text: I bought this at a really good price, and I actually thought it was cat food. That's OK because I have both cat sand a dog, all about the same size. They both eat it and absolutely love it. My cat who's not much of a talker will not hush unless I feed her some of this. She's mostly an outside cat but is welcome to come in at any time. When she does, she's under foot crying for this food until I split a package with her and my dog. My dog is a chunky Yorkie who's very jealous of the cats. I'm splitting the food and my Yorkie thinks it's contest on who can gobble it up the fastest. The second cat is laid back and eats it, but he's not a fighter, so he waits for his portion quietly. Regardless, they love it and now I'm stuck buying expensive dog/cat food because, you know, got to spoil the babies.  LOL. I might add that it has not caused any stomach upset for any of them and Mr. easygoing is prone to gas. That seems better since adding this. I do use it as a treat and not their main food source. title: Works exceptionally well on my carpet with a fresh stain; less so with a 1 hr. old stain text: This Bissell cleaner is the exact same as [[ASIN:B07S5GNTCD this one]] and I did not realize that until I tested both and compared the bottles.

I have three cats and I periodically come home to vomit and scoot marks on my carpet. Typically it is vomit and that leaves behind a yellow stain on my sand-colored carpet.

What I noticed is that if I clean up the vomit immediately and then spray this on the stain, the stain disappears after about two applications. This worked exceptionally well and fast on that stain. However, when I did not realize my cat threw up until about one hour later making the stain about one hour old, then this did not work as well as on the fresh stain. I attached three photos of the results for the one-hour stain. The first one shows the stain without any application. The second photo shows it with one application and the third is with the second application. It lightened the stain but did not eliminate it entirely. Nevertheless, this is as good as other stain removers I tried before, so I cannot expect to eliminate the stain completely if the stain sits.

My only complaints are that it is hard to see the lettering on the spout for spray or stream and there is some leakage when dispensing this product. I personally do not like the solution getting all over my hands. Other than this, this is a five-star cleaner, stain remover, and odor eliminator for fresh stains and four-stars for older stains.

title: Chicken and Apples Drive my Dogs Wild text: What dog doesn‚Äôt love a piece of jerky? It contains meat, and that means jerky is bound to drive dogs wild. But what if apples and other flavors are added to the ingredient list? It‚Äôs a combination I was willing to test so I went ahead and got my dogs Ollie Chicken and Apple Recipe Jerky Dog Treats.

Flat and semi- chewy, these jerky treats are made with chicken and apples, as expected, but they also have other added ingredients, among them oats, celery powder, sea salt, and coconut. These are not necessarily things I wanted to see, but there are no artificial ingredients, and the list is still far shorter than the ingredient list on other dog treats. So far, so good.

My dogs love chicken like any dog and they also eat apples on occasion. But would they like them in the same treat? After going through the first package quickly, I can enthusiastically say yes, they do! They love the meaty flavor and other tastes in these treats. They drool and inhale them in a short time, so they easily pass their taste test.

Another thing I like about these treats is that they are sold in three packs. This means they are made to last quite a while. There are about eight sticks per bag. I have two dogs and use these sparingly, giving each dog just one jerky treat every few days. That ensures the trio of treat bags will still be around for several weeks.

Chicken and apples are not something I thought I would find in a dog treat. But they have turned out to be two things that go together quite well. My dogs love Ollie Chicken and Apple Recipe Jerky Dog Treats and both dogs give them four paws up!.

title: Works great, our cats love the taste text: Cats groom all the time. That means they eat a lot of hair...theirs, yours, other cats, etc. All that hair has a hard time passing through without some assistance. That's where this product comes in.

This "greases" the digestive tract, giving hair buildup the help it needs to pass on out through the feces. If hair is not passing through, you'll know it in the form of hairballs or hair tubes left in inconvenient places, because hair does not digest on its own.

If your cat throws up a lot, or seems to always want to eat, first check for worms. If s/he is worm-free, suspect hair build-up in their tummies. It takes up the room where food belongs, so when they eat, they can't hold much before it comes back up. They need your help.

One of our cats will eat this right from the tube, and would eat it all if we didn't cut him off. The other is unimpressed, so we rub an amount a little bigger than a pencil eraser into his front paws for him to lick off.

Catlax truly helps keep hair on the move. We all love it!

title: Makes Dogs Happy text: Dog treats are a regular part of life for my two dogs. They get treats for good behavior, and they get treats for, well, just because they are our dogs and we like seeing them happy. I try to keep an assortment of treats available at all times and I was more than ready to try these dog treats, from PAWUP.

Packaged in a clear canister, these treats are easy to grab from the container, which is easy to reseal thanks to the screw on cap. There are different flavor options and the one I got is the one for puppies. These treats are tied into knots, which I like because it provides dogs with something to grip.

With the ingredients, the treats are grain- free which is good. The other ingredients are a little different from that of other dog treats. The puppy chews contain cranberries, chia seeds, and other non- traditional ingredients. Some of the flavor options have chicken, so if your dog is a meat lover, you might want to stick with those. The puppy chews also have added taurine, which is good for a dog‚Äôs brain development.

The treats I got don‚Äôt have meat, but my two dogs love them regardless. Their mouths water and their tails wag when they get these treats. They have a good deal of quality and I like the easy- to- seal canister. Overall, these are good dog treats, and they are recommended to anyone who likes to pamper their pet while maintaining good health.

title: Better than Drinkwell...cheaper too! text: Definitely seems like a superior design to the Drinkwell fountain I used to have. I've only had it running for a couple weeks, so I can't speak to the longevity. However, I think having a fountain where the dogs drink at the TOP of where the water is pumped is FAR superior to one where they drink at the BOTTOM after the water has flowed down, as in the Drinkwell design.

The main advantages of this design are that the dogs aren't drinking water from where there is likely debris in it, and that this design is much easier to clean. Dogs are messy animals. No matter how much you try to keep the area around the water bowl clean, it seems like they would get nasty bits of who knows what in the drinkwell fountain, and they'd be drinking from the same area! Yes, I know that dogs don't have the same 'ick' factor we humans do, and that most of the particles that ended up in the 'pool' at the bottom were likely benign. But you'd have to be ultra vigilant, deep cleaning that fountain probably every other day to have it looking like truly clean water that your dogs are drinking. With this design, which I didn't even know existed until recently, any particles, backwash, whatever you want to call it that was ending up in the fountain, will at least flow to the bottom where the dogs aren't drinking directly from it.

They seem just as happy to drink from this fountain as they did the drinkwell. There are much fewer crevices which makes it a snap to clean. As an added benefit, it seems like they end up splashing less water on the floor with this one, too!

I have read some reviews claiming that the pump tends to die a premature death on this one...I can't speak to that yet. If that's the case, I still will stand by my opinion at least the design is far superior even if the quality of the materials may not be....I would probably just see if I can locate a higher quality, third party pump if this one burns out before it should. I've already thrown away the Drinkwell fountain...no intention of ever going back.

title: good wipes for regular basic cleaning text: We use a drying ear solution a couple times a week to help clear out, dry out ears, then we use ear wipes like these in between. Please use a combo of products if your dog tends to have dirty, moist, troubled ears.

Nice pot of ear wipes; large enough and damp enough to work with. Really does nice job grabbing excess gunk. I am using these for a quick clean on my labs perpetually dirty ears. When his ears get itchy, he gets our attention and glances at a tissue box. Since dry tissues aren't always enough, we pepper in use of wet ear cleaning pads. Furthermore, we use an ear cleaner that helps dry out the ears at a deeper level. We have been using [[ASIN:B008158XP0 EpiKlean Ear Cleaner]] that we get from our vet (or more recently ordered here). Our boy gets mild ear infections 1-2x times a year, so after a course of prescription ear drops, we keep up on the ears with the drying flush and other regular cleaning. Keeping up with the flush and cleaning makes all the difference.

So use these wipes, but as they state, "Best When Used with [[ASIN:B01N4NZNSN Curaseb Antiseptic Ear Flush]] (To Treat Active Ear Infection within Ear Canal) ‚Äì Wipes are Not Enough!"

title: Large, hard, durable ball- might be too large for fetch, but my big lab can grab it w/mouth ok text: [[VIDEOID:2e3578c3cefca47136474a88a8d05db]] Large (5.5" wide/17" around), hard ball with divots that help the dog to grab at it- not so much with teeth (unless they have a big strong mouth) but with nails or nose, also helps to make the ball roll sporadically. The noise is not constant. It it more likely to make noise when it hits certain spots. I like this, is not as obnoxious as it could be. No matter, the sound is super silly, I have heard it before in other toys. I may post a video, but their product video does a good job demonstrating the sound.

My two labs are mildly interested in this. It depends on if Mommy plays too. Then it is suddenly a favorite of my boy. We have had a lot of fun playing with it inside. I toss it, he chases. My girl then chases him, chasing the ball. He brings it back to me. I toss it again. Sometimes I add in some "hide and seek". So while he fetches the ball, I "hide". Makes my girl crazy playing this game. So she semi chases him, then turns around and quickly finds me, then he comes back with ball, finds both of us. Huge party reunion, then repeat. All the while the ball is occasionally making its super silly sound. Silly toy, silly labs. All of it makes me laugh. Great times :)

But for them to play with it on their own? Likely not. But who knows.. they have 1000 toys, and there are but a few favorites, then all the rest make an occasional appearance. Not sure where this will fit in yet. Definitely is a more interactive toy for all of us, rather than just one or the two. But it works, it is durable, it is fun for us.

Be sure to check the sizing and compare it to what your dog can handle, or prefer. It is a tad larger than what my labs are used to playing with. This is 5.5" wide, 17" in circumference. Hard plastic. We use it inside. I roll it rather than throw it because it is hard. My boy with his huge block head can pick this up, my smaller girl hasn't tried. Likely best for doggos who like to kick or nose balls around. While my boy can play fetch style game with this, I wouldn't think it would be the best choice for that style of play since there is no give to the material and overall it is large for a mouth. You know your dog best, and so it could work for you. It kinda does for us. Since my two babes like to "fight" over a toy, and this one is hard to engage that game.

I give it 5 stars because the ball is solid and seems quite durable. Nothing wrong with it, really comes down to play style and toy preference of your dog. We have had some fun times with it, so I am glad it works for us.

I don't have kids, but it made me think that this would be a perfectly fun toys for kids to play with. It is rather entertaining :)

title: adequate sized biodegradable bags for picking up dog poop, & cleaning out litter boxes text: Good size, no issues. I have 2 large labs, and 3 cats. While I use poop bags out on walks with my dogs, I also use poop bags for cleaning out the multiple cat litter boxes. We use scoopable litter, so I go around and clean out the boxes every day. I was using the plastic bags we got from grocery stores, but now that the stores dont use those any longer, I buy small bags to use. I find that the biodegradable poop bags are perfect for my needs. I can fill up the bag with heavy litter encrusted poop & pee balls, and these hold up.

These are just a wide tube bag, no handles. Good size for putting hand in to grab poop off the ground, and still be able to tie a knot. Larger than some I have had. I think it comes down to your preference.

I have not had any break as of yet, save for the initial bag off the roll. I tend to find the first bag--because of the sticker-- creates a weak spot. So, true to my experience with all brands, the first bag easily ripped where the sticker was. Next bag on roll, when pulled in all directions, did not rip. I could see the material stretch, but it did not rip (and I was trying). And for that, I think these are pretty good. If I experience anything else-- like more tearing, I will be back to update & revise.

The poop bag roll holder is pretty durable feeling. It comes with a small D-ring clip attached to it. I even like the box all the bags come in. Kinda cute retail looking box.

title: Dogs liked it, We wish it was grain free text: Our foster pups loved this food and our older dogs loved them as treats, but we are firm believers in grain free feeding, at least on main foods. The food went a long ways and the two pups we were fostering didn't even put a dent into a 30 pound bag, so we have treats for the older dogs for a long time to come.

It is interesting that the bag reads like a bag for human food with all it's claims. I have never seen so many health claims on a pet food. But after reading the ingredients list I can see why they can make the claims. I like that much of the filler other than whole grains are missing in this food. At any rate the dogs seemed to like it with no bad effects.

title: Long Lasting Treats text: My dogs are spoiled when it comes to treats. They consume treats of one type or another every day and I like to mix up the quick serve treats with the longer lasting treats. A good example of the latter is these pig ear dog chews from Bullysticks and More.

These pig ears are single ingredient, so they earn high marks for purity. They don‚Äôt smell as bad as other dog treats, either. They are certainly not something you will want to smell but compared to some of the dog treats on the market, these are inoffensive.

The best feature of these pig ears is that they take time to chew. They are large in size- large enough to keep medium and smaller size dogs busy for a while. A larger, more aggressive chewer will be able to eliminate one of these chews in a matter of minutes. But that is still longer than other dog treats last. And if your dog isn‚Äôt as aggressive and likes to take his/her time with chews, then you can expect these to last a while.

My dogs love their treats and they adore pig ears. These pig ear treats might gross some people out, but remember that it is your dog that is eating them, not you. They are natural, long- lasting, and you get a large number per package. They make a good choice for anyone who wants a dog treat that cannot be consumed in a few seconds.

title: The best safety collar brand for your cat text: I will only buy Safe Cat cat collars, because they are the only ones that absolutely will break if your cat
gets caught on something. I see many other cat collars, especially "hand-crafted" ones, that use the same
black clips that are used for small dog collars. These are great for small dogs, which are much stronger than cats.
They are NOT safe for cats, because it would take amazing strength and pull to break one loose if a cat was caught.
They could easily fall victim to predators if they were ever caught outside on a bush or hedge. (Yes, people will
disagree with me on that, but I stand firm. I've tested them with my own hand strength, and know for a fact most cats
could not break the black rectangle/square clips.)

Safe Cat collars always use the round safety clips, which are made specifically for cats.
If you must let your cat go outdoors (not safe in the city), these are the ones you want.
We have two indoor cats, and still use these, in case they would ever slip out the door.
They have already "popped" the collars off inside the home, and we still have not found where they are getting hung up...
we think it might be somewhere behind the dryer. But imagine the horror if we pulled out the dryer and found our cat
had hung himself and couldn't break the collar!! *shudder*

We are happy with our purchase, and have ordered a couple extra collars. I am sure some day we'll find a pile of collars
somewhere, when we figure out what is catching their collar. I can guarantee it is someplace they are not supposed to be! ha!
But until then, Safety Cat collars are the ONLY ones for our family.

title: Wonderful glittery alternative to solid caps
text: I like them and 2 of my cats don't seem to mind them.  There is however an art to putting these on correctly.  You don't want to use too much or too little glue.  Too much will stick to the fur or the skin that hold the retracted claw.  Too little will be ripped off when climbing.  Both scenarios may cause discomfort.  If you've ever had fake nails, you know that ripping one off leaves a sensitive nail surface behind.  Regardless this is far better than mutilating a cat by declawing.  Trick is to get them on and knowing the right size and right amount of glue.  Have a vet tech help if you have doubts.  I trim the tips when the claw starts growing longer.  They still stay on and still prevent damage.

title: A Healthy Treat Your Dog Will LOVE! text: I wish that I could let my sweet boy Mac eat all of his favorite foods anytime he likes...he LOVES cheese, steak, chicken and hot dogs especially. But I CAN spoil him with some healthy treats that he obviously loves because he cries and barks for them as soon as he sees the bag!

Mac was thrilled to sample Wellness Core grain free puppy bites, beef and turkey recipe. The treats are small and VERY soft! I'm beyond thrilled over the list of ingredients which I will list for you: beef, turkey, chickpeas, ground potatoes, vegetable glycerin, carrots, salmon oil, apples, carrots and more with NO artificial flavors OR colors! I love that his treats contain healthy ingredients AND he loves them.

These treats are healthy and your dog will LOVE them. They're nice and soft as well and come in a variety of flavors. So far, Mac has tried the beef and turkey flavored treats.

title: No soy or corn - dogs really like a small amount mixed with our usual food text: I'm a fan of the Purina Beyond line of dog food because it's free of soy and corn. One of my dogs was itchy after eating this even in small amounts mixed with his regular food. He has a know, confirmed chicken allergy, so I suspect the poultry here just isn't for him. I just added a 1/4 cup of the Beyond to our regular grain and poultry free kibble for a week. None of the dogs had any digestive system upset or flatulence.

title: Thought It Was Silly At First...But Its Perfect For Our Dog! text: I admit to doing a double take when I first saw this...a power bar for dogs? Then I thought about it for a bit and the more I thought about it, the more I liked the idea. Our bichon Mac enjoys treats, goes for walks, loves to visit /stay with his grandparents (my parents) when we go away. All are perfect occasions for Mac to enjoy a PLATO energy bar.

Mac's favorite food is salmon. He LOVES it, so I was thrilled when I saw the salmon + carrot bar and that is what I ordered him. Salmon is the #1 ingredient and that is important to me. I want Mac to eat healthy. The remaining ingredients are limited and healthy as well. The bars are packaged well (and individually wrapped), nice and fresh. They're a good size and soft-ish....soft enough to easily break pieces off and Mac has no trouble chewing the pieces. I didn't think he liked it at first. I broke a piece off and gave it to him and he spit it out. Then he spent a minute or two nudging it around the floor with his nose. lolol. He gave it another try, picked it up, chewed it and LOVED it. Immediately stared me down for another piece!

This is not a complaint but I thought I'd mention it. The scent of the energy bar isn't pleasant. Wash your hands well after touching it.

Since I don't give him an entire bar at one time, I wrap some foil around the end (while keeping it in its original wrapper) and store it in a zipper sealed sandwich bag. Its been days since I first opened the bar and its still nice and fresh. These are perfect for 'on the go', traveling, a snack/reward, for an extra burst of energy. Seeing as salmon is the #1 ingredient, the bar contains minimal but healthy ingredients, they're convenient and Mac loves them, I find the price to be reasonable. I love to spoil my furbaby and I'm SO glad I can give him a healthy treat that he LOVES!

title: Not to my or my dog's liking
text: I wanted something to mix with my dog's dry food to make it a little more appetizing. Unfortunately, the "gravy" part of this is very thick and gummy, especially after spending a day in the fridge. The "meat" part is just too homogenous and artificial looking for my taste.  More importantly, my dog did not seem very thrilled at all with the gelatinous gravy. The price is VERY reasonable.  If you or your dog are not very picky about food and economy is your main concern, this might be a good food to mix with your dog's dry food. For me and my dog, it just wasn't right. Since then I've decided to make my own mix-in...when I go to the grocery store once a week I look and see what protein sources are on sale - chicken, turkey, liver, ground beef, canned salmon and then buy a pound or two of it. I keep a big bag of frozen peas in the freezer and I always have a couple of carrots in the veggie bin. On the weekend, I saute or boil the protein source, add in a few handfuls of peas and grate in one or two carrots and then I may even break an egg or two and let them cook into the mixture.  Any leftover rice or pasta that we have in the fridge gets thrown in.  When I feed my dog, I scoop out a cup of this mixture, pour some chicken or beef stock (maybe 1/4 cup) over it and microwave it for 30 seconds.  Then mix it in with his dry food. My dog is dancing at my feet for his supper now!  :)

title: Bombs Away when your dog tried to get the squirrels out text: Our dog is a medium sized Shephard mix and is hard on dog toys. First thing she goes for is the squeaker, then the stuffing. This large log had six squirrels in it so we figured it might last longer with her than a few days.

We had to show her there were squirrels in it after she tried chewing the stump. So she goes for the squirrels and shook the stump like a dog will when playing. One squirrel jettisoned from a hole and flew 15 feet over the Christmas tree. Another one went the opposite direction 10-feet and hit my 20-year-old grandson in the face. We couldn't stop laughing.

Now we plug the top with some of her older toys so she has to dig them out of the holes. A couple of squirrels have already been destuffed and de-squeaked, but she loves this toy. How long will it last and will we buy more squirrels? Don't know. But as long as the stump holds out we can stick any matter of toys inside it.

UPDATE; Day 3 and three squirrels totally dead. Some cardboard insert gone from stump.

title: for dogs 50+ lbs this is a 7.5 day supply if 1/4 tsp dose= 30 days, then 2tsp dose= 7.5 text: Rating based on quality (seems fine, seems reputable company, 4 stars), and some confusing lack of info for a pricy product (see headline/title as also mentioned below 2 stars).

I chose this because this seems like a quality brand. It is a brand that comes up all over the web when researching canine cancer. I'm sure soe pf us feel frantic and overwhelmed and may be making purchases we wouldnt otherwise.

I was looking to add supplements to my 7 years old labs diet who had been recently diagnosed with terminal lymphoma. I had already been a few weeks or so in with adding in extra vegetables, fruits, turkey tail mushroom supplement and another similar sort to her food. Then I wanted to incorporate something for times when she was not up for her regular bowl of kibble and whole foods. Sometimes all she wanted was pate. However, by time this arrived, I noticed that we were getting close to the end (we scheduled Lap of Love for a few days later). So I never opened this. I would have given this to her as I didnt see anything it it that concerned me, I just wanted to make sure she was getting a well supported diet. I was cleaning out her food and supplement area, and stumbled upon this having totally forgotten about it. I wont be using it on our other dog or cats. I know the cats wont eat it, and I doubt my ultra picky lab will, and the price for upkeep is astronomical for a 100 lb dog.

This is the part that they could do better with in terms of info transparency. Either include it on the bag or include it on the product page. I don't know how many servings are in a bag! "Can last up to 1 month for dogs or 4 months for cats---depending on daily dosage". Ok cool.. but which amount is this referring to? Also, they give nutrient info as "per 3 grams", and the bag in in grams (100 grams) but the serving is only in teaspoon. Now all dry ingredients weigh the same when packed into a "rounded teaspoon". So a teasppon can be anywhere from 3 grams to 8 grams depending on what it being scooped up.

So lets do some assumptions then. I assume they are referring to the small end of the size spectrum for how long this will last (Thirty, 1/4 tsp servings). SO if that is for "up to" 30 days at that amount, then the 2 tsp for large dogs (over 51 lbs) will last a week, and that is just based on if 1/4 tsp = 30 days, then 2 tsp (4 half tsp) will be 7.5 days. Nevermind the actual weight, etc, which could be closer to 10 days, but why do I need to buy this and use it up to figure it out? Just tell us! That's around 152.00 (plus tax) for a month supply for a dog over 50 lbs. Save a little w/ subscribe and save. For short term use.. I'll pay anything, but this is a bit much for a regular use. I dont rate on price, by the way. I figure we all can see the price and decide before purchase. We all have different needs, budgets, and situations. I was open to this for short term use, but as I stand now I have a totally unopened bag that I wont be using. Might call around to see if I can donate it.

Iodine information is on back of packet as well as can be seen in their product picture (sixth photo over, or second to last, lower right corner). The iodine is naturally occurring from Dulse, algae and kelp. As someone who has had hypothyroidism/hashimotos since childhood, I am well aware that iodine containing food is not good for the thyroid at all. I can eat foods containing it, but not on a regular basis, and certainly not as a supplement. Same holds true for animals. So be aware if you have pet with this condition. Even though it is listed as a caution on the package, I would like to see it listed more clearly on the product page.

Ingredients:
Spirulina and Chlorella Blue-Green Algae; Free-Range, Grass-fed Beef Liver; Barley Grass, Wheat Grass, Organic Wheat Grass Juice Powder; Lecithin; Alfalfa Juice Concentrate; Fructooligosaccharides (FOS); Brown Rice Protein; Dulse and Bladderwrack; Air-dried Parsley; Blueberry; Flaxseed; Beet Root; Natural Bacon Flavor; Carrot; Air-dried Broccoli; Air-dried Spinach; Turmeric; Beta-1-3-D Glucan; Amino Acids (L-Arginine, L-Histidine, L-Isoleucine, L-Leucine, L-Lysine, L-Methionine, L-Tryptophan and L-Valine); Probiotics (Bifidobacterium longum, Lactobacillus acidophilus, B. bifidum, L. rhamnosus); Vitamin D3; Digestive Enzymes (Lipase, Invertase, Protease, Amylase, Cellulase); Cayenne fruit.

title: Nice quick refresher for the beach going pooch
text: I need to start by stating I live in sunny Florida, a few miles from the beach. I take my dog regularly to the beach to run and play in the water and the sand. Typically, when she is done, I use the little shower device on the outskirts of the beach area to rinse her off. But I know she is not really clean and hours later I can still smell the beachy dog and end up giving her a bath. With these grooming wipes in hand, I run it over her after she has been rinsed and towel dried and I noticed an immediate improvement. The scent is lovely and it seems to stay with her. Although I will probably regularly have to wash her anyway, these wipes, in a pinch do the job to keep her fresh smelling. I keep them in my glove compartment. As someone else mentioned here, it would be nicer if they were a little larger. My dog is a 38 lb. midsized dog and I need to use at least 2-3 of these per use.

title: Sophie really likes this food; Sadie doesn't; ingredients are good; grain-free may be a problem text: I got this for my friend's dogs to supplement with their other food. Sophie really liked this food as can be seen from the photo. However, Sadie would not eat it.

Note that unless a dog has a grain allergy, it is not a good idea to feed them grain-free foods exclusively. The reason is that vets are finding an association between heart disease (such as canine dilated cardiomyopathy) and grain-free dog foods. However, it is mostly associated with the foods that have peas, lentils, other legumes or potatoes as their main ingredients. Note that I did not see any of the "bad" ingredients in this food; however, I personally would only supplement a dog's diet with grain-free since the science is new even though I really like the ingredients in this food.

This food's first ingredients are deboned turkey, egg, sweet potato, tapioca, turkey fat, natural turkey flavor, flaxseed, minerals, calcium carbonate, etc.

The current price of $19.99 for 4 pounds is competitive for this type of food.

title: This litter cabinet has been a game changer! text: I've wanted a litter cabinet for a while, but could not rationalize the cost. I live in a 1 bedroom apartment and the only places to put our multi-cat jumbo litterbox is in the living room or the bedroom. Essentially, while we're enjoying a quiet cuddle night and TV dining, our cats are pooping six feet away from us in our line of sight. It's not a very good arrangement.

I finally talked about the benefits of having a litter cabinet with my partner and we agreed to just do it. I will never regret having bought this item. First, we decided to use it as our TV console and it supports our 40 pound flat screen TV with ease (we put it towards the back because we did not install the center divider when assembling, so there was a bit of middle support missing which we were concerned about). The assembly wasn't the easiest, but it came together just fine. I would suggest it as a two person job, if possible, so one person can hold the heavy compressed boards for the other.

As I said above, we veto'd the central divider due to the size of our litterbox and have about 5" clearance between the entry and the edge of the box. I had also bought some corrugated cardboard kitty scratchy pad inserts off Amazon and broke off a portion to stick between the box edge and the entry/exit so help with further getting residual granules off their paws in exit, or if they try to cover their misdeeds by scratching on interior walls or floor, there's a scratchable surface for them, too.

We were concerned about the darkness in there at night and bought some battery charged stick-on motion detector lights off Amazon when we ordered this litter cabinet, and they work perfectly if centered on the entryway. Our cats have gotten used to the light coming on and they actually seem to appreciate the privacy while they powder their noses now. It is working out for us fantastically and we're just grateful to have found this affordable model. It really does just look like a TV console if you didn't know any better, so it fits in our room perfectly.

title: Pleqse get the urine OUT!

This time I ordered this product. I've sprayed it on and scrubbed. Then, allowed to dry, I sprayed it on topically. We shall see! I smell no odor from the urine or the product, which is gooood!

text: I like to add these little cups of canned food to my big dogs' regular high end dry kibble as a treat. These are expensive and way too small to feed as their actual meal (we have Rhodesian Ridgebacks and a Plott Hound), but as a flavor enhancement these are just right. The  Filet Mignon "flavor", the new york strip flavor and the pot roast version are all popular with my six dogs. There are pieces of meat and a thick gravy in each flavor - all mix easily with water and dry food. None of my dogs have had any digestive upset when we add these to their dinner - I give them the Cesar Fillets three times a week usually. (These are good for hiding pills in also) My one caveat is the inclusion of wheat in the ingredients, just be aware of it if you have a wheat allergic dog.

I use this sleeve for a light casual massage/brushing. I like that I can feel how much pressure i am using, and I think they prefer the feel over the brush. BUT for a more thorough clean, and to reach some areas, a brush may be better.

I want to try this on my cat, but there is no way any of them will let me stick my finger in. Although big, I think this would be easier to use for a quick brushing.

title: Helps continue extension gaits without stiffness. Palatable and easy to mix text: I've been feeding this to my 15 year old Andalusian stallion for about two weeks so far. He doesn't have any lameness or particular joint problems related to injury. However, he's been my go-to horses for everything from moving cattle in West Texas to Prix St George dressage and trail rides to parades for 12 years now. He's always ready to go, but I have noticed he was bit stiff ten days ago after spinning in circles as several mares sashayed past his paddock.

I'm just adding a single scoop once a day to his breakfast and he's eating it without drama. This is a thin, white powder like mix that sort of blends with the pellets and I don't think he's even noticed. He seems to feel great and is moving fluidly at all gaits including the extended trot and the Spanish Walk - both require extension of the knees and shoulders and hips, so stiffness will be immediately apparent.

title: Effective leg protection in cactus country text: I ride an Andalusian/Mustang stallion across really rough, hard country in deep West Texas. Rocks, mesquite, huge cactus, shale, sand and steep trails are the norm here. It's not for weak horses or people.

Protection for my stallion's feet and lower legs is critically important. The cholla thorns can be 4 inches long and pierce a foreleg in split second. We only use Cavello hoof boots and good sport boots on all four legs every time we ride and they catch all sorts of thorns.

These fit his front legs correctly, but are too short for his hinds. The velcro style attachments seem to be strong and well stitched. The boots didn't shift or slide on a 12 mile desert ride the other morning - no rub marks. They did catch some mesquite thorns and a prickly pear pad without letting the thorns reach the skin. My only issue is these seem to be hotter than our regular name brand sport boots - he had sweat under them and I don't usually see that.

title: Be wary of extremely sharp edges! text: I bought this for a 42g Crested Gecko - to use as a hide. This showed up literally 30 minutes ago and it looks awesome - it‚Äôs the perfect overall size however; as few others have mentioned there are some very sharp edges.
Especially on the inside of the resin which has a lip that hangs over practically every curve. They show a snake and a bearded dragon on the box cover; though I doubt anything larger than a 30g ‚Äúbaby‚Äù bearded dragon could fit through the back hole.
I also thought that the crack on the back of the skull would be larger. Of course the sharp angles and the cracked look of the skull gives a cool effect but it is very dangerous and I‚Äôm also not sure it‚Äôs big enough for a variety of species of lizards.
A part of me wanted to just simply return it because I know it‚Äôs going to take a fair amount of work before I can put it in my lil buddy‚Äôs home and feel comfortable enough that she won‚Äôt hurt herself.
I actually don‚Äôt know if my 42g crested gecko could fit through the whole as it is‚Ä¶ So I‚Äôm going to be taking quite a bit of time to use a Dremel and open up the back a bit and make sure that every single sharp angle and sharp lip are smooth before I put it in the terrarium. If there were no sharp edges I would have given this five stars but it‚Äôs getting a very generous 3 stars.
I am including photos that I have not otherwise seen that will hopefully help other potential buyers.

title: Sturdy harness for large dogs; mildly reflective text: The size large is too big for my friend's dog who is about 50 pounds. However, for the right-sized dog, this harness is a good choice, especially at the current price of $12.99.

It is padded in the front and back and has a sizable D ring for the leash. I do like that there is a handle on the back so that the dog can be held in place without a leash. However, I would have liked for the handle to be padded as the current cut of this handle can really hurt one's hands if the dog pulls.

The stitching is mildly reflective as are the silver "hems." There are snap closures on either side. My biggest complaint is that I found it almost impossible to adjust the straps. They are adjustable but it is very difficult to cinch them tighter. It took me about 10 minutes to do that.

For demo purposes, I put this harness on my plush stuffed life-sized Dalmatian as can be seen in the second and third photos.

Note that I rated this 4 stars only because of the difficulty with the strap adjustments and the lack of padding on the handle. Otherwise, this is a very sturdy harness for the right-sized dog.

title: My Border Collie loves it text: My Border Collie simply could not live without this toy - if it were up to him, we would play catch with it 24 hours a day. At times when he can't find it, he's almost in a panic looking for it.

He chews it quite aggressively at times, which it holds up to pretty well (over time, he does end up chewing through it). It does collect moisture (saliva), so it eventually gets soaked completely through (I always have several on hand, so one can dry out while he's playing with another one).

There are two squeakers inside this toy (one in each end). The squeakers are very quiet, and don't squeak for very long, but I consider this a plus. I personally would prefer that they not have squeakers in them at all.

title: Do NOT buy. Buy seachem Prime instead. text: I‚Äôm so annoyed. I bought this mid January because seachem prime was obscenely expensive at the time. I figured when I run out of my small bottle I could switch to this. I have used Prime for 15+ years? Never a problem. This is disgusting. I used it in my quarantine tank. I‚Äôm so annoyed. Immediately cloudy. White film on all my plants and sponge filter. I waited 24 hours to see what was up with it. After several hours still no change. I made up my mind to go to petco and pay for another small bottle while I wait for my prime order to be delivered.

The clear pic was 24 hours later. All the white junk is stuck to my moss and filter. I‚Äôm so annoyed and frustrated. Basically had to shell out for another filter and will be tossing this one. If I could give this zero stars I would. Plus prime is one capful for per 50gallons or something. No harm/issue if you were to use a full cap for smaller size tank. Think junk takes like 5 capfuls for a small tank. You‚Äôd run through this product way faster. Let alone the terrible affects it has on the tank itself.

The only think I‚Äôm grateful for is that it‚Äôs my small quarantine tank w/o subtrate so it‚Äôs easier to clean this filmy muck. Do yourself a favor and buy seachem prime. Way better product. I wish I could return this crap.

Mighty Mouse doesn't mind the padded leg pieces and he moves right along wearing this harness.

The design is unique and definitely helps when he feels the urge to lunge after a squirrel. I'm going to get a bigger one for our Plott Hound - he doesn't pull a lot, but when he does, he's big enough to wear me out. You do want to watch their video for instructions and fit help.

title: Well constructed, easy to use traveling in an RV text: We have three sets of this style portable fencing in the 4 foot tall version for our RV. I got this 2 foot tall section to use alongside the actual trailer to prevent the dogs from scooting under and away. It looks exactly like the bigger fences from 2 different brands and its made of identical materials. The whole kit and caboodle accordion folds flat and stores in big stack in the bunk area of the RV on travel days.

We've attached this section via zip ties to hooks under the trailer and the end pieces are attached to the tall fence. It takes about 10 minutes total to unload all 4 sections, set them up, attach everything and put in the ground stakes. When we're done, the dogs have a safe, secure fenced area anywhere we go. This one lines up exactly with the bottom of the travel trailer and there are no gaps or sagging once the zip ties are in place. I'm very pleased and the entire setup allows our dogs to safely play outside, supervised, but off leash.

text: It says it will hold up to 125 pounds, and shows a big dog in it, but it is pretty wobbly at even 80 pounds, which is my larger dog.  (And i definitely snapped all the pieces in all the way, and assembled it correctly.)  Neither large dog would climb the stairs that I ordered with it, so that leaves trying to lift an 80-lb dog into this bath.  I gave up.  Next I tried it with my 30-lb older dog.  He didn't like it, but I did manage to bathe him and finish up.  Last, I tried it with the husky-mix puppy, also about 25-30 lbs and about 4 months old.  She hated it and started bucking like a bronco once I clipped her collar to the restraint.  The restraint doesn't really hold her in place - for that, you'd need another for the hind end!  She actually managed to twist around and jump over the side, and would have strangled herself if I hadn't grabbed her immediately.  Obviously, never leave your dog unattended if clipped to that collar attachment.  Bottom line:  my dogs do not like to be washed, and this doesn't make it any better or easier to do so.  If you have dogs that enjoy being washed or are very well behaved, then it might be ok.  Also, I do not think it is really sturdy enough for 75+ pound dogs, I would only recommend for smaller to medium dogs.  And I personally found it hard to assemble and the directions were TERRIBLE.

title: Show Your Dog You Care, with Nature's Variety text: A dog‚Äôs nutritional needs are often neglected. It‚Äôs easy to go for the least expensive option when shopping for dog food, but these cheaper foods are not good for dogs. A better option is a dog food like Nature‚Äôs Variety Instinct Raw Boost.

As you can see from the ingredients and other facts, this is a high quality dog food and just to make sure it wasn‚Äôt a bunch of hype, I went to the internet and looked through the web sites that rate dog food. I quickly got the confirmation I wanted: Nature‚Äôs Variety Instinct Raw Boost is, indeed, better than the average dog food. It is high in protein, free of unhealthy fillers, and loaded with omega 3 and omega 6 for a dog‚Äôs good health.

One other important quality of any dog food is, of course, the taste factor. My young dog did find this dog food good overall and he took to it in a short time. No, he didn‚Äôt go all- out crazy over the food and gulp it down, but these higher quality dog foods often take time for a dog to accept. The cheaper foods are made to taste good- much like candy tastes good to a child. Better dog foods take some time to win a dog over and Nature‚Äôs Variety Instinct Raw Boost did take some time, but it was worth the wait.

The one drawback to this dog food is the price. It is quite costly- more than other high end dog foods and multiple times more expensive than the low quality dog foods. If you‚Äôre going to buy this, I recommend splurging and buying the larger bag, since it significantly cuts the per pound price down to size.

Dogs deserve only the best and Nature‚Äôs variety Instinct Raw Boost is one of the better dog foods on the market. It is expensive, yes, but isn‚Äôt your dog worth it? Spend a little now, and improve your dog‚Äôs overall health with Nature‚Äôs Variety.

Our cats are older and have no issues jumping/climbing on /off of it. Nice and sturdy, it doesn't wobble or tip over. The fur coating is fluffy and soft. The scratching post sure comes in handy and prevents the cats from clawing the furniture and carpet in our home. Squeaky especially loves to nap in the bed but sometimes he hides in it, only to pounce on our poor puppy Sonny when he walks past. lol

There are 2 Catry cat tree styles, a flamingo and dinosaur. I ordered the dinosaur. (It even has a cute tail!) Such a great cat tree your cats will love. Without a doubt its definitely worthy of gift giving. The price is reasonable. I absolutely recommend this tree for all cat owners!

title: Delicious, said 5 dogs text: All 5 of our dogs are serious about chew treats and all 5 love these sticks. We never ever give rawhide based treats because rawhide is so dangerous for dogs. These sticks are a reasonable compromise.

The biggest two dogs had their sticks finished in about 15 minutes flat. The 3 medium size dogs were done about 20 minutes later. It's been 48 hours and none of the pack have shown any signs of digestive upset or problems at all.

title: Not a good choice for my sheltie text: Shetland sheepdogs have necks that are as wide as their heads. They can easily move their heads out of a regular collar just by tucking their muzzle down and slipping out of the collar.

For that reason a martingale collar or choke collar is the only safe way to walk a sheltie on leash in terms of restraint.

The fabric is so thick on this martingale collar that the D-ring does not slide quickly enough to restrain the dog.

title: Bad ingredients for cats! text: Okay - read the label carefully.

Propylene glycol.
What is that? Antifreeze!!
Propylene glycol and ethylene glycol are both used in antifreeze.
It is what you try to AVOID for pets!

In humans, it can act as a humectant, and add moisture to an area.
Not that I'd want it on me either, but I know enough to not eat moisturizer.
But in pets, it can get ingested, and should NOT be used!

What this company is doing, I really don't know.
But you can bet that I'd never buy this product.
It isn't worth possibly giving my pet some sort of poisoning.
Even if not fatal, it would have to be painful.

title: Excellent results after two months - more energy, happy & healthy dogs, high-quality text: I tried a couple of varieties of Avoderm this summer through Vine and was so impressed that I researched there entire product line and chose two dry foods and two canned versions to switch my dogs to permanently. This Chicken and Brown Rice kibble is one of the two dry foods. I have had three of my five dogs on it for a couple of months now with excellent results.

Each 30lb bag smells fresh when opened and there's no oily or greasy residue on the food pieces if you roll it through your bare hands. The pieces are small and crunchy and mix well with water and a little canned food if you want. My guys love it and will eat single pieces as training rewards.

In two months I have noticed a significant increase in energy levels in one of my dogs in particular (she is 9 and was energetic before, but she's acting like a three year old again) and a definite improvement in the joy level at dinner time in all three that are eating the chicken formula. None have experienced any digestive problems and we aren't noticing any flatulence whatsoever. I'm using the subscribe and save option and that's been a good deal for convenience and value. I'm really glad we made the switch to the Avoderm products.

title: Soft and comfortable to wear or hold. Bungee end is nice - better for a tall dog text: I'm surprised by how much I like this leash. With 7 dogs of carrying ages, we do a lot of walking and we have multiples of every type of leash. This one is soft and thick so it's not going to be cutting into your waist or hand in a crisis. The bungee end is something I really like on all our regular leashes. It gives the dog a hint they are at the end without snatching them back hard.

This particular leash is best suited for a taller dog simply because it's only six feet in total - our smaller rat terrier mix actually had a difficult time with this compared to our very tall Plott Hound who just strolled along happily. Additionally, don't use this with a dog who isn't fully trained or you risk getting dragged.

Traveler understands heel, wait, slow, walk on, and stop for walking in public. He seemed to enjoy this leash today and by having verbal command over his speed, I felt comfortable using it hands free. I don't think the reflective stitching is right on mine however. Part of the bottom reflects, but not the rest of the leash,cso I won't use this at dusk or nighttime.

title: Great full bodied instand coffee, should be a staple in every pantry!
text: This coffee has been a huge hit in my household. I am typically a Keurig coffee drinker, but there are times when I just don't have the time to be brewing. This Cafe Bustelo is a quick alternative to full brewed coffee. It is full bodied and honestly tastes as good as any other coffee which may take longer to prepare. These were great around the holidays when I had 12 people here for dinner on Christmas. After dinner I had several guests that I served this to just to see their reaction and not one of them had known they were drinking an instant coffee. This coffee is a great alternative to keep on hand for last minute guests or for using on a daily basis when you don't have the time to making a pot of brewed coffee.

title: Good for tossing and catching. Big squeaker in the center text: I'm happier with this Mutt Nation toy than with their Unicorn toy. This one has no strings or rope to fall off or present a choking risk. Additionally, this tambourine seems to be of better construction overall.

There is an enormous squeaker in the center that has survived several days of rough housing by my 5 dogs. They enjoy catching it when I throw it and it's sturdy enough to survive some tug of war between the Plott Hound and Ridgeback.

title: Much too expensive for the tiny quantity. Real shredded chicken that the dogs like text: Limited ingredient diets are a good idea if your dog has food allergies and a couple of mine do with regard to wheat and soy. I tried the Chicken and Sweet Potato version of these pods for my pack with mixed results to my surprise. One of my dogs has had diarrhea for the three days we've been adding these to their regular food. Every one else is fine though. I took one of the pods to our vet and we think the sweet potatoes are just not agreeing with Traveler - there isn't anything else that jumps out at us as particularly problematic.

My one star deduction is not because of the digestive issues for our one dog out of five, but for the poor value these represent in general. These pods are only 2.75 ounces each - less food than almost every other similar sized single serve small "canned" dog food option on the market. Furthermore, these are significantly more expensive per pod than the other versions on the market - even the other super premium, limited ingredient brands. In comparison.... the Wellness Core pods are larger, similarly priced, made in Thailand just like these are, smell better, and have no corn, wheat or soy and you get more food per serving. (These Natural Instinct pods are really only suitable as a mix in topper for any dog larger than a true toy breed)

title: Not Love at First Sight, but It is Holding up to Our Dogs text: I was a little disappointed that the dogs did not immediately go for this toy, nor have they really grown to truly love it, but they have chewed on it some. We have one dog that seems to enjoy squeaking toys and has walked the house a few times squeaking this the entire time. The other dog feels that she needs something in her mouth when she greets you at the door and this has been the gift of choice for the last few days. But they don't seem to relish it as much as tennis balls.

But unlike tennis balls, which the denude of fuzz in ten minutes, and chew to shreds in 45 minutes, this toy is still pretty pristine. We will see if they eventually give it the same destructive focus, but there are no signs of wear from what attentions they have given it. So for now I'm impressed with it's quality, but not so impressed with their reaction to it.

title: Hours and Hours of Fun for Puppies text: Our 9 month old bichon frise puppy Sonny loves this set of toys! He weighs 8lbs; the toys are the perfect size for him. Included in the set: a stuffed rabbit that squeaks, a small ball, and 4 ropes ideal for tug of war and chewing. All 6 toys are very durable and well made.

In addition to playing, the toys are beneficial in helping to clean dog's teeth and a good deterrent to prevent the dog from chewing furniture, shoes, etc.

Not recommended for aggressive chewers

Sonny loves his toys. Plays all day with them and even takes the 9" rope toy outside when he goes to the bathroom every day. lol. Worthy of gift giving. The price is VERY reasonable.

Sonny and I both recommend these toys

title: All my fish love this food

The only fish that doesn't love it is my honey gourami - and I think she's just so small a few little bites fill er up. I have an acrylic tank for DoJo Loaches and they will sit on the ledge that divides t into 4 windows.  They'll catch the food as I drop it in.  Of course that's not saying much because they will eat anything and everyting in sight.  That said - it DOES cloudy the water.  My DoJo's eat a LOT of food and it's easy to overfeed they eat so much had to nearly starrve them on a numher of occsssions to get rid of the cloud.  The other problem is that Dojo are large fish and they poop a lot do  - both contributing to  a  white bloom.

title: Surprisingly strong biodegradable poop bags; bags not always¬†easy to open text: I did not expect these bags to be so sturdy because I tried biodegradable garbage bags in the past and they were horrible.

There are 10 rolls of 15 bags each roll for a total of 150 bags with one nice dispenser to hang off a leash or keyring.

I tested this using my cat's litter pan urine and poop. Since their waste also has abrasive litter pan granules in it, this is a better test for the bag. Nothing fell through. These are perfect from the strength standpoint. However, the bags are sometimes difficult to open which is the only negative I see.

At the current price of $13.99, it comes to $.09 cents per bag if I consider the dispenser a freebie.

title: Great for larger hands. Blades could be sharper text: There are some great features with these clippers. First, the color - LOVE it!

What might be very important to many is the SPACE in the finger openings. I have had several pairs of trimmers over the years, and some have barely fit my medium-sized hands.

These have large thumb/finger openings. So, if you are a guy, or just have larger hands, these might be the clippers for you.

Note that they are very stiff. I just opened and closed them repeatedly for 10 minutes just to try to loosen them up. They remained pretty stiff.
I also felt the blades could have been a lot sharper. For brand new trimmers, these felt like they did not do a clean trim on our cats' toenails. (And we do weekly nail checks/trims at our house.)

So, great for larger hands, love the colors, but they could have done much better on the blades.

title: Colorful toys, but don't like the bell inside. text: These toys are adorable.
I think these were made with humans in mind, as much as the cats.

Now, I was checking out one of them and felt something very hard in the middle of it.
I shook it and there was no noise or sound, so I gutted it to see what the heck was inside.
It turned out to be a rather large, flat jingle bell with no jingle in it.... seriously, the mouse is tiny and stuffed
so tightly with polyfil that there is no way for a jingle bell to make noise.

I found this to be rather unsafe. There are many people whose cats will decimate toys and eat the stuffing.
Those same cats might try to eat this jingle bell as well, and it is a good size to choke a cat. Given that, I have to take a few stars off for not really being a super safe cat toy. These are just as cute with no jingle bell in them, and are a good size for kittens to carry around.
Colorful, cute, but the jingle bell is NOT needed.

title: Versatile dog or cat treat training pouch with pockets text: This treat pouch is versatile. There are three ways to wear this - around the waist via the adjustable waist belt, clipped onto jeans/pants via the attached clip but with the waist belt removed, or crossbody via the extra supplied adjustable strap.

The interior of the pouch has a green liner to keep the bag from getting soiled. The treat pouch can be cinched closed partially but not airtight. There is a half height mesh pocket on the front and a zippered pocket behind that. On the back of the pouch there is also a tiny zippered pocket for credit cards or cash.

Overall, I feel this is a good treat pouch for the current price of $8.79.

title: Great Sup
text: Great preventative, maintenance, & repair supplement for your pets.  We have an elderly grandma pup whose hips were dislocated before she adopted us, yet the condition only started to flair up within the last year.  We started these supplements, level 3, for her & she's now off all pain meds.  We have 14lb pups that are on level 1 for preventative & while we don't have performance dogs, they love to be outside running, we have some on level 2 since they are so active & we want them to have long-happy-running-around-lives.  The pups love them as a treat so I'm thankful the manufacturer has taken taste into account so they will be eaten.  A good way to keep you critters joints healthy.

title: Nice Minced Cat Food
text: I have 3 senior kitties. I love that Fancy Feast has a line of canned food geared toward them! They eat a combination of wet and dry food every day. I like the smaller can size that Fancy Feast has because I don't have to mess with refrigerating left overs. This is minced finer than other non-pate cat foods that I have fed them. I think that makes it easier for them to eat which is a concern for at least one of my cats who has had several teeth extracted and is going to get the rest removed soon. My cats are all pretty picky when it comes to eating wet food, but I have noticed one of mine eating this on several occasions.

title: Has helped our 11 year old Ridgeback a bit in 9 days. text: We have five dogs with three senior citizen dogs in the pack. A Rhodesian Ridgeback of 14, a Beagle mix of 14, and a Rhodesian Ridgeback of 12 years old. (The other two are 11 and 5 years ) We definitely see some signs of age and joint wear. My guys are healthy and very active - they still chase squirrels, wrestle with each other and jump on my bed to snuggle at night. However, unlike their youth, now a day of over doing things can result in stiffness or joint pain.

I try not to keep them on pain meds any more often than necessary and they eat a high quality, grain free senior kibble which has helped a bunch. These tablets seemed like a potential boost for their joints without adding extra aspirin or Dermaxx to their diets. Each one is really big, but they are scored in the middle so you can break them up. My guys are happy to eat these as a treat or broken up and mixed with dinner.

After 9 days with these, none of my dogs have shown any stomach upset. The 11 year old girl seems to have had an absolute improvement with her right, rear knee. It was broken when we rescued her at 16 weeks old and she can be a little gimpy on that leg on cold mornings. The last two mornings though, she bounced up with no limping or visible stiffness. I'm very surprised actually, but I will keep the Heathens on these.

title: Nice in a sandy environment text: We are down at the ranch in West Texas for a year and that means sand. Our 6 dogs love rolling in the Chihuahuan desert sand. It drives me nuts because they are constantly coated in a layer of dust. Including their ears.

I had been using a damp washrag to wipe down the inside of each dogs' ears. That works great actually, but only at the house or RV. Out hiking or riding horses with dogs trailing along, getting water to clean ears is a problem.

I can carry these wipes in a saddle bag easily. Each one is big enough to do both ears on one dog. They get the sand out and any other gunk without causing irritation. The dogs don't seem to mind the wipes at all.

title: Sturdy, but can be too steep for very tall dogs text: We have three elderly dogs that I typically lift in and out of the car and two big middle aged dogs that need to learn to use these steps before we reach that point. The steps are more sturdy than they look and once they are attached to the car correctly, they are stable.

They are steeper than I expected- the really tall Plott Hound does not care for incline at all. He just leaps over them entirely. The shorter dogs like the Blue Heeler, Entlebucher, and Beagle mix are all pretty comfortable using the steps. Those 3 live for car rides, so it just took a single try to them on the steps and into the Sequoia. We've tried these steps with a Sequoia, a Kia Soul and a F-150 truck. The steepness very noticeable on the truck, but it's fine for lower SUVs.

title: Soy and corn free. Mixed with a super premium kibble, no digestive distress text: I'm not a huge fan of the random grocery store brands of dog food by any means. I typically feed a true, grain free super premium dry kibble mixed with a super premium canned food that has ingredients I can fully understand and recognize. The canned Pedigree is sort of a middle of the road compromise with regard to quality level of ingredients - I think of it like fast food burgers vs home cooked from scratch healthy eating. Nothing really wrong with a McBurger and fries now and then, but you don't need a steady, daily diet of it - neither do my dogs.

All that being said, I don't mind this stuff now and then mixed up with the very expensive regular canned food we regularly feed. My dogs like the slight variation in taste and mixing the two doesn't cause any digestive distress or flatulence. I definitely prefer the Pedigree ingredients to the overhyped Science Diet nonsense - there's no corn, no soy or wood fiber cellulose added to the Pedigree unlike the Science Diet. Pedigree has chicken and meat byproducts and something called "cheeseburger flavor" - no clue what that might actually be. It's soy and corn free and that's a good thing indeed.

title: Durable Pet Chew Toy text: Incredibly durable material. We've got a 60 pound retriever chewing and tearing at the thing and she hasn't made a mark in it, except she did tear part of one foot which is not firehose material but some heavy duty cloth. I suspect anyone with an active or large dog is going to lose the feet rather quickly. A quality I like is there's no stuffing in the toy. Even in the event your pet does (and some can!) chew through the edge binding or body there's no mess to be scattered about the house like you get with stuffed toys. On the blue footed bird (I'm sure the Amazon censor-bot will dislike it's actual name) the beak, eyes and facial feathers are all painted on (I can find no information on what type is used even on the Outward Hound page) I suspect they'll go next and would expect it's non-toxic. But contact the company if you've any concerns. There are three squeakers in the lower body, neck and head. These are supposed to continue squeaking even if punctured. Each makes a distinctive sound. I found the one in the neck rather hard to squeak by hand but the other two just need the slightest squeeze.
All in all this is a fairly durable pet toy that should last a good while for some dogs. Plus it's weirdly cute bringing to mind the Galapagos Islands.

title: Flexible Scheduling and Portion Controls text: We recently needed to leave our cat alone for a week in the house. This was the first time we had to leave her completely alone and we had some concerns about making sure she had enough kibble during the day. I selected this feeder with that thought in mind. We ended up not using it during the time we were gone as it came too close to the time we had to leave (no time to learn how to use it) and we had someone reliable come to feed her anyway, but we have since worked with it and are pleased with it.

The idea behind this feeder is straightforward. It dispenses food automatically, portioned and timed as needed. There‚Äôs no real mystery there. However, this is more than a simple ‚Äúdumb‚Äù feeder that spits out a cup of food every so often and has one setting. Multiple feedings can be set up and portion sizes are adjustable to make getting the amount right without a lot of guesswork. Everything is programmable so that odd times can be set up instead of setting the feeder to go off at fixed intervals or at specific times of day.

In use it works well. We can set it to feed our girl twice a day (it‚Äôs capable of more) which is plenty. She‚Äôd eat as much as we‚Äôd feed her if we gave her more, and weight control is an issue with her, so controlling the portion side is important for us.

Assembly doesn‚Äôt require much effort and in no time at all we had it ready to roll. The instructions are fairly easy to understand too, though the controls are straightforward.

This is a good automatic feeder and it will serve well when scheduled feedings are necessary without having to be around. It works as designed, does more than the average automatic feeder and is easy to maintain.

title: Light, super easy to use and clean text: I really like this scooper. With multiple big dogs in our house you know we have used every scooper out there on the market at some point. I had just gone back to the trusty old bag in a bucket and shovel until this unit came. It's light weight, super simple one hand operation, gets 100% of the poop 90% of the time in a single swipe and I love that I can use the plastic bags from the grocery store trip with it. It's also made scooping the yard much faster. There is a little trick though - when you squeeze the trigger to close it and sweep the poop into the bag, let go really fast so it sort of throws the poop into the bag - no bits & pieces left over this way. We would totally buy this again.

************* REVIEW UPDATE ONE YEAR UPDATE January 2010****************

Ok we've used this pooper scooper for almost a year now and it's still working just fine with no problems at all. No parts have broken or cracked and I keep it outside full time, rain or shine, freeze or swelter. We scoop almost every single day with multiple large dogs and this scooper is holding it's own. I just hose it off with the pressure nozzle to clean it after use, prop it against the wall and walk away when I've finished scooping the yard. Excellent product!

title: Helps Keep Doggy Teeth Clean text: Dogs need dental care, but most of us don‚Äôt want to take them to a vet for constant professional cleaning. We need something to help between those times when we do take our dogs for cleaning and these Dental Effects dog treats are made to help with this necessary task.

The small bag I got contains exactly 5 treats. My dogs are medium in size so these treats were a little too easy for them- they took only a few minutes to devour them completely. The treats seem like they taste good enough for dogs, as mine two dogs snatched them from my hands and ran off immediately to enjoy their feast.

With their jagged edges and other qualities, these treats are intended to scrape your dog‚Äôs teeth, helping to remove plaque and tartar. I haven‚Äôt taken the time to confirm this claim, but based on the crunchiness and the design, I will take the manufacturer‚Äôs word for it. All I know is that my dogs like the treats and munched them down quickly.

Because there are only 5 small treats in my package, this is not the type of dog treat that will last long. The ingredient list, while certainly not bad, doesn‚Äôt have meat among the top three, so that concerns me a little. Thus, when I consider all factors, this dog treat rates average overall.

title: One cat won't touch it. Second cat loves it text: Well...one of two cats won't eat this at all. Our Siamese should have liked this food.... it's basically meat - and yet he actively avoids it. I offered a couple of pieces to the neighbor's cat that lurks around for dinner. She ate it and even played with a few pieces. Today she was back for breakfast, so clearly she likes this food. Our kitty? Looked on with utter disdain - though that's the Siamese go-to expression. Resting Disdain Face. However, even if our cat loved this, it's a total budget killer.

title: labrador approved, my girl likes to scrunch it up to make a pillow; light, thin, but lofty text: Big squishy English labrador approved!

I was looking for a thin pad to add loft to an existing dog bed. Started searching, and that just brought me down a dog bed rabbit hole, haha. So many options.! The look of this intrigued me. I liked that this would fit on their bed, would be light weight yet appeared lofty enough to provide comfort. I didnt plan on it to be used anywhere else. I saw similar products, and kind of looked through those reviews to see if I'd like this one. The price was better on this and had the color I preferred, and the description was all in line with what I wanted, so I went for it.

It arrives rolled up. It is just kept closed via a trip of velcro. The ribbing you see are puffy panels, and lends to it being able to be rolled up. There is a flat handle on one side, which does not impede use of that side. Two tone brown, just what I wanted. The darker side is meant for use against ground, with lighter side being what they lay on. Says it is waterproof. I imagine it can handle some wetness so long as it isnt sitting in a puddle (or allowed to have liquid accumulate). The pad is on thin side, but it has loft. It reminds me of a camping bed pad, just a little more fluffy. If you travel, this is something I would recommend as it rolls up nicely and cleans up easily.

I didn't know if they'd like it. Once in hand, I was like.. mmm maybe they wont like the texture of the panels. But, I placed it on their bed, and let them tell me if they like it. It ultimately came down to my dogs as to whether this is any good. I have two large yellow labs. They IMMEDIATELY took to it, and it even piqued the interest of my cat.

The 40" x 26" is the minimum I would go for a dog of their size. My girl fits better on this- she's around 70-75 lbs and is more compact, whereas my boy is a big moose (105 lbs), so he hangs off of it a bit. But that doesnt stop him from lounging on it. In fact, I notice that they like to pick it up and take it somewhere so they can both kind of lay on it. They are very much bonded, so they are always together. I will see them just laying down shoulder to shoulder, and a couple of times they used this together. I will try to get a pic, so cute.

The unexpected benefit of the panels, is that my girl-- who is a snuggler-- can pull a panel or two toward her and make it scrunch like a pillow. So cute.

I didn't plan to use this outside, but now that I have it, I will give it a try. Come nicer weather when we are all hanging out outside, I may grab this for them to lay on. Seems like it will be very easy to clean off. I can't test that right now or any time soon. It is still winter in NY- we just had snow, and now it is melting so there is lots of wetness and mud. My dogs aren't lounging outside in this weather even if this bed can hold up to it. But inside? yep they are using it (esp my girl, and my cat). I may get another so each dog has one.

Anyway, glad I bought this. So far so good, and I recommend it.

title: So quirky it becomes cute.. the kitty loves! text: Who knew.. The center of attention would be a gawky looking giraffe set in the living room- a giraffe made to disguise a cat scratch post?! No one visits without chatting about this silly but clever little thing! Certainly a novelty way to decorate and hide cat paraphernalia!!

Im pretty sure kitty thinks it‚Äôs a lost relative.. she seems so intrigued by its head- dare I say she can even be a bit shy and timid around it.. a budding romance?!! Either way, within a minute she is digging her claws into the post as intended and sparing our furniture- Some do wonder how cat ‚Äúknows to use it‚Ä¶‚Äù well, happy to say- all without help she figured it all on her own. Go figure- crazy cat instincts!

Easy to build this is beyond simple. Set includes instructions but, optional and not necessary. Received folded at base hinge with x3+ pieces. This includes a ‚Äúhex key‚Äù which is ONLY tool you‚Äôll need! Posts have screws in place. Unfolded one inserts post then.. using key just tighten at the base. Boom! It‚Äôs that easy- the spring tail with bell + rope post are sturdy and bolted in. But, both the eye + nose are hot glued on.. and done a bit sloppy. Total truth, these may not last long! *Be sure they won‚Äôt cause choking hazard if dislodged- my x1 concern or complaint and reason to deduct x1 star. All other features ie. feet, ears are stitched into place and seem to entertain kitty.. ours is quite obsessed with the head/face!

Overall, this is a ‚Äúso ugly.. it‚Äôs cute‚Äú type of item. One that‚Äôs well worth $16- a solid deal for a scratch post alone.. to be quirky cute is a bonus- extra pay pieces are icing on the cake! Hoping this info helps your decision- stay safe everyone.

title: Adds Flavor and Health to Your Dogs Food text: I now have two dogs and one thing they both agree on is food: They love meaty, soft food or anything that resembles it. I am wary of feeding excess soft food, but I don‚Äôt mind adding soft food or other toppers to their dry food. This preference is the reason I was happy to discover Zesty Paws Allergy Immune Bone Broth for Dogs.

Packaged in a pump bottle, this broth is easy to add to your dog‚Äôs food. Just hold the bottle upright and pump it a few times to coat the food. It doesn‚Äôt take much and the scent and flavor are enough to convince the most finicky canine consumers to give in and start eating.

This dog food product is more than just a flavor booster, however. It is also formulated to improve your dog‚Äôs overall health, with omega 3 and other ingredients to improve your dog‚Äôs coat, skin, and digestion. I can‚Äôt really comment on these qualities- I will have to take their word for it. All I know is that it does persuade my dogs to eat and if it does, indeed, help in these other areas, then that makes it even better.

Zesty Paws makes life better for your dog and it is much easier to use than soft dog food, which must be scooped out of a can with the remainder stored in the fridge. I had a slight issue with the pump at first, and it did make somewhat of a mess. But I worked out this minor issue and have had no problems since. It‚Äôs a great way to better health and happier eating and a product perfect for any dog owner.

title: My Puppy Gives this 3-Stars, But... text: My very food-motivated puppy gives these treats 3-stars. He will eat them if he is really hungry, but they are far from his favorite. In fact, I don't think he regards them as treats at all. If he eats these, I know he is seriously hungry.

I took one-star away because they are messy, too. Maybe if my puppy liked them more and they weren't so dry, he would at least eat up the crumbs.
