title: Fix throat latch strap and it's great text: I seriously considered giving this mask just 2 stars after the first day of use. However, we made adjustments to it and after two months, it's still in daily use.

The problem is the throat latch strap. That is both a blessing and a dangerous addition. Without all three attachments, the mask doesn't work and won't stay on - velcro under the jaw, ear strap and throat latch strap. Unfortunately, the design for the throat latch is bad. The hanging end after it's fitted, dangles loose and can be tightened by any little pull or catching on a fence post etc. If your horse has a buddy....like, say, a donkey who messes with stuff, this strap can be pulled dangerously tight around the throat.

We ended up setting the length and tying it off in two knots below the snap closure. So far this has stopped the entire strap from being tightened by the donkey and the mask stays on until I remove it.

The actual face/eye covering works very well and my white stallion no longer has fly and sun irritation around his eyes. We're deep into the Chihuahua Desert here and it's both incredibly hot and bright almost year round - eye protection is a must for equines.

The only reason I deducted a star is this:

My 11-year-old dog couldn‚Äôt even begin to crunch them on her own (she gave up even trying to do so), so I poured them out into a bowl and left them exposed to air for a couple of days. Much like graham crackers that get a tiny bit softer as they‚Äôre slowly exposed to levels of interior humidity in the air, these biscuits became just the right amount of breakable and crunchable. title: POTENTIALLY FATAL DESIGN FLAW - be careful! text: Potentially deadly flaws with this collar. The design makes it tighten easily when the dog pulls on it, but it doesn't release easily to allow the dog to breathe again! This is a legitimate choking hazard or could potentially permanentnly damage your dogs windpipe, with possibly lethal consequences. It's important buyers know that, I'll try to explain exactly what the problem is...

First, counterintuitively the slip portion goes through the O ring and then through one side of what is a pretty standard plastic snap mechanism which isn't made for easy sliding. Like any good standard snap it fits the nylon prety snug and the feed-though is angled. Just from messing around with it I can see it's much easier to pull the collar through the snap than it is to loosen it back - additionally there's no limit to the amount the collar can tighten as with a martingale collar.

The danger is if your dog pulls on a walk the collar could cinch tight and not loosen back to neutral. At worst you'd be asphyxiating your dog, at best it doesn't loosen fast enough to reward the dog for not pulling. Slide the nylon through the snap for a while to get a feel for this effect and potentially loosen it up a bit. You could undo the snap when using the slip funtion but the D-ring with half the snap can fit through the O ring and get too loose, then prevent tightening the collar if your dog tries to slip out of it.

Second issue: This isn't a safe collar to leave on your dog unattended, period, under any circumstance. If your dog were to get the D-ring caught on anything it would undoubtedly choke itself to death, no question. Nor should a dog ever be tied out in this collar without both the D and O rings clipped together (or better yet, not tied out in this at all). Similarly a dog should never be allowed to drag a leash from the D ring, even while supervised.

This is a collar which should NOT be a dog's main collar, but used only in supervised training sessions if at all. If I can't work the collar to where it softens up and "loosens" back to neutral easily I'll return it, that's irresponsibly dangerous and can cause permanent damage to the dog's windpipe.

The construction and materials appear quite good and solid, but the design is fundamentally flawed. They should have added a piece between the snap and slip portion through which the slip part of the collar could easily slide - running it through a standard snap, designed specially to limit collar slippage, is potentially fatal laziness on the manufacturer's part and quite frankly inexcusable. Dogs could literally die.

Finally, be aware the collar runs large. I ordered a small and with the adjuster slid as big as it'd go it'd easily fit a German Shepard. I have it adjusted in the middle for my lanky 40lbs dog. Tightened up all the way it might work for a small dog with a thick neck, but I'd say the small size would be called a medium in most brands.

title: Show Your Dog You Care text: Dogs love anything made with meat and as pet owners, we are often wary of feeding our dog canned food, however meaty and delicious it might be to a dog, due to the often questionable ingredients and fillers. Under the Sun Grain Free Adult Dog Wet Food Duck Formula puts these worries to rest with quality ingredients that are meat- centric and acceptable to most any dog owner.

My dog eats a diet of mostly dry dog food, but we do like to top off his dry food with wet food as an occasional treat. Under the Sun Grain Free Adult Dog Wet Food Duck Formula is very good for this purpose. The meaty food is ground up into a fine mixture that makes it easy for a dog to eat and it could probably be handled by dogs at any age. My dog is around two years old and he had no problem eating this food along with his dry food.

Under the Sun Grain Free Adult Dog Wet Food Duck Formula is a little bit pungent, like most wet dog foods, but it is actually quite bearable compared to some. I have purchased and fed some canned dog foods that required holding my nose in order to empty the can, and then running as far away as possible. This dog food keeps the smelly factor under control.

Wet dog foods often contain sub- par quality ingredients but Under the Sun Grain Free Adult Dog Wet Food Duck Formula is different. With duck, water, turkey, and turkey broth at the top of the ingredient list, this is definitely a wet food you can feel safe feeding your dog. Yes, the price per can is high, but you get what you pay for and your dog will love you even more for taking the time to serve such high quality, canine palate compatible food.

title: My friend's three dogs devoured this food after they sniffed it a few times text: I ordered this for my friend's three dogs. At first they refused the food. However, after sniffing it a few times, they ate ravenously. This is a wee bit expensive at the current price of $66.84. However, for a limited time, Amazon is giving 40% off on the first order via a savings coupon (not sure how long that will be for).

Attached are pictures of the claims, ingredients list, and guaranteed analysis. This is a limited ingredient diet with one protein and one carbohydrate according to the claims on the bag. The first three ingredients are dehydrated lamb, pearl millet, and lamb fat.

The details on the bag seem to be in about 50 different languages.

Based on the response of my friend's dogs, I am rating this 5 stars. I believe a variable ingredient diet is better than a limited ingredient diet for any animal. However, this is a good supplemental food to mix in with their regular food. I would not feed any animal a limited ingredient diet for life unless he or she has some sort of allergy.

The dogs love it. I believe it is up to the pet owner to decide if the price and ingredients are right for their pet.

title: WARNING! DANGEROUS!!! text: i've never liked the way this puts tags on their Squeak balls. It's a real challenge to take them off without leaving very sharp points on the ball. But the tags on the Snoop and Nook are exceptionally dangerous. Luckily I thought to look inside each one before giving them to my dog. Of course, the other ends of the tags were inside, just waiting to fall out at some point and possibly end up inside my dog. I spent the next 15 minutes with a long pair of hemostats pulling them all out.
My dog loves playing with these and I hate that they are probably the only ones he will ever get to have. Even though I now know how to keep my dog safe with these toys, I refuse to support a company that knowing endangers my dog. I emailed them over a week ago and have yet to get a response, other than an acknowledgment that they received my email. This leads me to believe they simply don't care. They are more concerned about their tags than they are about my dog.
So be warned. And unless you have some long hemostats and a good bit of patience, do not buy these. And if enough people complain and stop buying these toys, maybe they'll finally get the message.

This foam mat does fit perfectly in her dog crate, but we have actually stopped crating her in the last year because of her age. So we are using this in the living room as a dog pillow. At first, she was hesitant to use it, but once she saw that her feline siblings were all over it, she decided it was worth investigating closer. It offers nice support on her old bones and joints. It is very well constructed and doesn't look out of place on our living room floor. It's about 2 inches thick and the cover can be removed and washed. I am very happy with it and so is my dog!

title: Small, Crunchy, Organic, and Promotes Sustainability text: My dogs eat treats daily. I use them for many purposes, and that would include rewards and just simply getting their attention, like when I want them to come inside from my backyard. I like having an assortment of treats and small treats are perfect for those times when you want to feed your dog a quick snack. This is what you get with these Cheese and Bacon treats from the Everlasting Pet Company.

Heart shaped, these treats are dry and cookie- like. There is almost no smell at all, so you won‚Äôt gag when you open the pouch. The flavor features two things we know every dog loves: cheese and bacon. There should be no problem at all getting your four- legged family member to enjoy these treats.

There is one added plus with these dog treats, and it‚Äôs something you don‚Äôt see with most dog treats. The package is 100 percent compostable. Another plus is that the family- owned business that makes these treats preps them at a factory that is solar powered. They obviously take their commitment to the planet seriously, to go along with their commitment to making quality treats for dogs.

While these treats are crunchy, they are surprisingly grain free, which is yet another plus. The ingredient list is short, too, and free from the nasty chemicals you often see on the ingredient lists of other dog treats. Another plus? The package contains a large number of small treats, so a single pouch should last for a while.

With so many plusses and no minuses, these bacon and cheese dog treats from the Everlasting Pet Company are a home run, both from my dog‚Äôs perspective and from mine! I can‚Äôt find anything negative to say about them, so they earn an easy 5 stars.

I do disagree with the product description here - these are fairly large treats; I don't think that they're proper for "training". A much better choice for training is [[ASIN:B0006349WQ Crazy Dog Train-Me! Training Treats Bacon]] or [[ASIN:B0006349W6 Crazy Dog Train-Me! Training Treats Chicken]].

The break away mechanism does indeed work, as that is the only way to get it open. Pull, and it pulls apart. BUT This does not make either of my cats happy. I am currently getting the stink eye from my one kitty after putting it on and needing to take it off again to make it fit better.

The bells are cute, but kinda hang low. That is probably typical of a cat collar. The bell is attached to a tiny key ring, then further attached to a mini D ring. I took it off even though it looked precious on my girls. The product description has good pics of these collars.

My 2 girls, "the lady bugs" were recently adopted. They are adults, and I called them that collectively before I gave them names (now Stella and Sophie). I still call them my little lady bugs. Anyway, both are tortoiseshell- one being the typical black and orange, and the other being a dilute- so she is gray with peach. The gray and orange looks great on the black/orange tortie while the gray & pink looks adorable on my dilute. The latter seems proud of her collar, while the other is well.. giving me the stink eye. I may not put it back on her.. but it looks so cute.

I definitely wouldn't get this for a dog. Between the cat buckle, the thin collar.. it really reminds me of cat only. But hey, go for it I guess.

title: I haven‚Äôt tried it, but the wild bunnies keep coming back for more... text: I haven‚Äôt tried it, but the wild bunnies keep coming back for more...
On the evening where I placed some hay in my front yard, where the bunnies typically come out of the bushes to graze on my grass, I was quite surprised how quickly they found they hay.
Their adorable little noses sure work well! I no sooner than placed the hay back in the house, with maybe 20-30 seconds passing before I went back out front and find them already nibbling their hay.
I had fresh mounds of hay around the yard every evening, which is when wild bunnies are most active. I would say about 75% of the hay does get warmer up by the bunnies, but they leave the large twig looking pieces behind. For $4 a bag and free shipping, I don‚Äôt mind the 25% waste, which I can easily rake up weekly.
Overall good purchase, happy bunnies and have brought much joy to my days finding cute bunnies in my yard more often now then before.
Win win! I recommend this item

title: Works well if the pet tolerates the paw submersion text: This is not only for dogs. I got this for one of my cats because he repeatedly gets sick and steps in his vomit. This helps clean his paws. I use a little bit of Dawn with warm water and then put one paw at a time in the chamber while turning it back and forth. The silicone bristles help cleanse the paw. The instructions are on the box but photos would be good too.

I dry this by pulling off the top and removing the silicone as shown in my photos.

The current price of $14.39 ($15.99 minus 10%) is a bit pricey for this. Note that this comes with a cheap/ratty blue cloth. I first saw these types of paw cleaners at Duluth Trading Company in New Jersey and was impressed; however, the price there is over $21, so this is still a better deal. However, I hate the ratty cloth they provided. If a pet will not tolerate this, then no matter how good this is it will be useless.

UPDATE - I gave one of these to a neighbor to try and her dog loves this. She said this works well. In her case, it is 5 stars.

title: Helping with seasonal pollen induced itch text: We have a 14 year old Rhodesian Ridgeback mix who gets awful skin itch in the spring. Shes reacting the nightmare levels of pine pollen we have in East Texas. We give her benadryl at night (under full supervision of our vet) so she can rest, but we don't want to do that multiple times a days for weeks.

I was skeptical of these chews, but we've given her 2 per day in the morning for 8 days now. She really likes the chews and they are easy for her to chew. Soft, but not mushy. I think these have helped her - she's not scratching as often during the day and seems happier. I'll keep using them as long as we see any improvement.

title: Great Bags! text: Love these bags. I like that you can't see the waste and they're thick enough to not really feel the waste. I also love how the bags label which way is the correct way to open on every single bag so I don't feel like an idiot for 5 minutes trying to open the bag. In addition, the holder is very sturdy.

I'm a first time pet owner and got my dog last week. So I had no experience with bags and figured a bag was a bag. I bought a set of bags from Petco. They didn't label how to open them. They split very easily, and the holder that came with it just simply did not work.

title: chubby tabby approved, makes my big boy happy for "snack time". text: My tabby cat was never into treats until I introduced these to him. Now we have to have a "snack" upon demand a few times a day. I keep them in a certain spot, he knows where they are. He goes to the general location and gives me the look, waiting for me to do the right thing. lol. So to keep him pleased with his servant, I give him 4-8 of these little bites, and he is a happy boy.

While he only gets a few at a time, I am glad that these are nutritionally balanced to not offset his regular meals. I dont know what makes these so crazy yummy for him, but it sure is a pleasure to see him perk up when I dole these out. I get a little chirp of approval that makes my heart sing.

title: Best part of the set is the large comb; the rest is cheap text: This is a four-piece grooming set with one tiny hand-held comb, another flea comb with handle, a long double-side tiny comb/brush combo that reminds me of an eyebrow brush/comb set, and a large wide-tooth metal comb.

The wide-tooth metal comb is very sturdy and excellent for large jobs and larger animals like long-haired dogs. It is too big for me to use on my long-haired cats. ¬†The other combs work to get out knots but they feel very cheap and I expect they will break with repeated use. I had to be gentle when I used these. I love the fact that the teeth are fine but the cheapness I do not like. Also, I do not know what to do with the tiny brush on the end of the long handled comb that looks like an eyebrow brush.

The current price of $7.99 is reasonable for this set because it is not a set that will last. However, the large metal comb is excellent.

title: Amazing fish food!! Great for picky eaters text: High quality food for the price! I was very suspicious but I found this at my local specialty fish store and it's something new so I thought I'd try it...I was not disappointed...

One of my boys fin nipped the crap out of himself and after two months of trying to get them to regrow I didn't see any regrowth...I've been overly happy the past few days (after a two weeks of this food) I've noticed rapid regrowth! I guess it just had to become part of his regular diet but every day for the past three days I've noticed a crap ton of regrowth!!!

I rarely go online to write a review for in store bought products but if you're thinking of just trying this you won't regret it!! I have three picky eaters and they don't even hesitate to wolf this food down!!

This is definitely going to remain one of their main sources of food

title: For small dogs or cats; awkward to put on and harness strap is subject to movement (2.5 stars) text: This review is for the [[ASIN:B07KP1FLM3 dogstory Dog Story ENZO Harness A-Royal Blue-Large]].

I ordered this for my 16-pound cat Ricky. However, I should have ordered a medium because the large is just a couple of inches too big. Nevertheless, I actually do not care for this harness. First, I found it very awkward to get this fastened. The harness just seems to "ride" too high (under the belly and close to the neck). Also the back strap glides from side to side and would be subject to movement as the leash is pulled from left to right. I would think this would irritate a dog or cat and also shift the harness around the pet's neck. Although this is well made in so far as the material and stitching, due to the other issues I do not feel it is worth the $28 price tag.

title: Worked for short term grass induced itchy spots text: I have one older dog who gets itchy for a day or two after the yard is mown. No hot spots or fleas, it's just a temporary allergy reaction to the fresh cut grass. There's no reason for him to be on daily medication, but now and then he needs a little help on the tender skin on the inside of his back legs.

This spray has definitely helped this week. He was tolerant of the application and happy to have me rub his ears for five minutes while the sprayed area dried. He still felt a little itchy periodically, but wasn't scratching or chewing incessantly. I used this twice a day for two days after mowing and he was certainly more comfortable.

title: Formula changed - for the worse! text: July 2020 update: grudgingly reordered despite dented cans (see below). PURINA HAS CHANGED THE FORMULA! All of the cans have WATERY JUICE that does not mix with the "pate". The pate is extremely grainy in texture. Even warming in microwave does not improve it. My 4 cats won't eat it, nor the outside feral. FOR SHAME, FRISKIES.

BEWARE: my last case of 24 had 10 of 24 cans severely dented. The worst part is that four dented cans had deep V-shaped dents on the BOTTOM -- and they were on the TOP layer. Several with deep dents on the side were swollen! There is no evidence of repackaging. This would indicate that either Purina or their packers are willfully selling dented cans. There is NO way the bottoms of cans on the TOP layer can get damaged AFTER packing.

title: 12" long, good thickness, a favorite for my big yellow lab text: Excellent size for my big boy. I have a 95 lb labrador retriever who is picky about what he eats and gnaws on. Bully sticks are usually a favorite of his, and this brand of this size is extra appealing to him. He will take days to work through one. I just take all 4 out and place them in his toy bin. He take one as he wants it. Sometimes he likes to switch to another, so I let him choose. Since he doesnt seek to gobble it down at once, I can do this.

This bag had 4 thick bully sticks- the perfect thickness for his preference. Since I have had so much variability among brands (some being real skinny), I will stick with this brand if I can expect the same thickness and quality. So far so good.

title: Unscented Multi-Cat Litter "Fresh and Lightweight Ultimate Care" Hypoallergenic by Cat's Pride text: An excellent choice if biodegradable is not for you. Does not contain sodium bentonite. We've been using this brand, [[ASIN:B0159HV23W 2 PACK WORLD'S BEST CAT LITTER 391032 Clumping Litter Formula 28-Pound]], for the last 2 years and our Cat seems to find the 1% of dust in the product so we thought we could try something new. I selected Cat's Pride brand for their slogan "because a fresh home is a happy home" ~ I feel the same.

fyi - Cat's Pride clay litters are naturally occurring clay minerals known as "fuller's earth" and contain small amounts of crystalline silica in the form of quartz. Crystalline silica, in the form of quartz, is the second most abundant mineral in the earth's crust. This mineral is also found in beach sand as well, and PetMD reports that a large quantity of either clay or silica litter would need to be ingested to really be dangerous to your cat,

text: I have 3 full grown cats, ranging from 8-11 pounds, and they all fit wonderfully and best yet, took to it right away, even before I had finished putting it together. My priority was to get something with three SOFT beds that were high up (this is almost as tall as my husband who is 6ft) because we have dogs too and I wanted them to each have their own comfortable spot where they can lounge and not be bothered. This was exactly what I was hoping for. The beds on top have very soft fabric and soft cushions. My cats fit perfectly on top. The little caves are a huge hit as well, and have plenty of room for them to turn around and get comfortable in, or should you have larger cats I think it would easily accommodate them as well (see photos). I'll probably end up putting a soft cushion in the little caves too, but they don't even seem to mind because the fabric is so soft. It connects to the wall too, for safety, so in case they leap off or get the zoomies I don't have to worry about it crashing down and injuring on of them, or my puppies. Very happy.

title: Ergonomically designed groomer; pin side great; brush side gentle but doesn't pick up much hair text: This is an attractive and well-made brush. It is ergonomically designed and so easy to hold. It also feels great in my hands as there are finger bumps along the length of the handle.

This brush is dual sided. I have three-long-haired cats and the wire bristles pick up a lot of hair; however, the nylon bristles act more like a massage brush than a hair brush. It hardly picks up any hair. It only picks up surface hair as that side is super gentle.

I love this brush because of its feel, hold, and dual-purpose. The nylon bristle side is good for pets who are not used to being brushed or just prefer light grooming. The wire pin side is for more vigorous hair removal.

Normally, I would rate this 4 stars due to the lack of hair pick-up on the one side. However, I love this brush so much that I am rating it 5 stars because it is so easy to work with. There is no current price listed but a price between $8.99 and $11.99 would be considered competitively priced for this.

title: Cheap piece of rubbish text: This "Partysaving Self Heating Snooze Pad Pet Bed" is - without doubt - the CHEAPEST, FLIMSIEST self-warming pet pad ever ! I have purchased plenty of the self-warming styles over the years. As a test, I placed it over a pillow and layed on it for 30 minutes. NO WARMTH REFLECTED BACK -- even after unzipping and flipping over the aluminum foil stuff.

This product has NO padding material inside except the foil material; you'd be better off putting heavy duty aluminum foil between a PILLOWCASE And don't be deceived: that "faux Sherpa" material is just that -- FAUX and extremely thint. The product insert that came with this product indicates it is suitable for outdoor pets. Yeah -- if you live in Hawaii or Arizona.

Save your money and for a few dollars more, get a real self-warming cat/pet pad that has cushioning AND is actually self-warming.

title: Love the portion sizes text: This has been included in the diets of both of my indoor cats since they were kittens. In fact, one of them would consume two cans plus small portions of dry food per day. However, I try to use these as a treat or special meal every other day to balance their diets. Both of my cats are extremely healthy, but that is not due solely to this food - they have been pampered with the best regular diets and routine vet visits. But I am sure that this food is a contributing factor.

On rare occasions I also treat my feral colony with a feast comprised of a can for each of them. They are like starving wolves when this is put out for them. Again, they are feral and will eat anything, so it's no real test, but they all seemed to relish this and all come running.

One of the main reasons I love this is the portion sizes. I certainly don't want to overfeed my two housebound cats, which would lead to health problems. One of the related products from this brand that I alternate with this is their pate (same portion size), which my cats seem to like even more.

The three colored sections result in three different sounds when bounced. It has a good bounce and is lots of fun for the right dog or puppy. It certainly is keeping the puppies occupied.

UPDATE: July 10, 2018 - My friend's constant revolving door of puppies (she runs an animal foster home) love this toy. However, the adult dogs do not. She keeps telling me how amazed she is at how all the puppies seem to take to this and the others show no interest.

title: Loved but cause soft stools in smaller dogs text: My dogs love these. They only last a minute or two for them, and they aren't very aggressive chewers, but it's enough time to sneak out of the house without feeling bad.

The downside is they make their stools soft and white-colored. I only give them about one a week, but each time they have a soft (not runny) stool. Maybe this wouldn't a problem for a bigger dog. Mine are 20-25 lbs. I would recommend the smaller bones for smaller dogs because of this even though the bigger ones last longer. I'll be switching to the smaller ones.

title: Sized SMALL. Measurements are off text: Once again, a dog coat that is either measured incorrectly or is incorrectly stated on the listing page. We have the 3X size for out Plott Hound.

The physical construction of the coat is ok. Not great, but should last one winter. The back zipper is flimsy, so you don't want to use the harness attachment with an untrained, rowdy dog.

title: My Lambie LOVES Meat Mates Lamb Treats!!!!!!!!!!
text: I think I will let the pictures tell the story!  As soon as I brought the package of Meat Meats lamb treats into the house following their delivery, our dog Mac went bonkers!  I couldn't open the package fast enough for him!  As soon as I opened it and took the bag of treats out, he grabbed it and tried to chew the bag open! lol.  (Don't worry, I took it from him and opened it properly)  Each treat is small  and soft, about the size and consistency of a mini marshmallow. Mac wolfed all 3 down immediately and cried for more!  (As you can see by my photos, our cat, Miss Piggy also wanted some and took to licking Mac's face to get a nibble! Just a crumb, she did NOT eat any treats other than a little crumb off of his face)  I love to spoil Mac and give him treats, especially healthy treats.  And Meat Mates lamb treats ARE healthy because lamb is the ONLY ingredient!  I WILL be purchasing Meat Mates for Mac in the future. He loves them and they're good for him!  My little Lambie LOVES Meat Mates lamb treats!~ (He's a bit spoiled...his name is Mac but I call him all kinds of other names as well, including 'Lambie' because he reminds me of a baby lamb)

The food itself is a definite loaf with a bit of "sauce" so it's not dry or clumpy. It's easy to mix into dry kibble with water. My dogs all liked this food actually and ate it happily. Out of seven dogs, four had gas with this, but none had any diarrhea or vomiting. So it's not bad food, it just shouldn't be in the premium category.

title: Easy clean brush; doesn‚Äôt pick up as much hair as my other brushes text: This brush's best feature is that it is a cinch to clean. I just engage the bristles by pushing them out, brush my cats, then retract the bristles with the button. The hair remains on top and can be slid off. It is a cinch to use. The only reason I took off one star is because the bristles do not grab the hair like my wire brushes do. This means it does not pull off as much hair as the stationary brushes.

Note that this is for long-haired pets only; I would not use this with a pet with short hair.

The current price of $12.99 is $2 more than their [[ASIN:B0989NVP1H black colored one]].

title: Only one of my three cats would eat this text: Since Amazon combines reviews for various flavors of the same brand of cat food, note that this review is for the salmon pate of the Wild Frontier brand.

There are 24 dual packages in this box. What I mean by dual is that each package is actually two halves or two single servings that can be broken apart at the center. Each serving (meaning each half ) is 1.32 ounces. I love that I am not forced to throw out cat food that will not be eaten or that is only eaten in small batches.

I have three cats and only one of my three cats would eat this. However, note that the other two are very finicky eaters.

In addition to lack of interest in this food by two of my cats, I am also disappointed that the ingredients list is EXTREMELY BLURRY and TINY and it is not my eyes. I was, however, able to guess at the first seven ingredients, which are salmon, chicken liver, chicken, pork broth, chicken broth, natural flavor, guar gum, etc.

At least one cat likes it.

title: Picky Pomeranian will eat this text: My mom's dog who will eat NO dog food crunchies will eat this! lol

Royal Canin is a very thoughtful dog food company and they put lots of research into the products for each specific breed. If you have a picky eater, try this stuff!

title: Works quite well!
text: I was surprised how well this works. Much better, in fact, than many of the far more expensive brushes and devices we've had. I have an aging Maine Coon who has stopped grooming himself much. He became quite matted. Eventually, we had to have a vet shave him down some, but he didn't get it all. I'm trying to work through the rest and keep up the improvements. I've also been using this on another senior, very long haired cat of ours, one who's not matted. It does wonders taking of abundant amounts of fur.

title: Decent

title: Not anatomically correct. Definitely NOT for male dogs. Nor females! text: Gave a two star rating only because the actual material is nice and soft.

BUT...the fact that the design, more specifically the way in which the bottom portion is designed makes one think the designers never actually have seen a dog pee and poop.

The sizing was accurate. The material nice enough. It is designed for a dog who does not pee or poop ...if you have one of those, then, by all means buy it.

I had to actually cut the bottom part with sissors because it has been very cold and I actually **needed** the little outfit for my pup not to freeze outside. I had ordered another one that is going right back to the seller as soon as I receive it.

Tood bad because the fabric's design is cute.

Side Note: watch out for the positive reviews as included with the outfit there is a card with a note that reads: "A same item with different color will be sent for your GOOD REVIEW STARS" Hummm...sounds like a little unethical brivery is going on....but to be fair, too many people include brives such as this one. Mentioning this just to make you all aware that if you find a bunch of great reviews for an item is time to be a little skeptical.

title: Good quality, reversible and great for hard to fit dogs

title: Our dog wouldn't eat them text: Our dog doesn't like thunderstorms or even rain. He's like John Prine's dog in that can "predict hurricanes". He starts getting anxious even before the storm starts. I've tried a couple of these and the key thing is whether or not he'll eat them.
In this case, he wouldn't touch them, so I don't know if they are effective or not. I just know that the taste and scent are a non-starter for him. They are in the shape of pills and look like a big, beige aspirin. Since they are for anxiety, I don't want to force him to take them so we just threw them away. Maybe I should have kept them for myself :).
They may work for your pet, but mine refused to take them so I don't know if they work or not.

title: Helps Clean Your Dog's teeth text: My dogs love their doggie treats and I probably feed them more treats than they should have. But I at least try to stick with treats that are healthier than most and one good example is AlphaPaws Dentalicious dog treats.

These dog treats are designed to help clean a dog‚Äôs teeth. They have ridges which are intended to get between a dog‚Äôs teeth and help scrape away plaque and tartar. In addition to that, the treats are made with parsley and botanical oils to freshen breath. The treats are thinner than most and a little easier to chew and swallow.

I have two dogs and they love most any dog treat. These treats are not quite as appealing as others, but they still enjoy them. They don‚Äôt go ga- ga over these treats like they do other dog treats, but in many ways this is good. It prevents them from eating too much, too quickly. And they still like the treats and I like that they are healthier than most.

Dogs love treats, especially those with a meaty flavor and texture. These treats are not quite like that, but they make up for it with their quality ingredients and teeth- cleaning ability. It adds up to a good, quality dog treat overall that is easily worth it to serve to your dog.

title: THIS IS A MIRACLE SUPPLEMENT FOR DOGS WITH DISC ISSUES!!!
text: Two of my three Mini-Dachshunds have IDD, and I started giving them this supplement when one of my dogs didn't respond at all to Prednisone.  THIS IS A MIRACLE SUPPLEMENT!!!  Both of my dogs, who are over 10 years old, are just as frisky as they were when they were pups!  They are both pain-free and able to ambulate without any issues.  Since they've been on Vetri-Disc, they've not had any spinal issues whatsoever, which is amazing since Sophie was having issues every few months.  This supplement has given my dogs new life, and I am thrilled beyond words!!!  Just like a previous reviewer wrote, I wrap the pill up in American cheese, and my dogs can't wait to get it every morning!  Finally, something that works the way it claims to!  I don't know why this supplement isn't recommended by every vet treating IDD!!!

title: Comfortable for a 16 year old dog text: Frankly, I am surprised at how good this bed is since it is a no name random brand. I usually avoid the products from letter soup brands. However, we needed a new large bed for a 16 year old dog and this one has the waterproof liner.

The bed is large enough for one really big dog or two smaller dogs like our elderly Beagle mix and the Entlebucher who like to sleep together. The side bolsters are nice and add some support for the elderly girls. I like that the front is slightly lower than the back so it's easy to step into.

The inner cushion is thick and stiff, supportive, but not hard. The waterproof liner does make a crinkling noise every time the dogs move on the bed, but it is worth it. Our 16 year has some incontinence when she sleeps deeply and she can't help it. After 16 years together, I don't begrudge her a little extra clean up every day. This liner is handy and does protect the mattress. I would definitely consider buying this bed again in the future.

title: variety of nourishing ingredients, great as topper, in treat puzzles, snuffle mats text: The aroma piqued my labs interest, even one who is quite picky. My two labs enjoy this as a food topper. I have a (non grain free) base of food that I stick with for them, but do use other brands as a topper, as a treat, as a stuffer for their treat puzzles, and for sniffing session (in the grass, in a snuffle mat, etc). I often prefer a good quality food over a bag of treats as I do keep track of calories and overall nutrition intake. Lots of good ingredients here, so I am happy to have this for them to have on occasion.

Whenever I use freeze dried food with them, I make sure to add a little water or broth anyway. I just figure they may need extra moisture. Sometimes I let this soak, then it turns into a chunky mash. My dogs think it tastes better than that sounds, lol.

Typical kibble size- roundish and flat-ish

The 4 lb bag is dense, it is well packaged- had a vacuum sealed feel to it. Fresh!

No problems thus far. For us, the 4 lb bag will last quite awhile since it is a supplementary food/treat for us. $20 is a bargain for that purpose!

PS. Take note of the calories. It is on the higher side per cup, so you will likely feed less than you would with many other brands. Feed according to your dogs caloric needs. My girl is on a diet, so I am always aware of these things.

title: 3 dogs like it. Soy free text: We've used the Inception Pork dry food for a senior dog who wasn't tolerating beef kibble well. Her allergies improved over a month, so switching her wet food over to the pork Inception was a reasonable idea. She did great with the all pork, so we tried the chicken and pork version this week.

Three of our dogs have been eating this daily and they all like this food.
The ingredients here are strong without garbage like soy added.
After a week nobody has exhibited any allergic reactions or digestive upset.

The food itself is brownish mush, but much dryer than other pate type canned food. You can see rice bits in it. I mix it with water and it softens up enough for senior dogs with weak teeth to eat comfortably.

title: Excellent dog food from Hills text: My short haired dog has quite the appetite, and quite the urge to scratch himself frequently. I‚Äôm always on the lookout for quality dog food and the combination of nutrition and a food that supposedly helps with skin issues- and digestive concerns- convinced me to try Hill‚Äôs Science Diet Adult Sensitive Stomach and Skin Grain Free Chicken and Potato Recipe Dry Dog Food.

Poured from the ziploc style bag, this dog food consists of small kibbles, each shaped like a flat disk. The dry food is typical of other dry dog foods, so no issues there. My dog likes it about as much as he likes other dog foods. That means he will eat it in due time, but he would much prefer a freshly cooked steak.

With the ingredients, I like that the food is grain free and consists of chicken as the first ingredient, followed by an assortment of other ingredients including several fruits and vegetables. The ingredient list is long and there are certainly a few items in there that could get some dog owner‚Äôs attention, but it is still better than the ingredients found in most other dog foods.

As for the skin and stomach claims, I can vouch that the stomach claims seem valid. My dog doesn‚Äôt seem to have any issues at all surrounding his stomach and his stools are more solid. With the skin, well, I can‚Äôt really detect any difference since he still scratches just as much as before. It could take more time for these positive results to show up, but regardless, the other qualities make this dog food worth purchasing.

I have always had good luck with Hill‚Äôs dog food products and Hill‚Äôs Science Diet Adult Sensitive Stomach and Skin Grain Free Chicken and Potato Recipe Dry Dog Food is certainly an excellent choice for the concerned dog owner. It is free from grain, helps with digestion, and is packaged in an easy to use, reseal bag. Another excellent dog food from Hill‚Äôs, one of the best names in the business.

title: Keeps my little guy healthy! text: Have a 6 yr old Chi-Pom mix who was diagnosed with pancreatitus.

The vet wanted me to get him the really expensive Science Diet food. I opted to try this one. I checked the fat content (research showed must be 9 or less) so this one qualified and wasn't $50 a bag. He only eats 1/2 cup per day, so it lasts a long time.

Been 3 years and he is still doing great!

NOTE: He is so little I should never have tried to change his food to what my other two eat. His tummy was just too sensitive. Now I have everyone on the same food, I don't mix and match per what is on sale. I stick to Purina for the 2 big boys, and Hills for the little guy.

title: About 9" long, 1-2 squeakers in center, looks hilarious dangling from dogs mouth text: It's a sturdy toy, best for gentle play & chew, I think it reminds me of a subscription box level of toy and am very happy with it. Pack of two is nice.

Neither of my labs are heavy chewers. Every toy they have owned over the years have held up, even cheapie toys. I expect this to as well. I wouldn't give any soft toy to an aggressive chewer. I dont know why people do that, and then complain about the toy. Only toys that hold up with aggressive chewers are the harder, rubber style. So if you have a dog that seeks to destroy, then this is not suitable. All play should be monitored.

My big boy looks so silly with this toy dangling out from his mouth. I crack up when he just sits there and looks at me with his "cigar". My girl doesn't really play much with toys, but she will use them to manipulate her toy loving brother to move out from a preferred spot on the couch. She will also use them to engage in some tug of war. Even in that style of play, they are gentle. This toy has held up (so far) to that.

The photoshopped pictures on this product page are hilarious. Just so you know, each toy measures about 9" long. Works well for my bog English labs, but should be fine for the tiny doggos too.

Just a cute set of toys. Throws well, has a good squeak, long enough to engage in various play.

title: My labs consistently love Wag brand treats. My girl really enjoys these crunchy cookies text: Crunchy cookie sized treats that smell good, look good, have great ingredients, priced well, and are packaged nicely in a pressure zip durable plastic bag. We have quickly become a Wag family!

I have two labs. My boy is super picky about treats, but seems to love Wag Chicken n Waffles bites.
https://www.amazon.com/dp/B07V9Z4GZW

And so I buy a big bag for him on Subscribe and Save every month. My girl enjoys most treats, and since the other Wag treats are so well received, we had to try these crunchy biscuits. My girl loves them. Her eyes lit up when I presented a couple of biscuits to her. And my boy...well he snubbed them (not surprised). So I grabbed him a "Chicken n' Waffles" chewy wafer treat instead. They both got to enjoy a nice treat of Wag snacks. We have tried Wag freeze dried treats, chewy jerky treats, chicken n waffle bites, and now these biscuits. All have been good, just a matter of finding what my babies like best and I have had no qualms in repurchasing for them.

Be mindful of calories. Each treat is 34 calories. Not bad, as these are robust, thick cookies. But since my girl is on a diet, I have to be sure to not give her more than a couple per day. I wont let her read the back of the bag as the recommended amount is 7-14 treats for a dog of her size. lol

24 ounces actually is quite a big bag and provides a lot of treats. I may add this into my regular orders, and I would totally feel comfortable giving this as part of a pet themed gift, or as a bag of snacks to have on hand for any visiting doggos. Or to buy for purpose of donation (doesnt break the bank!). I dont rate on price, but it is truly refreshing that these are healthy, quality treats that are really reasonably priced. So many are boutique priced, and these are absolutely as good as those kinds.

I also greatly appreciate a well done product page. There is plenty of information, the pictures are clear, and they have bonus question/answer section that further makes me feel comfortable to purchase Amazon Brand Wag treats for my babies.

title: OK Poop bag holders; Velcro straps will hold on large leashes / not great on small leashes text: There are two poop bag holders in this set with a set of black poop bags in each one. title: What bath?
text: My Corgi, Skip, tends to fidget too much for my back to handle when bath time comes around. So I decided to give these pads a shot. They work!! I spread one full of peanut butter and stuck it to the tub surround wall. A few things to note here... these pads have a lot of suction cups, but they're quite small. My tub surround is tile and due to the size of this pad vs the size of my tiles, I had no option to position it where the suction cups did not align with the grout line in between the tiles. This caused the pad to not want to stick to the wall very well. I would also suggest to not spread your treat (peanut butter, in my case) on to the pad before you put it on the wall. Due to my lack of suction issue, I had to press hard all over the circumference of the pad which led to peanut butter drenched fingers (but Skip was more than happy to help me out with that hiccup lol). So come next bath time, I'll be sure to stick the pad to the wall *first*, pressing anywhere and as hard as I want/need to get the small suction cups to do they're thing... and *then* bring the peanut butter into play. Other than those two minor issues, this pad worked wonders keeping Skip's full attention throughout the entire duration of his bath! When we were done, I called him out of the tub and he looked at me like "Oh! Did I just have a bath?" as if he had totally forgotten even walking into the bathroom to begin with. LOL!! I'll certainly be using these lick pads repeatedly! (I may even have to use both since Skip nearly finished cleaning the peanut butter off the pad before I was done with his rinse cycle!)

title: Potential danger and buyer BEWARE!
text: I bought these to protect my doggie‚Äôs delicate feet when he hangs out in the backyard on the grass. It seems that grass irritates him in between his toes and then he overbathes them. The concept of these socks is simple enough. It‚Äôs like an oversized water balloon. He patiently allowed me to stretch them on to his feet even though this was quite difficult as the ankle opening looked about 10 sizes too small. (I followed sizing measurement, and chose accordingly). The foot part size was fine; however, the leg part was very concerning because it was so tight. Sure enough within about ten minutes of wear, I did a health check on his legs and there was already some apparent swelling above the top due to these cutting off the circulation.  This can do permanent damage so I immediately removed them. With sadness, I began to carefully pack the four that he used in a separate ziplock bag to prepare my return. While I was writing a post it note indicating that these four had now been worn, I noticed black dog hair on the INSIDE of the package that contained the remaining 8 (this was a 12-pack). My dog is blonde. With trepidation, I started to more closely examine the contents and found more stranger dog hair and to my horror found that there were four socks that were soiled with dirt, hair, and other contamination. We are in the state of a GLOBAL PANDEMIC and I now had some other person‚Äôs and dog‚Äôs filth sitting on my kitchen counter. I am not mad at the dog or the persons who returned but am absolutely disgusted with the lack of quality control on the seller‚Äôs part to have allowed this to happen.  It was a plastic container that snapped together. After disinfecting the amazon packaging and outer package of this item, I had absolutely no reason to sanitize further. Excuse my frankness, but a valid comparison would be to buy a men‚Äôs pack of underwear, pull out a few pairs, go back for more as needed and find a skidder stain on the bottom one. This was a gross find in any circumstance, but in the height of Covid danger, it was gross negligence and extremely careless.  If you buy this product, please monitor your dogs legs after 5 minutes and check again every 5 after and for God‚Äôs sake, inspect each sock before use.

title: My Dog Literally Licked His Food Dish Dry! He LOVES Beneful! text: He loves it! Mac LOVES Purina Beneful Superfoods Adult Wet Dog Food! He's already a fan of Beneful dry dog food, both Superfoods salmon flavor and Little Bites beef. He's been eating Beneful dog food his entire life so it wasn't really a surprise that he wolfed down the Beneful wet dog food ! He literally licked his bowl clean!

Mac did experience a few bouts of vomiting after eating the wet food. He was fine immediately after vomiting, it didn't cause any type of illness. He wasn't in any pain. IDK if its due to the fact he's 7 years old and has been eating dry food his entire life and that's why he experienced some vomiting after eating wet food. It didn't happen every single time he ate the wet food. Because of his occasional vomiting, Mac still eats mainly Beneful salmon Superfoods dry dog food but every couple of days I put a spoonful of Beneful wet dog food with the dry food. He wolfs it down and, so far so good. No vomiting My sister also has a bichon. I gave her 3 containers of the wet food for her dog. He didn't have ANY issues at all. I also gave a neighbor 1 container for her dog and he was fine as well. (He's not a bichon...he's a little chihuahua. ) Beneful dry dog food and Beneful wet dog food contain healthy ingredients and wholeome grains. Doesn't matter which one your dog eats, he'll be eating healthy food either way. On an unrelated note, check your Sunday newspaper coupons for Beneful coupons. They're in frequently.

I had a blond moment and accidentally deleted the photo of him eating his Beneful wet dog food. But I DID get a picture of our cat enjoying some Beneful wet dog food! (He only licked the gravy for a few seconds while I took the above picture. This was the ONLY time he ate dog food...and it was just gravy)

You want your furbaby to be as healthy as possible and live a nice, long life. He can do that with Beneful dog food! And its VERY reasonably priced!

title: No soy! text: With 6 dogs in our home, we take nutrition seriously. Our senior dogs are 15 and 16 and still playing and chasing balls.

We mixed this with our regular, high end kibble for a few days. The ingredients are very similar to our usual brand and I'm happy to see WAG doesn't add soy to the food - it's a known allergen for dogs and people.

None of my dogs turned up their snoots at the addition of this food. They all seem to like it and it smells fresh. I haven't noticed any digestive system irritation in any of the hounds. However, this is more expensive than our regular food and that makes a difference when you're feeding this many dogs every day.

Finally, after having basically given up on finding something they would both like, I decided to give Higgins Vita Seed a try. I liked that I could get 2 bags at once and loved the fact that they arrived safely packaged and smelling fresh. Best of all is that Morticia & Gomez eat every single seed and food in their dishes! I am amazed! I've had birds for over 60 years since I was a small girl and never have I seen such a complete consumption of all seed as I do with Higgin's blend. title: Get used to using it if  your're cycling your tank!
text: How to use this is very self explanatory.  Once you've added the drops to the water in the test tube be sure to replace the lid and shape/swirl the tube a bit. Don't put your thumb over the test tube and shake since some of the solutions will burn your skill.  Keep away from children.  Also wait a few minutes after you've added the drops to read it because the color may deepen over time.  That's especially true with the most important one - ammonia.

title: Two of my friend‚Äôs three dogs love this food; the other one gave it a lukewarm reception text: I got this for my friend's¬†dogs¬†to supplement with their other food. Two dogs enthusiastically¬†ate this but the third one gave it a lukewarm reception and just smelled it but would not eat it. As you can see, they are spoiled by being hand fed.

The food itself is small, dark, and¬†round. This is made in the U.S.A. (i.e. Ohio) but I am unsure where the ingredients are sourced from.

The ingredients are good except for the lentils and peas (see note). The first 18 ingredients are¬†¬†buffalo meal, red lentils, green peas, chickpeas, lamb meal, canola oil, carrots, celery, beets, parsley, lettuce, watercress, spinach, tomato pomace, Menhaden fish oil, ground flax seed, natural flavor, lecithin, etc.

Note that unless a dog has a grain allergy, it is not a good idea to feed them grain-free foods exclusively. The reason is that vets are finding an association between heart disease (such as canine dilated cardiomyopathy) and grain-free dog foods. This disease is mostly associated with the foods that have peas, lentils, other legumes or potatoes as their main ingredients and this food has lentils, peas, and chickpeas. Nevertheless, I feel it is okay to feed this food to a dog only to supplement a dog's diet and not as an exclusive meal.

I love that the bag has a zippered closure. This ensures that the kibble stays fresh.

The current price of $17.99 for 4 pounds is competitive but expensive. This is a good supplemental food as long as the dog eats it but I would not exclusively feed grain free.

PROS:

No bulky base, my dog always has hit her feet on the bottom base of raised stands and it scares her. (She‚Äôs handicap and can‚Äôt walk well) She doesn‚Äôt have to stretch so far and can come right up to the bowls.
BEST FEATURE IS YOU CAN USE ANY BOWL YOU WANT!!! Most raised stands use basic bowls, restricting you from using a custom bowl. The trays are large enough for a good size bowl.

title: Definitely controls odors ... text: The look of this cat litter is quite different from the usual "fine grained" clay litter. The "bits' are much larger -- It took a few days for my cats to get used to this. I think they were a little uncomfortable with the "feel" of it, but they got over it fairly soon. I mention this because the difference might cause your cat to resist using the litter box, too. Yes, we had a couple of "messes," but I stuck with it, and they're totally fine with it now.

That said, this stuff really does suppress odors. I usually try to scoop the box at least once a day, but I do sometimes let it sit overnight. With my old litter, I would start to get a whiff of the odor the next morning; not so with this stuff.

It's more expensive, but it might be worth it in the long run. My cats have had allergy problems in the past with clay litters, including unscented, and even some "all-natural" non-clay litters. So far, I've seen no signs of the usual allergy issues with this stuff. That alone will make this worth the expense.

title: Perfect for my needs text: Update: I bought this a little over a year ago, and I am impressed with how well it has held up and how much my cat likes it.

It has been a perfect little "my space" spot for my cat, who is a bit above average size. She naps on both levels, plays on it, and prefers this for sharpening her claws to anything else in the house.

I was initially concerned because as she used the hammock part, it stretched downward. However, this has resulted in forming a nest that seems to be the perfect depth for her comfort, and it has not continued to stretch out past that point. The fabric hasn't shed into the room at all, but there have only been a couple of little fuzz-balls that came loose and ended up in the bottom of the hammock. The entire unit remains sturdy, solid, and in excellent condition.

It was super-easy to assemble; you attach the hammock first, and then the base (essentially, assembling it upside-down). Assembly took me only 1-2 minutes. I haven't needed to retighten or readjust anything at all since first putting it together.

The size and configuration make it easy reposition if desired. It doesn't dominate the room, visually screaming "CAT TREE!" But it seems to give her the same benefits that a larger cat tree would.

This is a product which is truly a great value.

- animal fat
- natural flavor

- etc.

Yes this food is cheap but it has cheap ingredients as well. I think this is best used to mix into the more high brand dog food so that the expensive food can be "stretched."

title: Kitty has more options now! text: We adopted a couple of shelter cats in the fall. We already had one cat. We're definitely having territory issues, so this wall unit gives the kitties more options. They do like to be up high. The instructions were easy enough to follow, though I wish they had added the picture from the product description as a way to place the pieces on the wall. With that being said, the picture on the description has the pieces in reverse which was a little confusing. It says you can hang them anyway you want, but we felt that we needed some specific guidance as to how it would work best for kitties to use. We did have to remove one piece from the wall after installing it because the hole didn't line up well enough for the kitties to access that shelf. We do have some wall patching to do now. Once installed, they seem pretty sturdy. The two new cats are small, but our original one is a bit chonky and I'm not sure if it will work for her. But because of her heft, I don't see her trying it anyway. It looks nice. I haven't seen anyone use it other than the time we placed a cat up there. Time will tell.

*Update - My daughter thought it would be fun to put our chonky cat up on this. I warned her, but she did it anyway. While it didn't fall down, it did become loose. When we installed it, we did not attach it to a stud. Although the directions don't require to find a stud to secure it to the wall, I strongly recommend that you do so.

title: We finally found a wet food our littermates would eat! text: We adopted two inseparable brothers from the same litter a little over a year ago.
The picture is of the two of them snuggling together on their favorite bed.

We had an abundance of canned cat food left over from our previous cat, who sadly had passed of kidney complications. He had his favorites, and I bought like the Coneheads, by the case. We had a LOT of canned cat food left.
Enter the new kids. They were fostered by someone we didn't know, and were adopted through a PetSmart adoption event. WE had no idea what they were eating before they came to us. But let me tell you - they were PICKY.
Cats are notoriously picky eaters, so I expected experimentation. BUT - I was expecting to find favorite FLAVORS, like chicken, tuna, salmon, etc etc.
Nope.
Just nope.

These two were TEXTURE freaks.
Of course, my cases of cat food were not the right texture for them. *eye roll*
While tempting to just say "Starve then!!", of course, I am too soft for that. |
And so began the Great Cat Food Texture Experiment.
We bought several individual cans from an area store - no more cases of stuff until we figure this out!

Shreds - not a chance. Both tried to bury them.
Bits - gravy licked off, the food uneaten and deemed revolting by both food critics.
Chunky - nope. Again, great disdain shown for the insult of trying to serve them chunky food. Eventually, gravy would be licked off and food spit out on the floor. *sigh*
Pat√© - We are getting closer. There was more acceptance of this texture. Good, we are making headway. I buy pat√© in a few brands. Good heavens, the insult!! How dare I feed royalty this peasant chow? But through trial and error, we did finally find one that the royal kings deemed acceptable.
That was Sheba brand pat√©. Yes, they finally found something they like! Hallelujah! (Now, we had never bought Sheba brand of any texture before, because our previous cat had a love affair with Fancy Feast. We bought the Sheba as a shot in the dark.)

So now, they like nearly any flavor, as long as it is Sheba, with the exception of the turkey. That's a hard pass, unless starvation has set in and they have not eaten in a couple hours. LOL But it is at the bottom of their list.
So yes, we spoil our babies and buy their favorite Sheba food, again by the case.

My ONLY complaint about them is that those skinny double-packets are beastly hard for me to open.
My fingers are not as nimble as they used to be. I also fear a painful foil cut while wrestling off the tops.
So now I grab the tab and use a washcloth to keep a decent grip and shield my fingers from the tops.

Sheba has won over the two harshest food critics we've ever owned. For that, I thank them.
I want to be sure they get enough moisture in their diets, and wet food helps with that.
Four paws up at our house for the Sheba Seafood Entr√©es, our boys' favorite.

title: Pink carriers not ‚Äúcr√®me‚Äù colored; comes with 1 carabiner but there are 2 ways to secure to a leash text: There are two soft silicone poop bag holders in this set and one "double-sided clip carabiner" supplied. The color of these holders are light pink. They are not "creme" or flesh-toned in color as the Amazon photo shows. I actually like the pink color much better than the flesh color shown.

These holders work well to carry a poop bag and there are several ways they can be carried. All I have to do is push the knotted bag through the Y slit in the holder and then either hold the carrier with my fingers, hook the loop onto something using the supplied carabiner, or loop the holder around the leash (see photo). This allows me to carry it hands free as long as I am not hooking the loop onto my fingers.

There are two negatives to me. One carabiner should be supplied for each holder. Also, when looping this holder around the leash, the holder slides to the bottom of the leash unless there is a knot or something that stops it from sliding (like a bag clip). Of course, if the leash handle is thinner than the one I have, it can be looped around the handle so it does not slide. Had a carabiner been supplied for each poop bag holder, this would have received 5 stars. At the current price of $5.99, which comes to an expensive $3 per holder in its current configuration of one clip for more than one holder.

We take them out and use pee pads, but they will be dogs and mark places. One  would potty in the entrance hallway just about daily.  My daughter mopped 3 times with this and suddenly there's no more accidents in the hallway.  Not one in several days. Part of the issue was out of anger because they were left at home while we went somewhere, still no accidents in this spot. There are more areas where they still have issues and those will come next.  I got this product cheap due to all the bad reviews. I decided at least it will clean the floor well if it didn't stop the accidents. It did both. It smells nice and works. It did take the 3rd mopping for it to work, so maybe some were just umping the gun. Now I have to stress about where I can find more. It seems the bad reviews have tanked this product.

title: Works ok, not great, but will do for now *** UPDATE 2015 *** text: I bought these after some research, but basically in a rush for steps for an older large dog that had just injured his hip and was in recovery. I need steps for an 80lb Ridgeback that will also hold up to the rest of the pack. I will say this... after 24 hours, the steps are holding up to a variety of dogs in a variety of weights as they try them out and learn to use them. (Meaning that so far the steps have not collapsed or fallen apart) They are NOT all that easy to put together - the so called "Snap together" process isn't quite that simple. They were very wobbly after being "snapped" together, so I took out the hammer and gave several solid whacks on both sides. No more wobbles and there will be no deconstructing these steps either. One note for assembly - none of my pieces were labeled to match the included diagrams in the directions. Not a big deal, the photos were pretty easy to follow and common sense will direct you easily enough, but if you need the literal "Part A attaches to Part B" type directions then be aware that the pieces are NOT MARKED.

The carpet treads on each step do remove and go back into place easily enough with nice wide velcro strips. We have tile floors where these steps are being used and rather than risk any slippage at all, I put a nonslip rug under them before allowing the dogs access. The steps do have little rubber footie things on the underside, but better safe than sorry. It doesn't take up as much floor space as I thought it would and that is a nice plus.

*******************JULY 2011 UPDATE ****************************************************************************************************

These steps have held up really well since I bought them in April of 2010. We've gone through phases of the dogs not using them at all and then every day one or more of the hounds will be using them. The only negative thing I can really say at this point is the angle of the steps is a tad steep for my Dad's Chihuahua. However, 50lb Beagle Mixes and 90lb Rhodesian Ridgebacks don't seem phased at all.

******Update August 2015 ******

After five years, these steps are still in use here and still in one piece. I have upgraded my rating to four stars. I've never been able to take them apart, but they have never fallen apart either. They do need a non slip rug under them for use on wood or time floors, but that's ok.

title: Not as great as I thought it would be... text: I thought these would be a five-star item, but I have to rate it based on my cats' responses.
Of course, every cat is different, just like people, so take my review with that in mind.

I thought the idea of a compressed ball of 'nip was great. I imagined the cats gnawing on it,
rolling it, etc etc. Well, they are only partially interested. Part of the problem might be that
it blends in to our carpet really well. (Note that this hurts like a son-of-a-gun if you step on
it with bare feet!) But I think they have better vision than I do, so I think it is more ME that
has a hard time seeing it than they do!

There is mild interest. Cat 1 will occasionally look at it, give it a lick or two, and move along.
Cat 2 will swat it once in a while, trying to get it to roll under my son's bed where she has one
of her stashes of toys, but that's all. She doesn't chew or lick it.

Both are catnip addicts, so it isn't that they don't respond to the nip. Not sure what it is.
I don't regret the purchase, but it wasn't nearly as fun for them as I had thought it might be.

title: Great, easy to use, pet odor and stain remover
text: My cat recently turned 12 years old.Up until about 6 months ago, I never noticed her having any trouble with the litter box. Not sure if it's her age or not, but I have found several times in the last couple of months after we adopted a small puppy that she has begun having issues. This Nature's Miracle works great. Easy to use, saturate the carpet and clean.No odors, no stains, is probably one of the best stain removers on the market. Again, I am not sure if it's her age or whether there is some jealousy going on with the puppy, but I am happy to keep this Nature's Miracle close at hand for the times she 'misses' where she should be going. I highly recommend for every household with pets to keep a bottle in spare for emergencies.

text: A little over a year ago, I rescued a cat and within weeks was constantly itching and was developing red welts all over his body. title: Returned immediately text: Like any dog bed I purchase for my German Shepherds, having a thick inner foam is extremely important to me for supporting my boys hips and joints. When the bed arrived I placed it on the hard wood floor and sat on it. I immediately sunk to the floor and felt the hard floor under me. I weigh 132.
I then pushed on it with my hand and could easily feel the floor because the foam inside is not dense enough. Very poor quality. My boys weigh 97 and 128 pounds. Honestly Costco beds have been the best ones so far and I guess we will keep buying those. I really liked the concept of the head rest for my pups, but this bed isn‚Äôt made well at all. Yes, your dog will like a new dog bed and eagerly want to lay on it, but as a fur parent you know what‚Äôs best for them. This bed won‚Äôt offer the support needed for large breed hips and joints.

title: Great Quality Dog Treat Made in the USA text: My pair of dogs are regular consumers of treats. I like to feed them treats each day and insist on a high level of quality. A dog treat that meets my stringent requirements is Pet Jerky Factory Turkey Jerky.

Starting with the quality, I felt good about these treats immediately, before I even opened the package. These treats are all natural; no artificial preservatives, colors, or flavors. They are grain free, too, so there are no added fillers that do little to benefit a dog‚Äôs good health.

With the taste, my pair of pups love what these jerky treats offer. One good thing, from my perspective, is that they take a little longer to eat. I don‚Äôt like the treats that my dogs inhale within seconds because it serves little purpose and they immediately want another treat. With these treats, my dogs at least spend a little time chewing. This keeps them preoccupied, and that is good.

Pet Jerky Factory Turkey Jerky are human grade and based on the ingredients and other factors, some people might be tempted to use them for their own midnight snack. Resist, and let your dog enjoy them. They are an excellent, high quality dog treat and one of my dogs‚Äô favorites.

title: Has a ton of fillers, but the cats like the taste text: Okay, I admit it.
I was sucked in my the most adorable, romantic commercials for a cat food product that I have
ever seen. I vowed to buy at least some Fancy Feast each week just to show my support for that commercial! LOL

The cats love the wet food. It is very expensive, and from what I have read on the labels, you are
definitely paying for the IMAGE, not the quality or quantity of the food. (The cans are only 3 ounces
compared with 5.5 ounces in the other can styles.) I still get it, and they love the ones with cheese the most.

So, I thought we'd give the dry food a try. I had my husband grab a bag when he was at the grocery store.
How bad could it be, right? Same company, same "gourmet" promotion on the foods, so surely it has great stuff
in it, right? Well, shocker - NOPE.

Fancy Feast is made by the Purina company in St Louis, MO. They are the same ones who make the generic dog chow,
cat chow, rabbit chow, ________ (fill in the blank with a critter name) chow.
They are all full of fillers that animals don't need,
because it is cheap to manufacture. Why I thought this might be different, I do not know.

First off, food mfgs have found the kitty equivalent of addictive MSG, and load their foods with it.
This one is no different. Note that BOTH our cats went crazy over this food, inhaling it out of my hand
before I could even get more out of the package. Fancy Feast knows how to make things that smell/taste good to cats.
However, most food mfgs know how to make things that TASTE good - how they got there, well, you might not really want to know.

Here's the ingredients list (which is in the order of the QUANTITY of the item) for this "gourmet" cat chow - bear with me, this is
a really long list of iffy ingredients, artificial junk and food coloring):

Brewers Rice
Poultry By Product Meal
CORN GLUTEN meal
Animal fat preserved with mixed tocopherols
Ground Yellow Corn
Soybean Meal
Animal Liver Flavor
Chicken
Turkey
Phosphoric Acid
Calcium Carbonate (in case they get indigestion?! This is what's in Tums!)
Salt
Natural & Artificial Flavors
Potassium Chloride
Dried Yeast
Choline Chloride
Added Color, Red 40, Yellow 5, Blue 2 and "other colors" (Why?!? Cats are mostly color blind anyway)
Taurine
Zinc Sulfate
Ferrous Sulfate
Vitamin E Supplement
Niacin
Manganese Sulfate
Vitamin A Supplement
Calcium Pantothenate
Thiamine Mononitrate
Copper Sulfate
Riboflavin Supplement
Vitamin B12 Supplement
Pyridoxine
Hydrochloride
Folic Acid
Vitamin D3 Supplement
Calcium Iodate
Biotin
Menadione Sodium Bisulfite Complex (a form of Vit K)
Sodium Selenite.

Sounds yummy, huh?
The meat is way down the list, after all the corn, soybean and rice fillers, various meals (meaning
conglomerate of parts chipped up and dried out) and glutens.

How on earth does cat food need artificial food dyes? The cats won't care.
There are many known reactions to food dyes in people - I am sure our pets don't need it either.
Cats are color-blind to most colors, so it wasn't for visual appeal to them.
Was the food too yellow with all the grain meal and gluten, or too white from all the fats?

So, the cats love it.
I will now consider this the equivalent of a bag of potato chips for humans -
okay some times, but NOT all the time. I'll have to watch our oldest cat. He gets super itchy with wheat
grain or gluten in foods, so I'll watch for reactions to the corn.

Cats are carnivorous, and do not eat grains in the wild. However, especially with the manufacturing plant
smack dab in farming country, they can apparently get all kinds of leftover grains cheap?

If you buy this for your kitties, just know that you are buying the IMAGE more than a quality food.
This is not really different than the super cheap pet food. Prettier bag perhaps, but image is
what you are paying for here.

Overall, I was really disappointed to read that ingredients list, when they could do SO much better for our pets.
We'll use this as their treats, rather than their main dry food.
We'll stick with our Blue Buffalo for that, which is grain free and actually has meat for the first ingredient!

Fancy Feast - marketing genius, but sloppy on the actual nutrition.

title: My friend's three dogs LOVED these text: I have once again redeemed myself with my friend's three dogs. A couple of weeks ago I brought over some treats that they would not touch and fell out of favor with them. Well today I brought over these and they LOVED THEM.

These are a perfect size for training as they look and almost feel like hard and lightweight miniature pencil eraser squares.

These treats are a product of Canada, are freeze dried, and the only ingredient is 100% salmon with mixed tocopherols.

Guaranteed Analysis
- Crude protein (min) 50%
- Crude fat (min) 20%
- Crude fiber (max) 1%
- Moisture (max) 6%

Serving is one per day for 10 lb dog and under, 2 for 11-25 lbs, 3 for 26 - 50 lbs, 4 for 50 lbs and over.

As a side note, the Amazon site says these are for cats AND dogs. Although I doubt they would harm cats, the package says dog treats (not cat treats). I even tweeted the company SEVERAL WEEKS ago to find out if these were okay for cats and they never responded so that was a big disappointment to me. Nevertheless, the treats themselves are fabulous and a definite hit.

As of this writing, the price is not posted.

title: Decent retractable leash but double the price another brand text: At the current price of $19.99, this leash is the exact same as this [[ASIN:B07J9XNKLD Menkar leash]] which is listed at $9.99.

I ordered both leashes for my friend's dogs; she runs a dog foster home. This leash has a 16-foot length, is retractable, and both temporarily locks with the push of the button or via the locking mechanism that allows one to release their finger. If the dog tangles the leash or it twists, it will retract in that position. I had that happen and was able "unfold" the leash and retract it back correctly.

It took me some getting use to engage the leash locking mechanism and is even harder to do with a moving dog at the end of the lead.

Overall, this is a decent quality leash but it is double the price of the other brand for the EXACT SAME leash except for the color of the handle. (See comparison photos attached. The Menkar is on bottom and Franklin on top.)
