title: Great in size and material- but, can be destroyed by a puppy! text: These are listed as a pack of 2 at a decent price point but, we only received 1‚Ä¶problem is, we really could‚Äôve used the pair!
Dog chew toy is listed for smaller breed dog‚Ä¶Only, we gave this to our 12 week old pug puppy, (Which for the most part aren‚Äôt all puppies pretty small..?!)
Let‚Äôs just say he had his way with this toy and he won!
‚Ä¢Even with constant observing and instant removal of toy when chewing became abusive- (just like Vet instructs with new pups..dont let them take on bad habits like- aggressive chewing of any item. Only, allow pup the comfort to cut their teeth..) well, in just x1 week- The toy began to unravel, which creates a possible chocking hazard-

‚Ä¢ The material and rope itself seem to be of good quality- so, i‚Äôm guessing the issue is in the secured construction? The rope is beginning to unravel- unwanted Amputation of a limb and pups teeth have punctured into middle of the ‚Äúsqueaky mechanism.‚Äù Again, this is a 6.5lb puppy who inflicted the damage.. so, The integrity is not there if you have a dog that really needs to chew.

‚Ä¢The size is right! It‚Äôs a very comparable size for a puppy or, small breed.. it certainly helps them not be overwhelmed by the sheer mass of a toy.

‚Ä¢I appreciate there are no loose stuffed animal eyes or hanging parts.. Things that would automatically detach and be swallowed! (Problem is, if they kill the toy- The small arms/nose could detach, creating the hazard you want to avoid!!

‚Ä¢I also liked the squeak sewn in.. it has the ability to get your distracted puppies attention! Most of us know, Puppies have the attention span of a 2yr. old!! They are easily entertained yet, easily distracted- the noise definitely Peak their interest.

Overall, this does not work for us and our needs. We‚Äôre definitely needing something with a much stronger/rugged worthy construction right out of the gate. If interested, I suggest knowing your dogs personality first‚Ä¶ for any who have a Chew happy pup- you may want to find an item better suited.

I hope this info helps‚Ä¶ Feel free to let me know!

title: Attractive Retro Design but Things Aren‚Äôt Sized for Maximum Functionality üêπ text: Upon first seeing this red-and-white striped retro hamster setup online, I couldn‚Äôt wait to actually see it in person. It arrived very securely packed and packaged, and assembly didn‚Äôt take me long, but it was a bit of a challenge. This set is unique in that it features an XXL 11.75‚Äù diameter exercise wheel, but the alternating color rays of the wheel insert are the only true ‚ÄúConey Island‚Äù themed attribute about this product.

While the full cage set does include a water bottle, food dish, and shelter cave, they are fairly tiny in size and are much better suited for a mouse. üêÄ I would also only suggest using this cage for temporary housing, transport, or creative enrichment periods.

The cage dimensions are listed accurately, and the wire bars and door feel sturdy and secure. I do believe this set would be fully compatible with all other ‚ÄúFerplast‚Äù brand products and accessories, including tunnel tube add-ons, so the eventual possibilities for layout configurations would be endless. I think it‚Äôs a visually appealing set overall, but the extra pieces simply haven‚Äôt been appropriately sized for maximum functionality.

title: truly waterproof, liquid just sits on top. Good dense material for claws/nails/wear & tear text: So yeh, it sure is waterproof. I bought these for use on couch and dog bed (I bought two) for times when my creek loving labs come in with swamp dampened fur. I never seem to get them fully dried off, so them having a towel or easy to clean blanket helps mop up the rest of their wetness. Been using it like so for few weeks now, washed them a couple of times. Feels dense but soft.

How I found out that they are REALLY waterproof is that once in awhile one of my cats will decide to PEE on the couch or dog bed. I tossed this on their dog bed, which is sort of loose looking (as opposed to couch where it seems to stay straightened out), and I noticed that it was holding pee. The pee had not soaked into the material. SO I carefully picked it up and poured off the pee. In hindsight, I should have tossed a towel on it to soak up the pee instead of trying to walk through the house with a puddle of pee.

It is waterproof. That's great. If using it to keep liquids from a place that can easily be washed, then this will do it. However, I would top it with something that can soak up the liquid. So for me, I will put this on the couch cushion then top it with a big towel or small easy to wash blanket. Then pee (or whatever) will hit that first, soak up, and THIS cover will keep the pee (or other liquid) from seeping down to cushion, mattress, etc.

It's durable feeling material, and I wouldn't hesitate to recommend it for providing extra protection from nails, claws, wear and tear and such, as well as the waterproof aspect. One of the pictures from a review shows what I experienced: the liquid sits on top. So yeh, it is waterproof.

I'll update if I experience anything else worth sharing, especially if I notice it not working anymore.

title: Very good for touch up clipping and quick clean up
text: Very handy for quick touch up trimming at horse shows. We use these to clean up stray whiskers around the muzzle, chin and bridle path for halter and dressage classes. They fit in a pocket, don't make a lot of noise or excessive vibration and most importantly don't require an electric outlet. I also keep a set of these Clippers in my barn first aid kit. They are good for clipping the hair away from an injury in a pinch without adding extra stress to the situation. These are not intended to do a summer clip on a dog or hunter trim on a horse - you need a real, full size pro clipper for that type of work.

title: Surprisingly my cats really like this wet food; many cans arrived dented text: Since Amazon is combining reviews for a multitude of flavors of this type cat food, note that this review is for the [[ASIN:B07PHMHWJC Purina Friskies Gravy Wet Cat Food Variety Pack; YUMbelievaBOX YUM-azing Extra Gravy Chunky - (40) 5.5 oz. Pull-Top Cans]].

There are 40 cans in the box. Note that many of the cat food cans arrived dented (1st and 2nd photo) even though the package was not damaged.

There are 10 cans of each of:

- Extra Gravy Chunky with Salmon in Savory Gravy (3 cats do not like--poultry 2nd, liver 3rd, & salmon 6th ingredient) - 4th & 5th photo

- Tasty Treasures with Ocean Fish, Tuna, & Cheese in Sauce (3 cats like--liver 2nd, fish 5th & 9th, & chicken 6th ingredient)

- Indoor Chunky Chicken & Turkey Casserole with Garden Greens (3 cats LOVE--chicken 2nd, liver 5th, & turkey 9th ingredient) - 3rd photo

- Tasty Treasures with Turkey & Cheese in Gray (2 cats like, 1 cat LOVES--turkey 2nd & liver 3rd ingredient)

My three cats use to love Friskies a long time ago but then stopped liking it. I tried many other types of food, including very expensive ones. Finally, the only type they would eat is the Fancy Feast brand and only several different flavors. Therefore, I was excited to try Friskies again and they love this more than their Fancy Feast.

Usually, I feed only one 3 ounce can of Fancy Feast per day to three cats because they do not each much. However, with this Friskies, I am able to feed them two 5.5 ounce cans per day and they eat most if not all of it. The only one they dislike is the salmon. They lick the gravy off the salmon dish and leave the rest.

Overall, this is a hit; however, I do not care for the dented cans. At the current price of $23.25 it comes to a reasonable .58 cents per can.

title: Contains black and red pepper. Not ok text: I want to like these for my dogs. However, they have two flaws that means I won't ever buy these in the future. I do appreciate that they did not use cheap, garbage ingredients like soy. And all 7 dogs like the flavor and texture of the treats.

The first problem is they go bad if you don't use them in just a day or two. The bag and listing should stare clearly that these need refrigeration after being opened. The second, more serious problem is the inclusion of black and red pepper!! In dog treats. Pepper! That's asking for gastrointestinal trouble - especially in older dogs. We don't feel comfortable giving more than one per dog every day at the most.

title: Happy with this bed text: My dog seems to really like this bed, but he doesn't LOVE it. He still chooses to sleep in my bed about 5 nights out of 7, but every now and then, he'll choose this bed instead. During the day, since it's next to my desk, he sleeps in it more and seems to go about 50/50 between it and the couch or my bed. He's a nester, so he curls up small, even though he's a big, brawny 75 pound pit bull. This bed is plenty big for him AND a king-sized human pillow that he loves to sleep with. If he liked to really stretch out, this bed would not be big enough, but he curls up 80% of the time, so it suits him just fine. It's a little softer than I thought it would be, so to add some stability to the bolstered sides, I put a 2-inch thick piece of egg crate foam underneath the sleeping part, and I had an old king-sized duvet that I just sort of rolled up and I put that butting up to and just under the bed on 3 sides - it's against a wall, so there are only 3 exposed sides. The rolled-up duvet helps to "bolster" the bolsters. He's a heavy dog, so he needs the extra support. Would have given it a 5 if the bolstered sides were firmer and the sleeping surface a little thicker.

TIP: Instead of disassembling the bed to wash the cover - just buy a crib-size sheet or two, they have them in cozy flannels - and then just cover the bed with the sheet. This way you just strip off the dirty sheet and replace with the extra one and it takes about 10 seconds or less.

title: These are okay, but you can do better for your cat & wallet text: We have two cats who are addicted to treats.
Okay, we made them that way. We fed them Temptations for years, before we really took the time to read the labels and understand what the ingredients really were. That brand is about the same as flavored potato chips for humans - flavor enhancers are added to make us crave the item. Temptations does the same for your cat. No wonder they didn't want to stop eating them!

Anyway, we were on the hunt for a healthier treat that wasn't full of kitty junk food.
Both our cats love chicken and could care less about tuna or fish flavors, so this was one of the items we tried.
The ingredients are top-notch, and the treat's size is really good for cats.

However, while both cats get excited about the bag being opened (like a can opener sound or popping the lid on wet cat food),
I could swear I hear them sigh when they see this bag! While they do eat these, it isn't a favorite by any means. Both will eat a few pieces then walk away, almost unheard of in all previous treat feeds of all brands. I can leave a few out and they'll get eaten, but it is probably out of boredom, not because they want them. One of our favorite games with both cats is tossing a treat for them to catch. They both love to do this, but are too bored to play catch with these treats. While I am glad that these do not contain the kitty version of MSG, it also needs to have something more appealing to the cats too.

There is enough chicken in this to make it a decent product for your cat. However, there also doesn't seem to be a lot of flavor, in their opinion. While I did not buy mine at Amazon, no matter where you shop, Halo treats are pretty costly, given what
they are - little round pieces of cat food.

We won't be buying them again. For a few dollars more, we can get a 3-lb sack of very healthy cat food that we can use as treats instead. Right now, we are using Blue Buffalo cat food as their treat. They both adore it, it is full of healthy ingredients too (despite being more grains than I really think cats need), and you get a lot more value. We also use Eukanuba dry food as treats, and both of those brands are very popular with both of our cats.

So, while everyone's cats have different likes/dislikes just like we humans do, I'd put my money into some other brand.
If this one came way down in price, then it would be an okay value as an extra treat.
But, for the premium pricing on a bag of treats, you can do just as well by your cat with other brands.
There is nothing really special about these, and don't have either the flavor or fragrance to get our cats too excited about them.
I think we were all a little disappointed with the Halo chicken treats.

For those who are interested, I listed the ingredients and guaranteed analysis below.

The ingredients are (as shown in picture):
- chicken
- yellow pea powder
- potato starch
- vegetable glycerin
- brown rice flour
- dried ground black beans
- cracked sorghum
- dried plain beet pulp
- chicken fat
- bacon
- salt
- sodium bisulfate
- natural smoke flavor
- dried cultured skim milk
- onion powder
- iron oxide

- rosemary extract

The guaranteed analysis is:
- crude protein min 9%
- crude fat min 9%

title: Why can't they send the unscented with the system in the first place?
text: Thank you cat genie for the unscented sanisolution.  The so called "fresh scent" that came with the cat genie system that I got was so awful that it gave me a headache and one of my cats nearly refused to use the litter box.  I Ordered the unscented and a couple days later after struggling to get my second cat to consistently use his nice, clean, (expensive!), new litter box,  he finally started to use it.  The smell of the fresh scent is too over powering and it must be made with flowers.  I am allergic to flowers and I get terrible debilitating headaches.  I'm guessing the fresh scent has flowers in it and that's what was making me so sick.  Why can't you sell 2 versions of the cat genie.  One with the fresh scent and one with the unscented so your customers can choose from the start.  Or even better, sell it with both cartridges so we can try both and know which one suits our needs best without having to wait days for the unscented version to show up.

title: Does not appear to contain much meat
text: I keep trying different dry dog food in the hopes that my dog will find one that he really likes.  Dry is better for his teeth that wet food or human food.  Unfortunately this is just one more that he didn't eat.  I have tried several of the Amazon Solimo products and find them to generally be of comparable quality to name brands and I certainly would try any of the products over a name brand when the price is better.  The price for this dog food seems reasonable, but I think for a few dollars more you could get a much higher quality dog food.  What I didn't realize when I ordered this is that CORN is the number one ingredient in this food and not chicken.  It is only chicken flavored, which could mean just about anything.  As with any dog food, if you are okay with the ingredients and the price, try it and see if you dog likes it.  Just like people, dogs have their own individual tastes.  I think the Solimo brand (which I think is rather new) shows a lot of promise, but of course some of their products will be better than others.  This food claims to meet certain feeding standards, so it is worth trying to see if your dog relishes it or shuns it.

title: Watch Your Cats Turn Into Playful Kittens With These Catnip Toys!
text: Last week, my 'on again, off again' bout with insomnia was back on. After 2 sleepless nights, I was finally exhausted and ready to go to sleep. I climbed into bed for a short mid-afternoon nap. Just as I was drifting off to sleep, a loud thud (and I do mean LOUD) followed by a scratching noise had me wide awake.  Turns out, the cat's Legendog catnip toys had arrived! My husband had placed the packaging envelope on the dresser for me to open (he didn't know what was inside) after my nap but our cat Squeaky, had no intention of waiting for me to wake up! lol.  It was he who hopped on the dresser once he caught a whiff of the catnip and knocked a bottle of perfume off (didn't break it, thankfully) and began to scratch away at the envelope to try to get the toys out. lolol. These toys are SO SO SO cute! They come in a VERY nice bag-(so nice if these are a gift for someone, you won't need to wrap it! ) All 5 toys are soft and such cute designs. They're well made.  No holes or loose strings/threads anywhere. And, of course, they've got catnip in them. These toys even have our other cat, Miss Piggy playing like never before. She is 10 years old and was never super into cat toys, lasers, etc. .  She likes to sleep and...sleep! Now that she had her Legendog catnip toys, she has more energy than ever before.  She goes bonkers for the toys, batting them all over the house, pouncing on them and chewing them. You'd never know these cats of ours are 11 and 10 years old, they're BOTH acting like playful kittens now! After over a week of daily play from 2 cats, all 5 toys are still in exceptional condition.  Legendog cat nip toys are definitely worthy of gift giving. They're SO well made and provide hours upon hours of fun for cats.  I noticed they are an 'Amazon's Choice' product, meaning they are 'highly rated and well-priced products'.  And they definitely are! I went to the Legendog store's Amazon page and realized our dog Mac has the Legendog hedgehog toy which is one of his favorites. He's had it for YEARS and plays with it often.  Its still in exceptional condition. I definitely recommend Legendog catnip toys for your furbabies.  Have fun watching your cats turn into playful, energetic kittens right before your very eyes!

title: One dog likes it. Second dog hates the smell & taste & had severe flatulence text: I spoke to my vet about using this mushroom powder first. He looked at the ingredients and suggested using just the smallest dose first with only two specific dogs in my pack. That might have been a good plan, but we had drama.

The two dogs (of five total) in question are healthy. One is 11 years old and the other is roughly 5 now with a history of heartworms when we found him on the street 20 months ago. (He's negative now) I've been adding just 1/8 of a teaspoon to their dry food mixed with water. The 11 year-old, Sue, will eat her food with this additive happily and has no digestive issues afterwards.

Traveler though..... well he absolutely hates this stuff. He will sniff his bowl, nose every kibble piece around and deliberately pick out each one that a coating of the mushroom powder. Then he eats the rest - this is a dog who typically, joyfully inhales anything he sees in his dinner bowl. He's also experienced unusual and expressive flatulence in the four days with this added. We're done. I'm not going to continue feeding it to either dog after today.

title: DOGS WERE NOT ENTHUSIASTIC ABOUT IT
text: In my mind, Hill's has always been a good quality premium brand, but I had never used it before, so I thought I would try this for my dogs.  They will eat it, but don't seem very enthusiastic about it.  It probably will never be a favorite of theirs.  My sister said her cats don't like Hill's either.  In all fairness most of the dogs I have had over the years prefer firm food and none have liked the "stew" type of dog food very much, which this is.  At least I gave it a try, but wouldn't get it again.  If your dog likes this type of food, before you buy a case, I would suggest trying a few cans to see if they like it that well.  Just like people, dogs seem to have their food preferences.  This could be a good healthy treat for dogs who normally eat only dry food.

title: 6 of 6 Ridgebacks say yes, not for toy or small dogs, no flatulence or digestive problems text: I discovered these at Tractor Supply with a coupon and tried them on a whim for our big dogs. The bones are a rectangular shape and about six inches long, two inches thick and solid. These are big, heavy, edible chewy goodies. My pack really likes them and so far, one a day for four days, I have seen no upset stomachs or problems and none of the dogs have had any excess flatulence either. Glad to know that I can get them from Amazon too.

I have given these out at bedtime and the Heathens tend to take their time and enjoy them - maybe 10 minutes before it's gone. In the morning though, all excited and happy, my Ridgebacks would finish one of these off in half that time. One thing - this is not a toy breed size chew or really suitable for an elderly dog with weak teeth, it's just too dense.

title: Good odor control, Fred likes it ... text: Arm & Hammer offers a wide range of cat litter products, including several in the "Clump & Seal" line. I've tried a number of them over the years -- some work better than others for my cat and me. This one is a good one for us.

My cat, Fred, isn't terribly picky but he does have some skin allergies usually related to scents in kitty litter. I'm happy to say this one, although scented, doesn't trigger his allergy. I like that it's lighter weight than other litters, and the scent isn't awful (some of the are really too strong or "flowery" -- this one isn't). It does clump nicely and seems to control odor better than a lot of other brands.

I'm willing to purchase another box of this to see how it works long term, but so far I really like it. And so, it seems, does Fred.

title: Works great for me!
text: I did a lot of research before buying this. I have 2 cats, and I will not tolerate a smelly house. After researching, this seemed to be the best one for me. It has a few things I don't like, but I really love it because my house doesn't smell at all. I mean really...no litter pan smell. There are a few things that could be better. When the rake dumps the dirty litter in the waste container, there isn't a tight seal. Because of this, you end up with litter on the floor under the box. Also, I do not like that I have to keep buying the waste receptacles. They could have made it where a bag can fit over the receptacle so that you can just change the bag instead of the whole plastic receptacle. I ordered a box of them, and they arent cheap. Another thing is that the rake sometimes doesn't get the clumps if your kitty tends to urinate in the same spot. Every day, I have to take the scooper and scrape the bottom of the pan to get everything up. I know it seems like I have a lot of complaints, but I really do like it. I give it 5 stars for containing the odor!

title: My 15-yr-old kitty did NOT like this ... text: I have a 15-yr-old kitty with allergies (both food and litter), so I always look for grain-free food. This looked like a decent choice -- ingredients list was acceptable (duck, chicken, turkey, cod, some nutritional supplements, etc.). His usual food is a "surf & turf" variety with duck, salmon, chicken, and some veggies.

First mixed some of the new Nulo food with the old surf & turf. He ate a few pieces of Nulo but seemed to be eating "around" it, going for his old food. After a couple of days of this, I swapped out his old food for 100% Nulo. Uh ... no. He was NOT having it. Really went out of his way to avoid it, cried pitifully in the kitchen for me to please come and feed him (he also gets a small amount of canned food each day).

Still not sure what the problem is, except he really just didn't like the taste. I tried for 3 days to get him to eat it, but he wouldn't touch it, and at his age, I don't want to stress him too much by withholding food just to get him to eat something he doesn't want.

This is not to say that all cats will hate this -- the mixture of reviews here attests to that -- but for my guy, it didn't work. Sorry.

title: can you make this human size, because I want to curl up in this. So soft & cozy feeling! text: Goodness, this dinosaur is really cute. I think I got it more for me than for my cats. I should have gotten the pink flamingo too. But there are only so many cat scratchers/climbers we need (consoling myself for not springing for both, lol). The climber is small, but it is true to size in their product description measurements. It is easy to put together, and is even nicer quality, look, and feel than expected. So soft!

My big gentle lab who loves his stuffies really wants to play with this. My cats aren't sure what to make of it yet. As with any new cat item directly from box, they are wary. I will need to douse it with cat nip to help lure them onto it. There is plenty of space on top for them to sit. The cubbyhole area is questionable. I have fat cats, I know they will fit, but I imagine it will be easier for a smaller or more slender cat to move around in it. The support poles inside are covered with same soft material, which I find impressive. The scratchers are small, so I wouldnt get this for the scratchers, but they do add visual interest, and who knows.. maybe they'll be used, especially the angled one.

It is light weight, but fairly sturdy. I would prefer a wider base. On the plus side, the angled cat scratcher gives it additional stability. I wouldnt want to omit that item.

OMG LMAO.. I just saw this in their product description: "The cat tower with scratch post is perfect for naps, fur cleaning or uninterrupted sleep but also for playing, starring and judging your poor life choices" Hahahahahahahahaha!!!!! ok, THEY KNOW CATS (and cat lovers). Thanks for the chuckle, catry. Well done.

The dinosaur tail has crinkles in it. I imagine that some cats may enjoy smacking that around a bit. If I were a kid, I would like this just to use for playing with little toys, dolls, etc. As of right now, I have it sitting next to a recliner, and the way it is positioned, I can use it as a mini table. I'll probably put it in a better spot for my 3 cats, but right now I like it situated next to the chair.

I already have some Catry products that have held up over the years, and that good impression led me to getting this. Might have gotten it for myself more than my cats, but who knows. I imagine in the right location and after a few more days (I just put this together) they will like it. My house has lots and lots of fun cat stuff and this is another fun additon. I personally like it. Easy assembly.

I'll add some pics soon

title: Super adorable pet sweatshirt for dogs or cats but it has NO leash hole text: This is really a super adorable pet sweatshirt (that they call a sweater). The patch on the back is actually a full pocket that goes all the way through. It is fleece lined and the extra small will probably fit a 5-pound dog or cat. I actually ordered this for my cat thinking he would be able to stretch into an extra small but this is too small for him as he is 10 pounds. I use sweaters to keep him calm at night because it stops his crying.

I think this sweater is perfect for outdoors and will keep a pet warm in cool weather, such as spring or fall. However, the BIG negative is that it does not have a leash hole and that is desperately needed if this is being used when walking a dog or cat. As designed, the pet owner would have to thread the leash underneath the sweater collar to hook into the collar or harness.

Overall, this is very cute but it needs a leash hole.

title: Heavy-duty, high-quality stretchable leash; handle not as padded as I like; clasp lock excellent text: This leash is 46 inches from tip to tip--perhaps it stretches 6 feet. The handle is not as well padded as I expected. The rope weave is very strong and stretches with a dog's pull. The hook is ample and swivels 360 degrees. This is a great leash for a medium-sized to large dog that pulls a little. It is a great leash except that I expected more padding in the handle area.

LEASH FEATURES
- heavy duty carabiner with safety lock
- seat belt buckle
- rotating clasp
- two lightly padded handles (one next to carabiner and one where expected)

The current price of $16.14 is competitively priced for the quality of this leash. If the handle were heavily padded as the Amazon description claims, this would have received 5 stars from me.

title: Motion detector stops launches too soon text: I thought this would be an amazing new toy for our dogs - especially the German Shepherd/Husky/Border Collie puppy. Ball is life for Natalie. Unfortunately, there is one huge problem with this thing. The motion sensor on the front stops the launch of each ball until it's clear. That sounds like a great safety feature, except the darn thing is way too sensitive and the distance set is too far out.

The unit launches the first ball. Dog runs to snatch it. Dog drops the ball near the machine and waits for the next launch. And waits. And waits. And waits. Dog gives up and goes away. Machine launches the second ball and dog is no longer in the area or interested. This happens because the motion sensor trips at 10 feet away and closer even when the dog is to the side of the machine rather than directly in front of it. Additionally, the balls are tiny so if you have a big dog, these could easily present a choking hazard.

title: Not for shredders or chewers at all. Lots of bounce text: This is both a great toy and a terrible toy in my house with six dogs. I have three dogs who are perfectly suited for this - they squeeze without biting and are happy to bounce and chase this ball. The other three are all about catching, shredding and destroying these types of things immediately. So you definitely want to consider your dog's personality before buying this.

It's soft and gets lots of bounce and random rolling when tossed and it squeaks like crazy. My three soft mouth dogs have had a ball playing with it for well over a week now. However, if the other dogs got hold of it, I would have a pile of fuzz in a few minutes.

title: Easy clean brush; doesn‚Äôt pick up as much hair as my other brushes; love the lock text: This brush's best feature is that it is a cinch to clean. Its second best feature is the¬†locking mechanism to lock the tines in place. With many other¬†brushes I have to hold the button down. I just engage the bristles by pushing them out and locking the tines in place and then brush my cats. When I am done, I disengage the lock to retract the bristles. The hair remains on top and can be slid off. It is a cinch to use. As is typical with brushes like these, the bristles do not grab the hair like my wire brushes do. This means it does not pull off as much hair as the stationary brushes.

Note that this is for long-haired pets only; I would not use this with a pet with short hair.

The current price of $12.99 is competitively priced.

title: Best litterbox for containment and ease of scoop text: I have used this style of litter box for years and it truly is the easiest way to "scoop" litter. Now the one weak point on all of these is where the top and bottom half connect. The sliding locks can slide open and then there is just enough litter spillout to keep you from re-locking the slider. So you do want to check the sliders before rolling. (or at least every few days.)
But otherwise, it is fabulous.

title: tolerated well by my lab w/ lymphoma, but not really sure if it made an impact, worth trying text: Worth the try. I am sure some folks are here because their sweet baby was diagnosed with some form of cancer and learned about Turkey Tail mushroom extract as a great fighter of cancer. Others may be here as a preventative, or as a preventative for their surviving babies after one passed. The following info is less about the product and more about our total experience. The short of it is that my girl liked this, tolerated it very well, and I gave it to her for the duration of her terminal cancer. She was diagnosed on the 18th of Janurary, we started this on the 24th. She passed yesterday February 27th

I bought this as a reaction to learning about my sweet 7 years old English yellow lab being diagnosed with lymphoma. She was always healthy, always spry. I didnt expect her to develop an aggressive, terminal cancer. With great consideration, we went the route of palliative care with high dose prednisone. We knew it may not provide a lot of time, but the time we have should be good, no stress, and she'd be at home doing all the things we are used to. No added complications from more intense chemo options (but that is fine if you choose that route. We all have decisions to make and consider). We loved and adored as usual. Really nothing changed for her.

I added in additional supplements, with this Vet Smart formula being the foundation of it all. I liked that it includes other supplements that are often mentioned in articles. I decided to use this day and night, as well as top it off with an extra dose of turkey tail mushroom (another product).

She did really well the first two weeks on the high dose prednisone and this supplement. She had no problem eating this mixed in with food. It smells good. Has a lightly meaty aroma and I found it pleasant. So did she. When the prednisone dose was dropped down, within a week her lymph nodes swelled back up. We went back to the high dose, and other than continued comfort (and added desire to eat), her nodes continued to swell all over. Her stomach was greatly distended.

We checked her quality of life frequently. We knew we werent going to keep her going for us. Our duty as a loving care giver is to be able to make that choice for THEM not us, as hard as it is. We decided which portions of her life created our Molly, and if those areas diminished, then we know that her quality of life diminished. Does she eat, does she play, does she snuggle, does she play with her lab brother, does she go for her special stuffy, does she get happy to see mommy/daddy/grandma, and so on.

Truthfully, it was hard to tell. But a couple of things indicated that she was simply getting tired. Could tell that she wanted to do all the things, but she was just wearing out. Her cancer was using up all her resources despite all the good quality food and supplements. She let us know, and we made an appointment with Lap of Love. We told her about it, and even told her how many hours (it would be 36 until appt). The day before the appt, she really perked up. Quite a bit of energy and loved seeing a couple of family member visits. It was a great day, great night, and we had that momentary thought-- is it too soon? But hubs and I both remembered that it is better a week early than a day late. But come morning- the morning of the in home appt-- she didnt want to to get up. She seemed to be sleeping. But she was awake and aware but not shifting position at all. We stayed at her side, verbally loving on her, not touching her much as we werent sure if any of the nodes were pressing on parts that are uncomfortable. she seemed to be checking out, so to speak. Thankful that the vet would be coming and thankful that our little girl really confirmed for us that she was done. She seemed comfortable (non pained) and was just such a sweet brave girl. When vet arrived, my little girl wagged her tail. Nothing else moved, but she wagged her tail. She could make eye contact with us, and I knew she knew we were all there with her and for her. Passing was peaceful. We did right by her.

------->>>So, if you read this far, I would just say.. go ahead and give this a try but know that it may not make a difference. Some cancers may respond, some not at all. I know it didnt hurt her any, but not sure if it helped any. At no point did I decide not to use it. In fact I went through about 2 bottles worth, using it morning and evening, 2 scoops at a time. It's pricy but the additional supplements beyond one type of mushroom appealed to me, and I bought/used a separate high quality turkey tail mushroom supplement in addition to this. Dont go broke if you cant afford this. It may not be the fix you hope for.

I personally am a huge fan of mushroom supplementation as use products similar to this for my own use. Due to all the stress of the past 6 weeks or so (and going forward with my loss of my soul girl) I am doing what I can to support my own nutritional needs.

title: Shows you how inaccurate your heater is
text: Since I test my water frequently with two devices (one being this one) and they always match within a tenth of a degree - I'm always SHOCKED at what temperature I have to set my heater on to actually get anything close to the temperature - they are all just way off. The biggest problem is that most heaters you set in Celsius while most of us prefer to read it in Farenheight.  The Celsius settings on my heaters are just not fine enough to translate into the temperature you need/want.  Never by a "preset" heater - every one I've tried is as much as 3 degrees lower than it's supposed to be - most are set to 78 - well I have fish that need at the minimum 78 and I never get more than 75 degrees.  So these are a lifesaver if you really need accurate temperatures, Do make sure you move it around in the tank - in all fairness it can change dramatically at different locations;  But I believe this device far more than I believe my heater's readings (because you can't move the heater around as easily.

title: Only grooming tool you will ever need text: WOW. I opened this and approached my incredibly large and hairy cat. He let me brush him with it and after about 10 minutes he was nearly bald LOL. Ok, that is an exaggeration but it certainly took A LOT of his matted undercoat off and though it took a long time, I finally got it so that not much was coming off. When I picked him up he was so silky and his fur felt so much softer.

This tool is fantastic. I cannot recommend it highly enough.

My cat loves it. He even flipped himself over and had me do the other side. He just layed and purred and purred and purred while I brushed him.

If you have a cat.....GET THIS. You won't ever need anything else!

title: Looks good, functions correctly text: With 7 dogs in our pack, we take collars and harnesses and leashes seriously. Our dogs range from 2 to 16 years old and from 25 to 70lbs - all of them wear only martingale style collars. The martingale style is so much safer, more comfortable and reliable than those old fashioned choke collars. The loop provides an extra bit of stopping power if you're still leash training, but it doesn't pinch the skin or twist against the trachea. We still use a harness for walks though - much safer than any leash/collar combo.

This one is decently made and the stitching is solid. The loop operates correctly and releases with release of leash pressure. The blue is bright and cheerful. It's a nice couce as an every day, constant wear collar.

text: We recently added a cat to our family and had no idea where to start when it came to food. Our vet recommended we do a combination of dry and wet cat food. We were originally using a different brand of dry food but found the Tiki Cat wet food at a nearby pet store. Our cat devoured the Tiki Cat wet food! Once this was introduced, he was no longer interested in the dry food. It was so disappointing. That is, until we tried this Tiki Cat dry food. He devours it just like he does the wet food. We honestly won't be buying any other cat food from now on. Highly recommend.

title: Real Meat and My Dog Loves Them text: My dog is a little spoiled. He has to eat his regular dry dog food, but he is a good and loyal family pet so we feed him treats several times per week. I prefer treats that are at least a little more nutritious than average and one that fits my requirements is Wag American Chicken Breast and Flaxseed Jerky Treats.

Packaged in a resealable bag, these dog treats are jerky- like treats and are made with chicken as the main ingredient. The smell is less pungent than other dog treats, so we humans won‚Äôt cringe quite so much when we open the bag.

One thing that sets these treats apart is the assorted sizes. The bag is filled with pieces, of all different sizes, which contrasts to other dog treats, many of which try to stay consistent in size and shape from one treat to the next. I like the way Wag treats are sized differently because I can assess how large of a piece I think my dog should get and find an appropriate size.

These dog treats are slightly chewier than others, but only a little. It still won‚Äôt take your dog long to eat them- mine finished his off in under a minute. He seems to really like the taste and smell of these treats and when you factor in the emphasis on meat in the ingredients, these treats are easily better than average and one I recommend.

title: Popular fun toy with 5 dogs text: [[VIDEOID:ff1302038e82626fda856df979a3bb82]] This is a very popular toy with our pack of five dogs. It vibrates, bounces along the floor and makes a LOT of sounds. The Blue Heeler and German Shepherd mix both chase and push it with gusto.

The Plotthound and Coonhound mix both catch it, shake it and are actively interested in killing it. The lapsize Heinz 57 dog is intent on ripping the cover to shreds. Despite serious abuse over several days, the batteries are holding up and the motion/noise is working great. I'll end up having to throw the cover out soon though and making a new one.

title: Surprisingly strong biodegradable poop bags; bags not always easy to open text: I did not expect these bags to be so sturdy because I tried biodegradable garbage bags in the past and they were horrible.

There are 22 rolls of 15 bags each roll for a total of 330 bags with one nice dispenser to hang off a leash or keyring.

I tested this using my cat's litter pan urine and poop. Since their waste also has abrasive litter pan granules in it, this is a better test for the bag. Nothing fell through. These are perfect from the strength standpoint. However, the bags are sometimes difficult to open which is the only negative I see.

title: Kitty Approved
text: This is so much better than a little hand held laser pointer! We have this in the kitchen. When it's on, and motion is detected, it does emit some sounds. It's similar to the noise when someone activates a motion sensor in a movie - kind of like a warning that somethings going to happen. Once activated, it points the laser in various patterns. It pauses to allow the cat to catch it and then moves again. We have 3 older kitties (8, 10, and 11 years). The oldest one has gone crazy over this! She attacks, jumps, and chases it for several minutes at a time. It has been so fun watching her. We're currently using the suction cup that comes with it to hang it up, but it also comes with a mount that you can screw to a wall and some double stick tape. I have been very impressed with this and it is working much better than I had expected.

title: AWESOME STUFF!!!
text: AMAZING!!! My cat peed on my new leather sofa. And not in an easily cleanable area, either. He peed right where the two bottom cushions and the two top cushions all come together! Nothing worked to remove the odor. I tried for 6 months to clean it trying so many products. Nothing worked til I found this stuff. It took about 2-3 soakings to get it all out, depending on the cushion and how bad it was. The smell of this product is reminiscent of cinnamon. It did not just "mask" the odor and cover it with a new smell. It actually took the ammonia smell out! And if you have ever experienced cat pee, you know how difficult it is to remove.

title: My 2 little dogs love it. text: I just received this food for the first time. I have been giving my dogs Rachel Raye dog food for a while, just another variety without the vegies etc. So, this time I thought I would try it. WOW let me tell you, I dumped a little on top of their food and both dogs were right there eating immediately. And, it smells pretty good out of the bag too. You can see the dehydrated vegetables and tell it looks like better feed as well.
My older gal has a lot of anal gland issues and gluten/wheat problems,,, she sctatches and cant sleep if she gets to much wheat or corn and these foods seem to be doing the trick. Plus she is old and has just a few good teeth left and this food is crunchy but not super hard like others we have tried in the past So, I think we will be buying this on our subscribe feature in Amazon going forward. (Its rough getting old LOL)
08/17/2021 - Update. I ran out of this and went to the store for a Rachael ray substitute. When I poured the other into their bowl, they both just looked at me as if to say..... REALLY??
They are eating it but its clear I will have to mix it in with the Super premium when it arrives thursday. My Toby just loves the carrots, peas and chunks.
I went to Walmart & Meijer ... could not find this specific food at either store.

title: 3 cat household approved. . Minced bits can be mashed up a little more if need be text: My three cats like it. I have tried a few varieties now by Kitzy. My cats seem to like it all. They can be picky, and will walk away from food. With this, I tend to see empty plates.

I like that there are several options to choose from. My cats are more about the gravy, but they will eat some moist pate. I use it more as a treat, so the smaller 3 ounce size is perfect. My one girl is demanding of wet food. She gets a bit hangry without it. So I keep a variety on hand for her desires.

Sometimes if I see bits left behind (they licked off the gravy), I will add warm water to it and mash it up. Gives it new life, and they may polish it off that way. Sometimes they see straight through my shenanigans. lol

title: Great quality dog food!
text: Absolutely great dog food. I was immediately impressed with the list of ingredients and seeing that cod was the first item on the list. Also has supplemental vitamin properties (B-12 and C). And, from my dog's point of view, she loved the food. Given that she is a super picky eater, I was thrilled to see her immediately smell and continue to chow down. My dog is not overweight by much, but she does have a tendency to be a little lazy and sleeps quite a bit, so I have always been concerned about her putting weight on in her later years (she is just about 3 years old now). So, this Trim variety is perfect for her. I am thrilled (as is she) with this Nulo brand and variety!

title: Works well if the pet tolerates the paw submersion text: This is not only for dogs. I got this for one of my cats because he repeatedly gets sick and steps in his vomit. This helps clean his paws. I use a little bit of Dawn with warm water and then put one paw at a time in the chamber while turning it back and forth. The silicone bristles help cleanse the paw. The instructions are on the box but photos would be good too.

I dry this by pulling off the top and removing the silicone as shown in my photos.
What is unique about this one compared to some other silicone paw cleaners is that it has a silicone brush on top. The top pulls off instead of having to be screwed off. It also comes with a lanyard that is a bit hard to "install."

The current price of $12.50 is reasonable for this. Note that this comes with a cheap blue cloth--it is not premium as described. I first saw these types of paw cleaners at Duluth Trading Company in New Jersey and was impressed; however, the price there is over $21, so this is still a better deal. If a pet will not tolerate this, then no matter how good this is it will be useless. I already¬†gave a few of these to my neighbor's and one neighbor says her¬†dog loves this. She said this works well, so in her case this is 5 stars.

title: Very Disappointed
text: Just last week I wrote a glowing review of the Kyjen PP01486 Invincibles Plush Gecko.  I have a Jack Russell Terrier that lives to kill squeaky toys, it is a mission for her.  The Kyjen PP01486 Invincibles is 2 weeks old and although it looks like it has been through a major battle, it is still intact and still squeaks.  I was so happy with this Invincible that I looked for others in the Invincible series.  This Small Hedgehog would be perfect.... or so I thought.  It did not last 3 minutes.  It is not made up of the same Invincible liner material, in fact it is no stronger than a cheap dollar store toy.  If you want a dog toy that stands up to a chewer, better than most...  try the Kyjen PP01486 Invincibles Plush Gecko, but pass on this one.

title: Mostly fillers text: For a long term puppy food, this is low on my list due to the fillers and byproducts rather than whole ingredients. Corn meal and soy are things I normally avoid in our dog food.

However, we recently rescued a severely malnourished Border Collie puppy off a desert highway. She needed puppy food immediately. At 4 months of age and starving, the primary ingredients aren't my first concern. We're mixing this with a much higher quality super premium kibble to get her healthy and put some weight on her.

Natalie likes the food and has shown no digestive trouble with it at all. She's putting on weight at an appropriate pace and is showing that famous Border Collie high energy now.

title: Cats were OK with this ... text: ... but weren't crazy about it.

I have a couple of finicky older cats, and their tastes are pretty specific. We've been trying some different foods recently, and I try to give each new variety a fair trial, introducing it slowly into their feeders. Mine are "grazers," meaning I can leave food out all the time and they don't overeat.

From the looks of things, they aren't wild about this, but they are eating it. Nutritionally, it seems well balanced. My cats have had problems in the past with wheat and corn, so I tend to offer them grain-free varieties. This Tuna, Barley and Peas isn't grain free, but after 10 days on it, I haven't noticed any of the problems I've had with other grains (they get an almost hive-like rash -- not fun for them or me). The bits are smallish, which suits them fine as well.

Hills is a high-end brand, and their products are generally high quality. This seems to be no different. It's a tad pricey, but for the quality, that's probably fair. I may try one of the other flavor combinations of this and see how it goes, and certainly keep this on my list of "rotating" foods for variety.

title: Soft, well padded and easy to adjust for size. Needs a second loop for tags text: We normally use the martingale style collars for our dogs for safety reasons. However, one of my older dogs needed a surgery and a lighter weight collar during recovery. This one was just right.

It's thick, but not heavy and it is really soft. The padding makes it comfortable for my girl to wear all day. I had to adjust this to fit her and it's easy to do and holds the new size without stretching. My one complaint is the leash loop. The collar needs a second loop to attach the dog tags to so you don't have them on the same loop as your leash snap.

title: Clumps Well!
text: I have 3 cats and 4 litter boxes. Two of the boxes are the Breeze systems and the other 2 are traditional. In the traditional ones, we usually use Tidy Cat. A few months ago, I switched the upstairs Tidy Cat with corn litter and I like that. I swapped the other traditional box with this. I started by completely cleaning out the box. Yuck!! It took the whole bag to fill the large pan. It has a strong plant smell to it which I am not crazy about. It's been several days and the smell is still pretty strong. It is doing a good job of covering the urine smell. I do really like the clumping that this does. It's the best clumping litter we've ever had. I am super impressed with that feature. This clumps better than the corn one, but in my opinion the corn litter smells better.  I'm noticing about the same amount of litter being tracked outside of the box. Oh, and none of my cats had any difficulties changing to this litter. That was pretty smooth. Now if only I could get all of them to properly cover their poo. I'm not sure if they're lazy or if they were never taught!

title: Much Better Than Traditional Litter Boxes!
text: We have two cats and have two standard litter boxes in the basement. A few months ago, our female cat started using the main floor dining room and an upstairs  bedroom as alternatives. I didn't want to deal with litter being tracked around so I searched and searched for the perfect litter box. The Tidy Cats Breeze system isn't perfect, but it's much better than the standard litter boxes. The first Breeze system was put in the master bathroom upstairs. There are some pellets that stick to their feet and get tracked onto the bathroom tile. However, it's much easier to deal with than traditional litter. I just pick it up and toss it back into the box. I rotate the pad in the drawer after 3 or 4 days and replace it about once a week. I scoop the solid waste every few days. I am really impressed with how little it smells. I have had the original pellets in the box for about 6 weeks without any issues. I did add some more to it after a few weeks just because I have two cats using it, but I have not disposed any yet. This box has eliminated the problems we were having upstairs completely. The female cat was still doing her business in the dining room. Last week I ordered a second box for the main floor of the house. So now we have the two regular boxes in the basement (which they are still using) and then one Breeze system upstairs and another one on the main floor of the house. I am very pleased with how they work.

title: So Far So Good!
text: Recently I was reading an article about health for senior dogs & it mentioned the use of probiotics for dogs. I personally am a fan of probiotics and have been taking them for the last couple of years, so I decided to look into it for my 12 year old Keeshond Sheltie. My dog can be quite gassy and frequently her stomach/insides make loud gurgling noises that are a bit disruptive. This supplement is very easy to use. I just give her morning food three sprays. There's no odor and she eats her food without any problems. The H20 PRO contains 70 million CFUs which is well over the minimum of 20 million that the article suggested. So far, it seems to be working well. I haven't noticed any gurgling stomach noises or gassiness since she's been taking this. title: A Bed for a Very Spoiled Kitty text: I have two very spoiled cats and each one has found her favorite place to sleep in the evenings. We have one cat bed set up in a hallway and one of them loves to sleep there. The other was sleeping on the couch at night until we presented this bed to her and she has slept every night since on this bed.

This is more of a dog's bed, based on the design of the bed and accompaniments. It is a rectangular bed with a trough entrance in the front. The sides are plush and soft but the removable cushion that serves as the base is very soft and puffy ‚Äì ideal for a larger spoiled cat. There is a large bone-shaped pillow that is attached to the bed on the inside that would make an interesting chew for a dog or possibly a pillow, but our cat does not seem to notice it.

I have the medium-sized bed and it seems about right for a small- to medium-sized breed of dog like a border collie or for a larger cat. It is slightly bigger than my cat needs but it is not big enough for both of our cats to comfortably sit together in it.

I have looked over this bed and I have found no issues with loose threads, uneven stitching or blemished materials.

The bed is fairly easy to wash too. The cushion comes out and is about the size of a standard pillow and its cover can be washed. The bed cover comes off and it can go in the wash (I recommend a gentle cycle). If using it for cats, most of the time it is easier and faster to just go over it very thoroughly with a vacuum cleaner to get all of the cat hair.

This bed has worked out very well for us and especially for our cat. Since placing this on the floor for our cat to find, she has slept in it every night without exception, and that's high praise coming from her. If you have a pet that you want to spoil, either a dog or a cat, this is a good way to spoil them.

Disclosure: I was provided a sample of this product in exchange for a fair, honest and thorough review. Even though I received this product at no/minimal cost I have rated and reviewed this product without bias, based solely on my experience with it.

title: Worked for 2 rescue dogs. Same quantity of Frontline ingredients text: First, let me say that we only use Advantix on our dogs and we've have had zero fleas in 15 years. None even with 5 to 8 dogs living here. However, we've been fostering two dogs who arrived with a flea problem - street rescues always have fleas. Their new home will be using Frontline, so I didn't want to put the dogs on a different product for the 30 days they are with me.

This has the same ingredients as Frontline and in the same quantities and that's important. A lot of the generic versions do not have the same amount and they just do not work. You put this between the shoulder blades and it soaks in. We saw an immediate reduction of flea activity in the first 24 hours in both dogs.

It's been a week now. There are zero fleas on either dog and both have stopped scratching entirely. Neither has has any sort of skin irritation or negative reaction to the drops. I feel confident that these puppers will go to their new forever home after the holidays flea free.

title: Crispy, easy to break apart for two dogs. No soy or corn. text: Hills is a company that I both trust and have to be a bit wary of, depending on which of their products I'm buying. Some of their canned dog food varieties contain cellulose (wood fiber) and I absolutely will not ever feed anything with cheap, non nutritional fillers. Then they also have the prescription diets and I have witnessed those products save dog lives.

These treats are a decent choice for my two pudgy dogs. They do contain wheat, but are free of corn, soy and cellulose. Each cookie has a cute little word or heart image on it - a sweet touch. They are easy to snap in half because they aren't as dense as other biscuits. You get a sort of cracker type snap - more crisp than crunch. My 5 dogs all like these and the crunch is mild enough that my senior dogs can chew them with only a little difficulty.

It's easier to store and the canister top helps keep in freshness as sometimes the plastic bag the other brand was packaged with would spill, so I can now avoid that issue.  My dog enjoys Native Pet just as much as the first brand of pumpkin flakes tried, so altogether a win-win situation.

title: Not sturdy and cat was not comfortable text: This window seat was very easy to put together, it just did not stay together very well. That was a deal breaker and it is being returned. It consists of :

* Rectangular frame for the seat part.. BEWARE : make sure you install the folding hinge in the middle, so that the frame folds upwards, not down... otherwise it will collapse when your cat jumps onto it. Also, the frame has a thin metal bar that runs across the middle of the bed. This sticks up considerably in the middle of the bed and makes an uncomfortable bump. My senior cat hated it, and would not stay in a stretched out position. He left the seat after 10 minutes and never got back in... he practically lived in his old one.

* 2 metal legs to support the frame on the bottom: we had trouble with these staying in the slots at the edges of the frame.... once it was put onto the window, the leg on one side kept drifting out. There is nothing to lock or hold the legs into place on the frame.

* Cushiony polyester seat cushion: BEWARE: this cushion has a strip of velcro at the edges of the 4 sides, so that you can install it by wrapping it around the 4 metal bars of the frame. There is only 1 piece of velcro... so this has to stick to the fabric alone, which is not a very secure hold on neoprene-like polyester. This is the only way to secure the fabric seat part onto the frame, unless you do what another reviewer did, and sew it together once it is on the frame.

* 4 suction cups: these worked pretty well for the few hours that we tested it out. I am not sure if they would stay on long term

title: My cats run from this & my friend's three dogs avoid it; but it might be good for some dogs text: [[VIDEOID:c99fcbfb372801140c9f9ce4c2a79fb0]] I've updated my rating from 2 to 3 stars and revised my review below to include both the response from three cats and three dogs.

---REVIEW---

I got this for my cats but all three of them run from it and will not eat the treats dispensed. Also, the treats are just spilled out all over the place making a mess. It sort of gyrates around as can be seen in the video even when there are no obstacles in the way. Therefore, my three cats rate this a complete zero.

I then tried this on my friend's dogs. They also avoid it but they wait until it is almost out of the way before they eat the treats or kibble I put inside. Most of the time this dispenser goes in circles or gyrates in place. Only rarely did it move along on a straight line. The dogs also seemed to find it as more of an annoyance than a pleasure.

ABOUT THE PRODUCT
This is an auto rolling treat dispenser but is not for heavy chewers. It takes 4 AAA batteries (not included). A Phillips-head screwdriver is needed to open the battery compartment. The wheels kept moving as I was unscrewing the cover so I found it a bit tricky to remove the screw to the battery compartment. The treats get inserted into the hollowed out wheels. When one wheel is full, I had to cover the full wheel with my hand so the treats would not fall out while I filled the other wheel. From that perspective, it is a bit cumbersome. Once the switch is turned on, the treats spill out due to the movement.

This is nicely made and the wheels rotate well in my hands. Dirt and hair do get stuck or picked up by the rubberized wheels and tip.

In summary, since my friend's dogs were not as skittish with this RoboBone as my cats were, I do feel that some dogs might enjoy this--especially the rambunctious ones. However, based on the results I got, it is obviously not a hit with all dogs and definitely not with cats.

title: Does a Great Job of Removing/Lightening Tear Stains text: Our puppy Sonny, a white bichon frise, has a good deal of tear stain around and below his eyes; even a bit in his beard area. TropiClean is easy to use. After wetting his fur we rub TropiClean into the fur around his eyes and beard and allow it to sit for 3 minutes as directed, then wipe it off and rinse the fur with water. TropiClean does a very nice job of removing the stains though not entirely in some spots. What remains is lightened a great deal and a huge improvement. It also helps to soften the black, hard and crusty 'goop' Sonny gets around his eyes from time to time, allowing us to gently remove most or all of it.

I like the ingredients in this cleanser. Sonny has sensitive skin, according to the vet. He has no issues /negative reactions from TropiClean.

We do use this on Sonny daily. (It is gentle enough for daily use) Despite daily use, faint stains remain in his fur but are MUCH improved from their original state. Overall, we are pleased with the results TropiClean delivers. The price is reasonable.

title: 8 dogs love the Beef and I love the ingredients text: I actually think very highly of the Beyond line of dog foods. title: High Quality Soft Food and Treats text: When you share a home with two dogs, you need something to reward them for good behavior. That means it is necessary to have assorted treats on hand at all times and while most dog treats have questionable ingredients, there are lots of quality brands and treats on the market, they just require an investment of time to find them. One good treat I just discovered is the Portland Pet Food Company Combo Pack - Human Grade.

When this combo pack, you get a bag of dog biscuits and a pouch of soft food. I have purchased countless bags of dog treats from different companies, but I think this is the first time I‚Äôve seen one that was sold as a combo pack. The soft food is beef and rice and it makes for a good topper on my dog‚Äôs regular food. Any soft dog food containing beef is going to be a hit with my dogs and they absolutely love this as a food topper.

The dry treats were my main motivation for trying this dog treat. I find them particularly good overall. They are small treats and are not going to last more than a few seconds, but they have their usefulness as a quick reward. And most important of all, these treats and the soft food are high in quality, free from artificial ingredients.

Dogs need to be rewarded and while it may be tempting to go with less expensive, store bought dog treats, it makes more sense to invest in a little more money and feed your dog treats that are high in quality. The Portland Pet Food Company Combo Pack - Human Grade is a high-quality treat manufactured in the USA by a company that donates part of the proceeds from these treats to animal shelters and related programs. It is an excellent product overall and one I am proud to serve to my dogs.

title: Three Sick Little Dogs & a $500 Trip to the Vet text: First of all, why have us rate the flavor? My three toy dogs ate them, not me. And what the heck does "longevity" mean? These things have a life span????

The flavor must have been okay because I gave them each half of one as soon as they were received. Unfortunately, ALL THREE became sick within a few hours. Bloody diarrhea, vomiting, lethargy. Had to take all 3 dogs to the vet & spent almost $500. Between cleaning up the sick & the runny poop & going to the vet & then hand syringing Pedialyte & little morsels of boiled chicken & rice the second day, I was the one who was BUSY. Trashed the remainder of the bag. Would definitely NOT recommend.

The big, long snout dogs in our pack can easily eat out of these without banging their noses. I like the rubber bottoms on tile floors - no more sliding around all over the kitchen at dinner time.

title: Pop up tent perfect- just impossible to put back!! text: Babysitting our sons pug for the weekend proves a harder task the one may think- The fact I‚Äôm allergic causes me all sorts of trouble!! Oh.. and the task is intensified with this being a rambunctious 2yr. old pup- one I needed to contain him/hair when its just me here to help out‚Ä¶

Kennel? I needed something easier to move around besides an obnoxious, large and heavy metal crate- so, I chose zonetech portable play pen which has done its job quite well.. (*this does replace kennel purpose just gives an is it move alternative!)

This is a ‚Äúpop and go‚Äù set up- open it up and playpen unfolds right in front of you.. BooM!! This weighs nothing as, it‚Äôs light as can be.. almost a bit too light! See photos included.. the material is see-through which makes me a bit hesitant for its longevity.. but, so far no issues with rip/tear.

All sides including top are ventilated and even transparent. For a pup who must keep eye contact to ‚Äúfeel safe‚Äù this has it covered. Speaking of covered.. if needing the polar opposite effect on sight- throw a light blanket over the hexagon top. This sturdy enough structure allows for a covered kennel!

Zippers can be a bit fragile so careful.. ours actually arrived off the runner- but, backing it up and starting the process over corrected issue.. whew! So far they‚Äôve held nicely even while containing the pup.. and interestingly enough, he seems subdued while enclosed?! Hey, I‚Äôll take it.

Ive got mid size SUV and actually placed this in back completely set up.. I did this so car stays free of animal hair.. **a huge perk for dogs with wirey hair that is impossible to remove from car seats otherwise!!!

Only angst: folding this back to put into the tiny carry case- it folds flat to the thin and long level- but try as I might.. I cant get that folded in half?? After 25min. of trying I stored this outside the case- Bummer! To clean: this does superb with a Lysol wipe of material.. one can wet material if need just let it air dry completely when done-

For $25 it meets a few unique but, important needs and if you fit this category I would suggest giving it a try.. hoping this info can help your decision- stay safe.

title: They might be helpful text: I love the idea of boosting our cats' health with a probiotic of some kind. I had high hopes for these pills. They are small, white pills that are definitely cat-sized.

However, I haven't been able to get one down either of our cats yet. I tried hiding it in their wet food. They managed to eat all the food and leave the pill! I then tried just doing a quick pop into the mouth and stroking their throats. As soon as I put them down, they hacked the tiny pill back up. üòë

We do have a pill gun, and I have not tried that yet. I prefer to leave that for when they have a prescription medication to take. But that is likely the only way to ever get one of these down.

I cannot say anything about the health impact of this item, because there is something in the taste of the pill that they refuse to swallow (or keep in their tummies). If your cat is ok with taking pills, you might have better success than I did with these.

title: No grains, No fillers. text: I have a 12 yr. old standard size Chihuahua who has become a picky eater. I think partly because she is missing some teeth, and I rescued her at 8 months old from a horrible puppy mill situation (almost starved to death,other dogs around her were not alive).
At such a young age, I had to have one of her eyes removed, and 4 front teeth pulled.
My vet said its more important for a small dog to eat a healthy dry dog food, then a large dog!
(I'm sure that is up for debate!)

That said , at first my Chi would not eat this dog food. But when I mixed it with a well fried egg, but it in her food, now she eats it like a champ, with out the egg, and I hope that continues.
She does not have any side effects eating this food.
I also have to put in her food, Coconut oil, if we don't she has a gagging problem. Btw small dogs have a small Esophagus which make it common for some small breeds of dogs to gag, Cough.

I like that this food is not filled with Fillers, and Grain, and its more of a Turkey diet.

I see its distributed in California, But where does this food come from, made at, what country??
Google said, this company was sold in 2013 to DelMonte foods, then sold to Smackers! Never heard of Smackers. I could not find anywhere what country this dog food is actually made in?
If anyone knows, please share..

title: Best litter I've ever used, hands down ... text: I think I've finally found a litter that ALL of us like: my two finicky kitties and me.

First, it's not too dusty -- there's a little but only when I got to the bottom of the box. Otherwise, it pours cleanly. That's a good sign.

It clumps better than any I've used in the past, even some that were more expensive. This means that the clumps stay "suspended" rather than forming on the bottom of the box. Another good sign.

It controls odor better than any others, even without perfumes. Seriously, there is NO odor at all.

Finally, my cats have allergies to some ingredients in other litters, especially any with scents. They have shown NO signs of allergies to this litter. None at all. They actually do a better job of covering since they're not in a rush to leave the box due to irritants in other litters.

I'm going to try to keep this stocked at home. A word about pricing: pay close attention, as the price varies wildly depending on seller, phase fo the moon, alignment of the planets, who knows. I paid just under nineteen dollars for my last 28-lb box; it's now going for just under thirty-five bucks from the same seller. I check periodically and buy when the price drops. The 28-lb box does last awhile -- it's equivalent to 37 lbs of "regular" litter, and it does seem to work out that way.

Definitely happy with this.

title: Some Questionable Ingredients but Still Good text: Dogs love to eat and they especially love any food that‚Äôs meaty in aroma. Eukanuba Adult Hearty Stew with Beef and Vegetables in Gravy is exactly that- a soft dog food that is loaded with real meat and certain to get any dog‚Äôs attention.

Wet dog foods are loved by dogs and this food from Eukanuba is much like other canned dog foods in that respect. Even if my dog is in another part of the house, he will quickly come running if I open a can of dog food. A dog‚Äôs extraordinary sense of smell picks up on the fragrant aroma of meat and soft dog food sends my dog running to the dinner table with tail wagging. My dog loves the taste of this food and eats with abandon when it‚Äôs served to him.

Just like with other wet dog foods, I tend to limit this canned dog food and serve as a topper to regular, dry food. I serve it as a treat more than a regular food and the reason is largely due to the ingredients. I like that meat comprises the top ingredients and Eukanuba should be commended for added a good dose of nutrition to this food. However, there are some by- products and a scattering of other questionable additives. It‚Äôs still a notch better than some of the cheaper brands of canned dog food but some of the ingredients could concern the more attentive and demanding dog parent.

Eukanuba is a generally trusted brand and its Adult Hearty Stew with Beef and Vegetables in Gravy is a good choice in wet dog foods. You won‚Äôt have any problem getting your dog excited about this and if you can get past some of the less desirable ingredients, you should find this a good canned dog food option.

title: Tastefuls declared not tasty by our kitty crew!  Seven Paws down on this one!
text: We have several cats in our household, including fosters. None of our 7 felines of varying ages enjoyed eating this chicken flavor supposedly in gravy. There was no gravy or liquid that I could find. I expected little pieces, but the texture is more minced. Overall, it's gluey. All of our cats seem to favor liquid and gravy versus pasty and dry. They like chunks, fillets, grilled, and pate as long as there is liquid to go with it. I've tried adding water to this food --- which I consider fairly expensive even on sale -- and they still refuse to eat much of it, even with competition. It might be healthy, but if they won't eat it, it won't do them any good. I didn't especially like the smell of the chicken. It doesn't smell spoiled exactly, just not quite right. Our band of finicky cats has declared the Tastefuls not tasty enough for them. I won't be ordering this kind of food again! I'm hoping the ferals I feed won't mind it.

title: Works ok but hard to keep clean text: Potentially a good concept but unless you agree consciousness about emptying and completely rinsing out reservoir With bleach to prevent mold build up, it is not healthy for pets.
You can‚Äôt just keep adding water through the top, if you do, it starts to get moldy . I do not recommend it for that reason. Poor design.

title: June 2017 recall for contamination. Made in China. Avoid. text: Nope. There are two reasons why I refuse to even open this bag and would absolutely never ever consider giving these to my dogs. First - this is made in China. I believe we are all aware of the dangers of China sourced ingredients in dog treats.

Second is the fact that this company had a recall in June 2017 for several of it's brands of rawhide dog treats. The recall is for products made with "rawhide" for contamination with quaternary ammonium compounds. This can cause diarrhea, vomiting and loss of appetite. Further more, this is a cleaning compound not approved for use in the United States for rawhide production. (Per the FDA site) This is just unacceptable and I will steer clear of all the brands from this company.

title: chicken or salmon pouches of gravy are well receieved by my girls, Stella & Sophie text: Just gravy. Just what my elderly kitties would have loved. They passed away recently at 18+, and the last couple of years they were extra keen on the gravy style wet foods. They'd have loved packets of just gravy added to their food. Keep in mind, these are not meals. They are compliments- so add it to kibble, to wet food, provide as a treat, appetite incentive, or an inbetween, or maybe as a way to hide medicine and supplements. But not as sole source of nutrition.

Who I did get this for? (honestly, it was a automatic reaction to snag some wet food as my elderlies had gone through wet food like crazy), but I do have three other cats. One who doesnt really eat wet food, and then there are my two adult newly adopted girls, who seem to love wet food.. and sure enough lap up this gravy with pleasure. So glad I got it, even though it is bittersweet every time I open a pouch.

Just tear off the top of the pouches and pour. Nearly all comes out easily. Doesnt seem to be much left behind. Can take a spatula, spoon, or some water to gather up any left over juice for them.

Not a huge portion, but enough to take one pouch and split between the 2 cats

title: Cute novelty, but WAY too expensive and too much work (surprisingly)
text: My dogs seem to love these, but my little monsters are certainly not picky eaters and will eat practically anything given to them. The bags say to microwave for 55 seconds and then let cool for 2 minutes. I followed the directions to a "T" with my first bag but all I ended up with was a burning smell that filled my kitchen, dining room and living room.. and when I opened the microwave, the bag was black on both sides and the snacks were varying shades of brown to black. Nope. Tossed that bag in the trash and, figuring I messed up a step (unlikely as it's a one step process), I popped another one in.. but this time, I ran it for 30 seconds. I ended up with the exact same results. By bag #4 I *finally* got decent results and unburnt snacks that I felt okay with my dogs eating. In my trial and error, I discovered that I can only microwave these bags for 22 seconds without the snacks burning. The bag is still slightly black but the treats are good. Given the current price of these, this was an extremely costly experiment and while I have figured out the timing and do think these are a cute novelty, I cannot recommend them nor will they be a repeat purchase.

title: Bags are narrow & handles are more like finger holes; these are easy to separate & open text: These poop bags are similar to others on the market in that they have a narrow opening but they are not as tall. However, the handles on the bags are useless to me as they are more like finger holes.

There are 8 rolls of 15 bags each for a total of 120 bags. The tape on the roll is easy to peel and the bags are easy to separate from the roll and easy to open. They hold a decent amount and are strong but getting the waste in the bag is not as easy as some other bags.

I was able to scoop two litter pans and the bag held both the waste and litter without leaks or holes. These are strong for being biodegradable. However, since they are biodegradable, there's actually a 2-year shelf life for these bags even though it doesn't say that on the box.

The current price of $13.99 is pricey for these bags as it comes to $.12 cents per bag when most bags sell for between $.04 to $.09 cents per bag depending on the bulk size purchased. I would not order these again because of the squat size, narrow opening, and tiny finger holes for handles.
