We free feed dry cat food and add canned food in the evening. He's at a comfortable, correct weight. The ingredients are excellent and the Crave does not cause him any digestive troubles at all. No vomiting, no flatulence and no need to sing "Smelly Cat, Smelly Cat".

title: Free Cat likes the beef a lot. Has decided the chicken and veggies is not for him
text: I am a big fan of the mixed flavor multi packs. Our Siamese is prone to outraged indignation if presented with the same flavor two meals in a row. You don't want to be on the receiving end of that cold, glinty, slightly cross eyed glare if you can avoid it.  As a rule, His Arrogance loves the different Sheba varieties and I can escape alive after sliding a plate of Sheba feed in front of him. However, he's not a huge fan of the chicken with vegetables option in this combo. He likes the beef a lot, but he tends to leave some of the chicken behind on his plate. I'm going to have to alternate the rest of the chicken every fourth meal until it's gone....or risk waking up to a mouse head in my bed a la the Godfeline.

title: Sammy loved them text: Our dog, Sammy, recently passed on. Before that he was on medication for kidney problems. I don't know how he did it, but we'd give him the tablet and it would appear that he ate it. But later we'd find it in one of our shoes (I guess he was telling us what he thought of those pills!). I heard about this product and decided to try it. He LOVED it! If he noticed the pill, it didn't matter. He still took it. Finally he didn't need the meds anymore, but he loved them so much that they made for great training treats. So I put them on the subscribe and save list. It was nice knowing that I wouldn't forget to get them.

As I said, Sammy has passed on (He was 15) and we cancelled the S&S subscription (I don't think we'll get another dog. Losing him hurt too much). But I wanted to review it because I want people to know just how great this product is.

The only downside is that they are pretty greasy. But, at least for us, it was worth the hassle of wiping our hands off afterwards to know that our dog was getting his meds and was enjoying a special treat. They come in chicken, hickory, peanut butter and some allergy thing. Lots to choose from.

The only suggestion I'd give the manufacturer is to provide a variety pack of different ones. Or Amazon sets up bundles consisting of different flavors, instead of selling only one flavor in a set, such as this one. I worried that Sammy might get tired of the one flavor and would quit eating it. He'd done that in the past with other treats so, even though it didn't happen this time, I still worried that it would eventually. It's so hard to find treats dogs like that when we do we want to give them as long as we can. Providing different flavors helps spread that enjoyment time a lot longer. Just a thought.

title: Decently built, good behavioral enrichment text: This was actually a lot of fun although it looks like a lot of random pawing. The kids probably had more fun trying to train the dogs to work the knobs. The dogs were able to access treats, but for now it truly does seem pretty random.

I have to say that I was shocked when I opened it up and saw MDF. Glad to hear that it's rated as ecofriendly. My first that was that this stuff was going to offgas and kill us all.

The construction is decent and the materials seemed clean and substantial. There are some rough edges on some of the routing and I did file off some rough edges on the slots where the food comes out. Nothing sharp or dangerous, just not aesthetically pleasing and it looked like it formed a wall that might stop the treats. The device is sorta hefty and low so it stays in place well, it definitely seems enriching for the dogs although a little frustrating at times. But their persistence pays off.

Misses five stars for being a bit pricy.

title: Bristles too thin, cheap base text: We have been owned by cats for many decades now.
We had a similar product that had a much sturdier base and thicker bristle brush for the arch
than this item did. Our cats used that all the time and even our shepherd mix would stick his face
through the archway and rub his side face on it!

We lost that one in a move to another state. So, we ended up buying one of these.
It is the same basic design, but the quality of the materials is vastly different.
The bristles are much farther apart, and can easily just poke the cat rather than brush it.

The platform on the bottom is super thin with some plastic rather than wood.
It doesn't seem to tip over much, but then again, that is hard to determine when your cats don't
care for it!

We have tried loading it with their favorite catnip (it comes with a tiny packet of nip), both in the
piece of carpet on the bottom as well as through the bristles.
Nope.
Neither cat cares a bit about this toy! One adores to be brushed, so it isn't that they don't want
the touch - they don't like the spiney bristles on this item. We've also tried attaching toys, making it
the "entrance" to their favorite bed, nothing. They avoid it like the plague.

So, not sure if this item will really be something your cat would like.
In my humble opinion, they need to use a better bristle that is more condensed so it doesn't feel
so sharp to the cats. It will definitely depend upon the individual cat as to if they like it or not,
but neither of ours cares a bit for it.

title: Great piece of wood, may need to sand it. text: Very nice piece of wood. I was sort of hoping for a log shape piece. However I didn't request a certain shape so it isn't the seller's fault. What I received was a T shaped piece of wood. The wood weighed 6 lbs dry so it probably would have been around 10 lbs waterlogged. It measures around 13 x 3 x 10 inches.

My biggest issue with this piece of wood was that it had multiple areas where it was sharp. I didn't trust this piece of wood to go in my 20 gal tank with my betta. I hand sanded it down for an hour to get most of it smooth. I have purchased another piece of mopani wood from amazon before (not large) and I didn't have issues with that piece.

Since this wood is in the reptile section of amazon, maybe the sharp edges wouldn't have hurt/bothered reptiles as much?

title: Not so easy-to-clean brush; doesn‚Äôt pick up as much hair as my other brushes; tines will bend w/use text: I am very disappointed in this ensemble. This brush's best feature is supposed to be that it is relatively easy to clean BUT IT IS NOT.¬†The¬†tines¬†do not sit flush with the faceplate that gets pushed out with the button. As a result, I have to pick off the¬†hair from the¬†tines because it gets caught. Also, the tines bend after the first brushing making it even harder.

This also comes with¬†a plastic rake-like tool and that is absolutely useless. Both items are cute due¬†to¬†the paw design, but only the pin comb is useful.

I just brushed my cats with the¬†pin comb and then¬†retracted the bristles with the tab. The hair remains on top and can be pulled off since it doesn't slide off like it is supposed to.¬†¬†

This is better for long-haired pets than short-haired ones. I don't have short-haired pets, so I cannot vouch how good it is with shorter hair.

The current price of $14.38 ($15.98 minus 10%) is a bit pricey for this especially when the pin comb is only acceptable and the plastic rake is practically useless.

title: Amazing --- low-smell poop!
text: I know why I returned to this amazing cat food ---- no-smell poop. And, of course, all four of my cats love it! I've tried different dry cat foods over the years (no cat should NEED moist food - don't be suckered in by your cat), but this is the ONLY one that produces a low-odor poop. It's actually pretty amazing. I have to remember to dump the cat pans because there is basically no poop smell, but some urine smell. Lesson learned: it doesn't matter how much smellem is in your litter, the poop is still going to smell. Masking it with fancy litter just does not work. I just wanted to share my experience. Try it and you will be amazed at the difference. AND, your cats will love it --- even if you have already spoiled them with the moist. You can mix at first, then gradually get rid of the stinky moist or dry food.

title: Nicely Built Panels, but it is small text: We bought the large version of this to reconfigure into a chicken run and we are very happy with it. We then got a chance to get a reviewer product of the small and we jumped at it because we liked the larger product so much. The panels are wonderfully modular and work well as a finished rectangular kennel, but for us, it also worked perfectly as a reconfigured wall. The panels are nicely finished with black, they have been maintenance free for us, sturdy and aesthetically pleasing.

This small kennel is definitely small, 4' x 4' and fence high. The canvas roof is nice and should hold up to most weather, although I would be concerned with constant sun beating on it. We have used it to separate individual chickens during introductions to the flock and it has worked wonderfully. I love the flexibility and portability and we are very happy with it. Looks great!

title: Easy assembly and adjustable!
text: I got this Geahod Elevated Stainless Steel Bowls for Cats and Small Dogs for my grandma and her cat. Up until now, she's been using two individual dishes for her cat, which wouldn't normally be an issue.. but her cat is not normal Lol! He likes to play soccer with his bowls which causes my grandma to trip over them as they can end up in the oddest of places in her kitchen, dining room, heck.. even the bathroom down the hallway! So I got this setup to corral not only the cat's dishes but also his tricks. It was easy to assemble - less than 5 minutes from box to floor, ready to use - and the ability to quickly and easily change the eating/drinking height of the bowls is useful. The included stainless steel bowls are decent quality and the bamboo will be very easy to clean - just a simple wipe down as needed.

title: Miss Piggy and Squeaky LOVE It! VERY Well Made!
text: My cats have been using cardboard cat scratchers for years.  They love them and it satisfies their need to scratch.  A few weeks ago, my vacuum cleaner-which supposedly doesn't clog...did just that. It got clogged from all of the small cardboard cat scratcher pieces I vacuumed.  I was almost tempted to trash the scratcher,  cross my fingers and hope they would use the cat scratcher on their cat tower which located at the opposite end of the house . In light of new furniture for our home that will soon arrive, I decided it was better 'safe than sorry'. I DID ditch the cardboard scratcher...the moment their Lahas scratching pad arrived! Miss Piggy and Squeaky took to it immediately.  Minutes after I put it down, they checked it out and began to scratch away.  They've been using it ever since. Its well made. Its so well made, you can't see where they scratched!  I found no loose threads or holes.  The mat is a good size-15.7*23.6".  Doesn't take up much room yet still a great size for my 2 cats.  Thank goodness for the anti-slip bottom...love that I won't have to continuously put it back where it belongs because it doesn't slip.  And I don't have to vacuum up cardboard any longer!  Thanks to the Lahas scratcher, I'm no longer concerned about the cats scratching the new furniture.  This mat is definitely giftable.  Makes for a nice holiday /new home/new furniture gift.  I find the price to be more than reasonable...and it sure is cheaper than having to replace furniture or carpet! Definitely recommended...a MUST HAVE for cat owners!

title: Got my shih tzu's attention
text: I have only used it once, but my little "guard dog" did a double take when I did.  He was doing his usual, totally obnoxious yapping to let me know the mail carrier was closing in on my mail box.  Previously I would say "NO!" with increasing volume and urgency only to have him pretty much ignore me.  The one and only time I have used the bark control device, "Charlie" did a little hop, then turned around and looked up at me like what's THAT?!!  Really, he seems to have modified his behavior, at least when I'm home.  Yes, he certainly has barked since then, but stops when I say stop or no, or sometimes just look at him.  I take it when we go walking in case he "acts out" around another dog or the neighborhood children, but he has been uncharacteristically pleasant and well behaved, or at least quiet.  I've only  had it a week, but so far I'm very happy with it, though I realize it may lose its punch once the novelty wears off.

title: All three of my friend‚Äôs dogs liked this food; careful of grain free exclusively text: I got this for my friend's dogs to supplement with their other food. All three dogs liked¬†the kibble. As you can see, they (see photo of one dog) are spoiled by being hand fed.

The food itself is medium, pale, and round and less appetizing (less solid looking) than other dog¬†foods they normally¬†eat. This is made in the U.S.A. but the ingredients are sourced from all around the world EXCEPT from China.

The human-grade ingredients are good except for the lentils. potatoes, and peas (see note). The first 17 ingredients are chicken, potatoes, peas, lentils, chicken liver, carrots, ground flaxseed, eggs, coconut oil, broccoli, pumpkin, apples, natural chicken flavor, chia seed, salmon oil, kale, minerals, etc.

Note that unless a dog has a grain allergy, it is not a good idea to feed them grain-free foods exclusively. The reason is that vets are finding an association between heart disease (such as canine dilated cardiomyopathy) and grain-free dog foods. This disease is mostly associated with the foods that have peas, lentils, other legumes or potatoes as their main ingredients and this food has lentils, peas, and potatoes. Nevertheless, I feel it is okay to feed this food to a dog only to supplement a dog's diet and not as an exclusive meal.

The bag has a sandwich bag type closure to ensure the kibble stays fresh.

There¬†is no¬†price listed but I would expect it to sell for between $13.99 and $15.99 for 4 pounds which¬†is a typical¬†price. This is a decent supplemental food as long as the dog eats it but I would not exclusively feed grain free.¬† ¬†¬†

title: Ideal Additional Safety For Evening Walks text: This is a review of the red LED collar. The product description and box both say this is can be (carefully) cut to size so it can better fit your pet. I honestly wonder about cutting off more than the last inch or so where there are no LEDs. I'd worry that cutting out an LED to get this to fit a smaller toy size dog or cat might damage the electronics as there's a tape marker on the tubing that shows what appears to be as much (about 1.5 inches) as you can remove.
Luckily the dog this was obtained for is large and fluffy enough that no cutting was needed. The dog likes to go for walks at dusk along a large canal behind the houses. People drive ATVs, quads and even large trucks along this area as well so being lit up as the sun goes down is a good safety feature.
The unit comes with a semi-standard mini-USB charging cable unlike the majority of devices that rely on micro-USB charging plugs. The cover for the charging area has a rubber 'blade' that fits into the charging plug. It took a few tries at first to seal the plug properly. It does comes with the proper charging cable just be careful with it if you have nothing else that uses this size plug. Luckily I do have other mini-USB chargeable devices so I have extra cables around. This odd size charging plug and the two permanent kinks the plastic tubing that this is made from are the reasons I can't give this a full five-stars. Still the whole unit is incredibly light weight and even though the battery is quite small they claim a run time of three hours. I managed almost two and a half switching modes (fast strobe, slow strobe and continuously lit). Recharge time is stated at approximately an hour and a half (half the claimed maximum run time) and I found that to be accurate. It's definitely a solid four-star item.
The light doesn't affect the dog we have wearing it. It can be seen, especially in one of the two strobe settings, from quite a distance away which adds to the safety of those evening walks. Please do remember, even for the smallest of pet this should never be used as a lead. Use a safe, strong collar or body harness to attach your leash to.
I received this item in exchange for my review.

title: Excellent facial razor; does the job it is supposed to do; on/off button in unusual place text: I love these types of razors. I believe this is the sixth one I tried. This is as excellent a facial razor as all the others I tried, yet it is not for everyone. It comes with the razor unit itself, a micro-USB cable (A/C adapter NOT included), a cleaning brush, and a user pamphlet.

I charged the razor for about one hour before first use. Note that the charging port is on the bottom and the ON/OFF "PIN" is next to it. Once the red light that I could see through the case went out, I knew it was ready to use. All I had to do was press the power button on the bottom. Since the button is a PIN it is not totally easy to depress. I shaved my chin and under my lips in seconds and it did an excellent job without pinching me.

When I was done, I unscrewed the tiny circular top and blew out the hairs as well as brushed them out with the provided cleaning brush. I absolutely love this razor. The geometric lines on this razor and the color look so sexy. The lines also make this non-slip. It also reminds me of a lipstick tube. I do wish the on/off button was more intuitive and easier to depress, however.

The current price of $12.99 is competitive. I absolutely love this razor and every other one I tried previously of this type because it makes quick work of removing my lip and chin hairs without having to get out the shave cream and razor. Sure I have to do it every two days but it only takes less than 60 seconds for a touch-up.

title: This is Easily The BEST Carpet Cleaner...EVER!!!!!!!! text: A few months ago, I had the absolute pleasure of testing and reviewing Rejuvenate Carpet Cleaner and I was simply amazed. It took care of stains immediately. Since then, I've used it MANY times on the carpet with perfect results each and every time. Last week, our dog got sick in my husband's work at home office. Though I used Rejuvenate Carpet Cleaner (regular carpet cleaner on pet stains), the stains came out immediately. I realized the bottle was getting low so I went to order another. When I saw the 2 pack of Rejuvenate Carpet and Upholstery Pet Stain Remover and that it can be used to tackle not only pet stains but grass, chocolate, mud and more, I didn't hesitate and placed my order. The bottles arrived packaged very well and protected-neither opened/no leaks. (And they arrived 2 days early! What a great surprise!) I wish I could tell you I haven't had to use Rejuvenate Pet Stain formula yet but alas, I cannot. Around 3:00 a.m. , I awoke to the sound every cat owner dreads...the sound of our cat throwing up...on the bedroom carpet. ( I will try to word this so I don't gross anyone out . ) I went and got the bottle of Rejuvenate Pet Stain spray and returned to the bedroom. I didn't have to search for the stains, found them right away. 2 spots, both dark in color, both liquid and nothing solid. I was so tired, I sprayed the Rejuvenate on both stains and put a damn cloth over each and went back to bed. This is how the instructions on the bottle advise to handle tough stains if they don't come out initially after using Rejuvenate. The instructions advise to spray the cleaner, let it penetrate for 15 minutes and try to wipe up. I skipped that step due to being tired and just sprayed the cleaner, covered it and went to bed. When I awoke nearly 7 hours later (I slept in!) and checked the stains, both were GONE! Just like that. As though they'd never been there to begin with! I'm telling you, you can't even see the stains faintly, they are GONE! ( At 3:00 a.m. it didn't occur to me to take photos of the stains for my review...my apologies)

Rejuvenate isn't limited to carpet use. It can be used on: furniture, clothing, flooring and, as the bottle states, 'anywhere stains happen'. I've only used the pet formula on the carpet so far. I HAVE used the regular Rejuvenate Carpet Cleaner spray on our sofa and a curtain. The cleaner removed both stains (one was iced tea, the other chocolate milk) immediately and didn't damage or discolor the sofa or curtain. The pet formula eliminates pet odors as well though I cannot comment on that as I haven't had to use it for that purpose...yet. The pet formula bottle IS compatible with a Click n Clean mop, however, I've not used it in conjunction with a Click n Clean, so I cannot comment based on experience.

I'm beyond thrilled with both Rejuvenate Carpet Cleaning (regular) spray AND pet formula. I actually did a live chat with a Rejuvenate employee a few days ago, asking if Rejuvenate makes a shampoo for carpet cleaners. They do not, unfortunately (Rejuvenate, if you're reading this, I BEG YOU to make a carpet shampoo for carpet cleaners! ) but I'm incredibly thankful for the carpet cleaning sprays. They work and they work FAST and VERY VERY VERY WELL! The prices cannot be beat. As I prepared to buy this 2 pack of pet sprays, I braced myself for what I assumed would be a fairly expensive charge on the credit card. I was FLOORED when I saw the cost for 2-32oz bottles! Although we have 2 cats and a dog, these bottles will last a LONG TIME. Just a few pumps on the trigger is enough to take care of stains...doesn't take a lot of product to tackle and remove stains. I cannot stress how wonderful this cleaner is. It really is amazing and I ABSOLUTELY recommend it. Its a MUST-HAVE for pet owners! But don't forget...the pet formula can be used on MANY other types of stains as well!

HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!

title: Actual OEM filters for my Drinkwell Platinum Pet Fountain text: I have had my Drinkwell Platinum fountain for over 24 years and in all those years, I have used a multitude of filters which I all thought came from the PetSafe vendor. Since I had anywhere between 2-4 cats simultaneously over those years and the filters were original, the fountain water stayed clean and would actually last up to 7-8 weeks (2 months).

The filters use to come in a foil package with three to a package. I never paid attention to the design on the filter (6 squares or 2 squares). However, I ordered this [[ASIN:B071J2B3YR 12-pack of filters]] and received 12 separate filters in a plastic covering. I did not realize that the ones with the 6 squares were knock offs and complete garbage causing the water to foam and foul with black mold within a few days.

However, these filters come in a 3-pack and have the 2 squares on them which are as pictured on the PetSafe website. These are definitely the original OEM filters. My cats' water no longer fouls and I have been using the same filter for a couple of weeks now. I would never order the other filters again.

title: It's A Definite Keeper!
text: Seriously, I have NO idea whatsoever I did before purchasing this leash. It benefits me in a myriad of ways. I'm a professional pet sitter and am therefore responsible for my client's furry family members and I don't take that lightly. Benefits - very reasonably priced, very sturdy, bungee cord makes it almost impossible for the dog to pull you down as you have time to react, if any kind of medical emergency should happen to you while walking (i.e. stroke, heart attack, fainting episode) then your best friend will be tethered to you and lastly, it frees up both your hands in case you would need to defend your dog or self from an attack or take an emergency phone call. I'm sure there's others I'm forgetting but I think you get the point. Cons -  I know the description reads the waist belt extends to 50 inches, but I believe it's between 46 and 48 inches at most. It would be nice to have a product out there for considerably larger men and women who would like to start walking with their pets to lose weight.

title: Good price, but some small issues text: I have two cats, one adult and one kitten. I purchased two of these to add even more litter pans around the house and in our enclosed porch. The shallow ones we already had were messy in that our furballs would manage to scatter litter on the floor.

This pan's first issue is it's light weight. My adult cat immediately tipped it over and spilled litter all over the floor. Part of that is because he has a weird way of relieving himself by bracing himself with his front paws on the top rim of the pan. The second issue, for my cats, is the pan requires that my kitten to actually climb into the pan. For now that is not working out well, but I am hoping that she will manage it as she gets bigger. For now she seems to prefer our other, shallow pans. Time will tell.

I could see it being useful to keep him from digging in the yard, since I could sit inside and watch when he starts doing that and give the collar a nudge. title: Two of my three cats ate this immediately; ingredients are reasonable text: I have three cats and two of them are finicky. One is so bad, it is hard to find food he likes. Well the one that refuses food all the time, refused this food (see photo where he is ignoring the food). However, the other two ate this immediately, which is highly unusual. The food smells slightly fishy to me even though it is a chicken meal and brown rice formula. The kibble is triangular as can be seen in my photo and it meets the nutritional levels established by the AAFCO Cat Food Nutrient profiles for "All Life Stages" - per the bag. It is 400 kcal per cup. This food is made in America from ingredients in the U.S.A. and around the world.

The ingredients are Chicken Meal, Brown Rice, Chicken Fat (Preserved with Mixed Tocopherols), Rolled Oats, Millet, Whitefish Meal, Pearled Barley, Whole Dried Egg, Herring Meal, Dried Beet Pulp, Menhaden Oil (Preserved with Mixed Tocopherols), Brewers Dried Yeast, Pea Protein, Marine Microalgae, Lecithin, Dried Cranberries, Dried Blueberries, Natural Flavors, Potassium Chloride, L-Lysine, DL Methionine, Taurine, Lactobacillus Acidophilus Fermentation Product Dehydrated, Fructooligosaccharides, L-Ascorbyl-2-Polyphosphate (source of Vitamin C), Sodium Chloride, Vitamin E Supplement, Niacin Supplement, Thiamine Mononitrate, Biotin, Vitamin A Acetate, Pyridoxine Hydrochloride, Riboflavin Supplement, d-Calcium Pantothenate, Vitamin B12 Supplement, Vitamin D3 Supplement, Folic Acid, Magnesium Sulfate, Potassium Chloride, Zinc Proteinate, Iron Proteinate, Manganese Proteinate, Copper Proteinate, Sodium Selenite, and Calcium Iodate.

The guarantee analysis has 33% crude protein (min), 15% crude fat (min), 3% crude fiber (max), 10% moisture (max), 7.5% ash (max), 0.3% DHA (min), 3.75% Omega 6 Fatty Acids (min), and 0.9% Omega 3 Fatty Acids (min). Both the Omegas are not recognized as an essential nutrient by the AFFCO.

I love that this comes in a resealable Velcro bag. The current price of $13.99 for a four-pound bag comes to a reasonable $3.50 per pound.

title: Extremely high in calories ‚Äì 300+ per treat text: I've given each of my two dogs one of these per day for a long time now. The dogs love them and have no trouble digesting them. However, I am going to limit treating with Busy Bones for the following reason: I have discovered that they are INCREDIBLY HIGH IN CALORIES.

Each busy bone in this (smaller) size contains slightly more than 300 calories. To put that into perspective, note that a dog who "should" weigh 20 pounds must consume no more than 500 calories per day (if only moderately active). In addition, veterinary groups say that generally treats should comprise no more than 10% of a dog's daily caloric intake.

My terrier mix should weigh 20 pounds but currently weighs about 23.5, and my vet has cautioned me to help him lose weight. While the dog food companies don't make it easy to determine how caloric their products are, and while there is no law compelling them to publish calorie counts for treats (starting in 2015, however, they will be legally required to provide such information for regular dog food), there are online resources (mainly the websites of some big veterinary practices and independent labs) that provide this information for some of the more popular treats and food.

I was shocked to learn from my internet research that Busy Bones are among the most caloric dry-type chew treats out there. While this might be an appropriate treat for a very large and highly active dog, it clear to me now that it was a terrible choice for my chubby, lazy little guy. I'll be researching leaner alternatives now to help him get down to a healthier weight.

These bags are easy to tear off the roll and easy to open. The sticker holding the roll is even easier to remove than some other bags I tried previously. These hold enough. I was able to scoop two litter pans for three cats worth of debris and the bag held the waste and litter without leaks or holes. These are strong for being biodegradable. title: Like playing interactive game.. but, on their own!! text: This device is easy to use and provides entertainment for the otherwise bored cat! The Best feature of all.. this is something that doesn‚Äôt need human involvement- other than flipping the switch!

*Before getting device in place- be sure to insert batteries!! Once this is done you are ready to go-

Attach to any standard width countertop or furniture ledge.. this is held and connected by a clamp method, easy open = turn left.. easy tighten = turn right. Once secure let fishing arm dangle the string with toy feather, butterfly, etc.. you can even attach something you have at home- as long as it‚Äôs light enough in weight!

From there.. this does just what you think it would. It releases the string any vibrating motion going down (helps to bounce item around and get/hold cats attention..) then, as quick as they begin to bat and play with.. it retracts and winds the item back up! Cruel and unusual.. probably!!? But, for a bored cat this can provide plenty of amusement.

Motor is NOT silent.. this is one issue some may have. Although not obnoxiously loud- this has the start and stop continuously that can become a little annoying. Personally, one can drowned out with TV or music- if you‚Äôre not sensitive to noises. Ordered for my son who works from home and has a relentless cat wanting attention or entertainment while on zoom calls.. putting this in the other room kept kitty quiet and out of the way!

I‚Äôd certainly recommend for anyone who have similar needs I‚Äôm keeping their cat entertained! Hoping this info can help your decision- stay safe.

title: Easy return for sizing issue, well made.
text: I‚Äôm writing this review because as I was deciding whether or not to purchase this item, most of the negative reviews I read involved returns. Going by the measurements in the product description I chose the xs but I knew it would be a 50/50 proposition between the xs and the s size. Alas I chose wrong and the xs was just a little too small. The return was painless. The seller issued a return code almost immediately and the funds refunded similarly. Now full disclosure: we didn‚Äôt ‚Äúuse‚Äù this item. We didn‚Äôt need to put 5 miles on it to know it didn‚Äôt fit quite right. We ordered the next size up before the return was completed. From the sellers perspective I‚Äôm sure this helped them in deciding that ours was a legit return. Bottom line this isn‚Äôt a custom made item like other ‚Äúprosthetics‚Äù and braces are, but it is constructed the same way with a sturdy molded plastic. I‚Äôd suggest buying a roll of vetrap to help in tweaking the fit and keeping it snug. This item is appropriately priced but remember you my have to get creative because IT‚ÄôS NOT CUSTOM MADE FOR YOUR PUP. Be prepared to use your head. Knuckling over is heartbreaking to watch and this little brace can help you help your pupper. ‚úåüèΩ

title: Perfect for aggressive chewers
text: My dog is wonderful but is absolutely an aggressive chewer.  I'm always searching for toys that she loves and can withstand her chewing.  These are perfect.  She absolutely loves to play fetch with them.  They bounce great and she loves the squeaker noise.  They're great for outside but are perfect in the house as well.  They don't cause damage.  She loves to just chomp down on them and chew them, but only occasionally has she been able to puncture the center and the squeaker stops, but the ball stays together and still works fine and she still loves to play with them.  There's plenty of them, so it's not a problem.  I gave a couple to two of my neighbors and their dogs absolutely love them.  When I first ordered them, I was concerned that the spikes might hurt her mouth, but they absolutely do not.  I was also concerned whether they would be big enough for her to play fetch with safely (she's a 62 lb. Pitbull, so her mouth is pretty big), but they're a perfect size for her.  My neighbors' dogs (that I gave them to) are a 100 lb. dog and a 40 lb dog, and they are perfect for them as well.  My dog loves them.  I definitely recommend them.

title: Violet absolutely loves these bones but they are $$$ & oral health is unproven at this time text: I ordered this for my 63 pound neighbor's dog Violet. She is a very calm dog that I knew would not swallow these bones whole. At first she plays with them and then she eats them. Since she has plastic bones that are toys, she did not know what to do with these originally. Now she ABSOLUTELY loves these chews but so far there is no noticeable difference in her breathe or teeth.

Although Violet loves these, I feel it is doggy junk food due to the ingredients. The first nine ingredients are (see second photo for full list):
- tapioca starch
- pea starch
- wheat gluten
- glycerin
- gelatin
- chick pea flour
- natural flavor
- citric acid
- potassium sorbate
- etc.

At the current price of $34.99 this is expensive as it comes to about $1.25 per chew and there are 28 chews per bag. However, I believe if the dog loves these, then it is worth the price as an occasional purchase. As for the oral health benefits, that is still unseen in Violet's case.

UPDATE June 17, 2019 - Violet still loves these chews but there is no discernible difference in her breath or teeth cleanliness.

UPDATE June 26, 2019 - Violet finished these and, although she loves these bones, it did nothing to improve or enhance her oral health. These are just good junk food treats that some dogs love and that is the only reason I am keeping this at four stars. However, it is 1 star with regard to the oral health claims.

It's protocol so there's no way around it) For personal use, these coats are a good deal. You should definitely go by measurement guide and don't size up ..NOTE: NO LEASH or Harness HOLE ( I've never seen this before and I had to cut one in every one of the 5 coats I bought for our shelter)I would have given a much higher score if it had the leash hole.

title: So Happy I found these here!
text: The first bottle I purchased was from the vet and cost around $27...a small price to pay for the health of my dog but trying to be a savvy shopper I decided to see if I could find them cheaper here on Amazon.  Low and behold they carried them and I couldn't be happier.  We were first instructed to give my dog one pill, once a day and my gal gobbled it up like a treat (Yeah!).  After revisiting the vet, she decided to lower the dosage to half of a pill once a day (great, now I've got to get a pill splitter or use scissors and cut each one in half, not a huge sacrifice but still kind of a pain).  I first decided to try cutting them in half with scissors and while scissors did work, the pill got kind of crumbly and made a mess.  I then decided to test my strength and wouldn't you know, they are SUPER EASY to break in half just using my hands. Now each morning I get my wake up call to give my girl her "treat"!  Yeah Pala-Tech!!  P.S.  I tried one and they taste awful :)

title: Absolutely great for all dogs, even extreme chewers text: Definitely a great dog toy. It's fun, interactive and has great sounds. My dog is an extreme chewer and manages to destroy all squeaky and noisy toys just about immediately. I think she takes great pride in it, Lol. This one has held up though and she absolutely loves it. It's big enough so that it's impossible to really clamp down it fully. So far it's held up really great and she absolutely loves it. The noises are fantastic. It's especially good in a larger space where she can run after it and the moving and squeaking is at a maximum.
Update - It's about a month later and the toy is still going strong. It's still making the giggle sounds and there isn't any physical damage to the toy. She has it all the time (I don't have to supervise it) and we play with it together every day. She still loves it. She had one of the green ones before, but she destroyed it. I'm not sure why this one is better (maybe the different size or shape?), but it is definitely better for aggressive chewers. I did order another one, assuming that she would eventually kill it, but it's holding up great. I'm very happy with it. If you have a really aggressive chewer like mine, this is definitely worth getting.

title: Nice bed and a reasonable price
text: I bought one of these beds to try it out and see what the elderly dogs in our pack thought of it before buying multiples. The bed is a bit smaller than expected - yes I checked the measurements first - but it just seems smaller in person. However, the 16 and 11 year old Dobermans both used it throughout the day and seem to really like it with the heat on and off. The 13 and 10 year old Rhodesian Ridgebacks used it and decided they prefer their older, larger beds with bolsters and no heat. The verdict is to keep the K&H Ortho Heated Bed and buy one more for the Dobermans. The heat seems to be just right - warm enough for me to feel on the bed, but not hot enough to make me worry about burns, overheating or damage to the bed itself if it's turned on for hours at a time through the winter.

title: Bags are typical small size; 1st bag of every roll is wasted; bags degrade after a year text: There are 120 bags distributed over 8 rolls, so that is 15 bags each roll. These are exactly like the dog poop bags almost every dog owner carries on a leash. The bags fit easily into a typical poop bag dispenser.

The first bag of each roll is NOT easy to remove because the tape holding the roll together tears a hole in the bag. This means the first bag of every roll is wasted. Otherwise, the bags are easy to tear off the roll and not so easy to open.

I was able to scoop two litter pans for three cats worth of debris and the bag held the waste and litter without leaks or holes. These are relatively strong for being biodegradable. However, since they are compostable, there's a 1-year shelf life for these bags after which they start to degrade.

The current price of $13.99 comes to $.12 cents per bag which is pricey. These [[ASIN:B09P467F1X bags]] are a better deal.

title: Good training collar for the price point text: Good collar for the price point. If you're used to $200 training collars then yeah, it's gonna feel cheap... but overall I thought the build quality was quite good for the price. I like that it has 3 separate buttons for beep, vibrate, and shock, as I've used collars in the past where you had to push one button repeatedly to switch thigh the "modes" and it wasted time and made accidents way more likely. The backlighting of the screen is a nice touch for dark. It seems like you have to re-pair the collar and remote each time you turn it on (maybe I'm doing something wrong?) which is easy to do, but also easy to forget to do and then obviously the collar won't work. The beep is very quiet which is good if you're training multiple dogs I suppose, but I've also used that function in the past to locate my dog, which you couldn't do with this collar. Adjusting the shock/vibration stregnth is a little fiddly but you get used to it.

So far it's worked consistently and well, and I'm pleased with it for the price point and would buy again.

text: I had no idea that whisker fatigue is a thing until our sweet Rosie began to have problems with it. She'd ignore her favorite wet food because of the previous pet food bowl we were using. This set of food bowls by Pipetpet has been a welcome addition to our house. The bowls are shallower and wider, so that kitties with whisker fatigue feel comfortable eating their favorite foods. title: A great aid in making our pup slow down
text: This slow feed dog dish has been a great aid in making our pup slow down. He was a rescue, and I guess because of that he always devours his food like it the last time he will ever eat. This dish has slowed him from seconds to minutes!  Plus, it makes him do some problem solving as he figures out the best approach to getting his kibble. At first he was a bit intimidated by it, though certainly not enough to stop him by any means. However, the more he uses it, the more comfortable he becomes with it. I can tell by where his tail is - it started out hanging down all the way, and has risen a bit with each feeding, now being almost all the way back up over his back. I would recommend this dish to anyone who has a dog who just inhales their food.

title: Fun!
text: I have 3 older cats and I'm always looking for ways to engage them into play. The premise of these showed promise. 2 of the 3 kitties showed a little interest in it, the other did not show any. The fish start swimming in the water immediately. You don't have to push any button to get them working. Then when you take them out, they stop. I really like that about it. They have a realistic swim motion that the cats enjoyed watching. The fish don't really swim around the water, but swim in place. They may move around a little bit more, but not much.  Two of the cats actually swatted and tried to catch the fish. Everyone lost interest after a short while. There are 6 fish in all.

title: My LO probably won't figure out how to open it because I struggle with it myself.... text: We purchased several gates for the top of the stairs in our home and there was always some flaw that made us send them right back. We ended up settling on this one. The gate is thick and well constructed. The Little one likes to shake and rattle against this and it won't move.

The latch always feels a little flimsy and weird. You have to pinch both sides and pull them up while lifting to open the gate. It's not easy. I fumble with the stupid thing all the time - I'm hoping that means that the little one won't figure it out either. All in all, this gate has worked well for us. One quirk (besides the hard latch) is that when you close the gate you have to push down to lock it into place, else you can just lift the gate and it will open again without having to use the special lever mechanism. Not a deal breaker, but definitely something to remember.

title: Not for shorter/smaller dogs text: As expected, our new corgi puppy was bouncing all over the truck and I wanted to keep him more contained. I will say that yes, I do have a crate for him to use during longer drives, but when I am going to the post office or grocery store which are within 20 miles from home, I let my dogs ride loose in the truck. They're cattle dogs and we live in an extremely rural area (southern Wyoming) so I don't have any traffic to worry about so it's mostly no crates for us, except for the young pups who lack self control. LOL!

So I ordered this doggy seat belt to keep Booker contained in the front seat. Just as I did with my 6 yr old corgi when he was a pup, I planned to wrapped a bungee cord around the front passenger seat and clip this seat belt to it. That allows him to have free movement but limits him to the front seat only. Well.. that would work if this seat belt wasn't so long or if it could be shortened. It has some room for adjustment, but very little. Certainly not enough to keep a corgi pup in the seat I have assigned for him.

I had my bungee cord setup all assembled in the front passenger seat and clipped this doggy seat belt to Booker's harness. The clips are very well made! They are thick, sturdy metal that I'd imagine could take being run over by a Mack truck and still work just fine.

That all said, I cannot recommend this doggy seat belt for small dogs. I had Booker situated in his seat and all buckled in and we went to the grocery store. When I came out of the store and opened the truck door to put my milk and sugar in the back seat (it was a very short grocery run), I saw my puppy dangling between the front seats, hanging over and behind the center console! I quickly jumped in and took care of him but that was the last time I used this product.

Forgive me for having no pictures (I was kind of preoccupied with saving my puppy at the time) but what happened is this... my corgi puppy tried to jump from the front passenger seat to the rear bench seat but this doggy seat belt stopped him about half way, and the elastic bungee portion of the strap probably jerked him backwards. Now.. if he was a larger dog he would have been left standing on the rear floor. But.. corgi's have very short legs and corgi puppies have even shorter legs, so Booker was left dangling with the doggie seat belt stretched out over my truck's center console where his feet were suspended in midair and nothing nearby to give him purchase to pull himself back up.

Bottom line... I do not fault this product for this incident. Booker is fine. The belt was clipped to the D-ring on the back of his harness, so he was not being strangled or hung by his neck. From my experience though, I will certainly suggest that this doggy seat belt only be clipped and used on dog harnesses - not collars! I will also strongly recommend to only use this with larger, or rather taller, dogs.

title: Buy this! Perfect for food motivated fur babes! Perfect combo of snuffle & licky style mats!!! text: [[VIDEOID:dcdec4e25b95398671964077588b8608]] I hemmed and hawed on this. Then I went for it. I got it today and immediately put it to use.

I have fabric snuffle mats and I have silicone licky mats, and this is like a combo of each. What a great idea! SO GLAD I bought it!

My 7 years old lab was recently diagnosed with lymphoma (it's terminal) and we dont have much time with her. Every day of her life has been good, and an absolute pleasure in min3, and will continue to be as long as she is feeling well. Taking it day by day. Nothing has really changed for her except she has a huge appetite (prednisone). I have been giving her extra mini meals throughout the day and will often utilize a snuffle mat, licky mat or kong to extend her pleasure. Give her something to focus on longer than what she would normally just scarf down. This works!

I really didnt think I needed this, but once I got it in hand, it was exactly what I needed (on various levels. Sorry to get sappy. I just loved seeing my sweet perfect girls face light up when I showed her this).

I loaded it up with the usual assortment of goodies. I smeared some wet pate all over and under the leaves, I sprinkles an assortment of kibble, as well as some healthy treats. I tucked away some blueberries and added in some stinky baltic spratz (dried whole mini fish). There is a lot of surface area to work with. It isn't limited to the base. Make use of the top side of the leaves as well as underside if using something sticky. The leaves are situated in such a way that food can be dropped onto the leaves. Kind of a shallow cup.

She watched in interest as I compiled this for her. Her nose sniffing the air in anticipation. Then I called my husband out to watch her with her new mat. She was eager to comply with cues such as (sit, paw, wait). She was really motivated (normally she thinks those cues are lame, haha)! He set it on the ground so I could get pictures (which I will include).

She worked on it for a long time, several minutes for sure. She was so focused and happy. She licked and snuffled and sometimes picked the mat off the floor to shake out some treats. She truly enjoyed this and it was novel enough that she seemed to get worn out (in a good way) from working this mat. She took a nice snooze afterward.

Her brother isnt much into food unless necessary (and he's a lab! how can this be? haha), so I am not sure if he will use it after her time to go to Rainbow bridge comes. We also have a couple of cats, and I am pretty sure one of them would use this. We'll see. I dont want to offer it to them yet. Right now it totally belongs to my baby girl.

When I came to review this, I noticed that the product listing has this on sale. I decided to go ahead and buy another because I want to give one to my friend who has a dog that needs to be on extremely low key activity for a few weeks. I think this will make a nice little gift. I'll add in a can of pate and some heathy treats for them to get started with. Little things like this can really help impact a dogs psyche. It is mental stimulation and it is also soothing, and therefor satisfying. So a doggo on bedrest may appreciate this!

As with any dog, supervision is a must. My girl isnt into destroying anything, ever, nor would she eat the actual mat-- but your doggo might! So just keep an eye on them.

The suction cups aren't great, but i didnt buy it for that. They also dont impede just placing this on the floor or rug.

I noticed that I could get some suction when I pressed it down on my counter top, but it wasnt a strong suction. Maybe it would work better if a little damp or in a tub? Yet a more traditional style licky mat may work better for that if wanting to secure it to a wall.

I totally think this is worth it. It made our day, and I will be using it again tomorrow. And hopefully many more tomorrows after that.

title: Made in the USA! text: First off and most importantly... these multivitamins are MADE IN THE USA!! Hooray!!

I got these multivitamins for my 6 yr old corgi, Skip. He has been showing just a few signs, but signs nonetheless, of his age so I figured these would be beneficial for him. Mostly, I worry about his back. Being a longer dog, corgis are more apt for back problems than most other breeds. I really appreciate how these multivitamins cover so many bases: digestive system, hips, joints & bones, skin & coat, urinary tract, immune system, respiratory system, muscular system, cardiovascular system, nervous system and special organs (like eyes).

The bag contains 60 multivitamins so giving him one each night as his bedtime treat, this bag will last us 2 months. The resealable zipper topped bag is most appreciated, helping to ensure they stay fresh and last the 2 months. These must taste good as Skip takes them with no issue or hesitation. We have seen no ill effects such as diarrhea or vomiting or any other issues.

Overall, I am very pleased with these multivitamins and will continue to purchase them!

title: Easy clean brush and the tines on this one are stronger than typical; for long-haired pets text: I actually tried several of these brushes previously and was disappointed in all but one because the tines were thin, highly malleable, and bent easily.

This brush's best feature is that it is a cinch to clean. I brush my long-haired cats, then retract the bristles with the button. The hair remains on top and can be slid off. It is a cinch to use.

Also, the tines on this brush are not as soft as several others I tried and the surface area of the brush is decently sized. As can be seen, I brushed one of my cats hard and got some of their hair (see photo) and the tines barely bent.

Note that this is for long-haired pets only; I would not use this with a pet with short hair.

In summary, this one's tines are stronger than other brushes I tried but will still bend. The surface area of the brush is a good size and I love the bumble bee design. I definitely like this brush but the current price of 16.99 is expensive as the exact same brush (but with a "wiuwiuwiu" logo on it) can currently be purchased for $9.99 [[ASIN:B09MQ193H2 here]]. This price is the only reason I deducted another star as this is a 4-star brush.

title: Strong, reflective, short leash with "tricky" locking snap hook and comfortable foam handle grip text: [[VIDEOID:f7eeaef78beeee3f89a03bcb2720e91d]] This is an impressive short dog leash best used to gain control over a dog that pulls or just for when more overall control is needed. I am pleasantly surprised that the stitching is reflective and the orange color also enhances visibility.

This leash is very short at 20" from tip to tip. The foam handle makes it easier to hold a grip and prevents the leash from cutting into hands. I did have terrible trouble with the locking snap hook, however. It took me about five minutes to figure this out. Once I did, it was easy to master. All that is necessary to release the locking mechanism is to pull down on the top of the lock toward the base of the leash. To re-lock push the lock up back toward the hook. Picture two shows the lock closed and picture three shows it open. I also attached a video demonstration.

Overall, this is a sturdy, comfortable, reflective short leash with a good locking mechanism that is great for when more control is needed on dog walks.

I wanted to do a quick update on this fish tank. I have the 5 gallon tank. As I started to purchase plants and decorative items for the tank I was purchasing them based on the dimensions that are given on here to my surprise the tank is not as large as they say that it is and it does not hold 5 gallons of water even without rock in there. The actual dimensions of the tank portion without the lid and without vase are 10 inches high X 13 1/2 inches wide X 6.5‚Äù sides without bow, going to 10‚Äù at the very front of the bow. Another thing that I found very helpful was reading through all of the questions and comments and finding one that told me how to quiet this filter down. They do not tell you that you have to fill the water all the way to the base of the filter which completely submerses it. Even then it does still make a slight grinding noise but much better having added the extra half inch of water to it that I was lacking. I do still wish that it had been the correct size that they say which is 15 x 15 1/2 x 10 essentially I would love to have been able to put a few things or a little bit taller in the tank. Just so that you know the highest that you really should put in there is about 9 to 9 1/2 inches anything else than that will be above the water line. And one last thing for me anyways the where the water flows onto this flat filter only about half of the filter actually gets used, And my tank is level. Overall I guess they just really need a better filter. I thought this tank because I like the way that it looks, however I am wishing now that I had bought one of the panoramic, tall round, or the 6 1/2 gallon tank or even go out to a 10 gallon tank, so that I could‚Äôve had a few more fish because I‚Äôm not one to just have a single Beita in a 5 gallon tank or in this case it‚Äôs actually about 4 gallons even without rock.

title: FLASHDRY IS YOUR FRIEND...!!!! text: ok... after being at my wits end in the puppy potty problem department... I needed help! Answers!! Most of all, solutions..!!! To top it all off- I need this for a Pug- a breed known for needing to mark their territory.. ugh! And the real cherry on top- we just had puppy neutered and so he‚Äôs a few days postop!
Let‚Äôs just say- I‚Äôve been on cleanup patrol and I‚Äôm losing the battle..

Looking for any solution I found disposable wraps... that mimic a doggy diaper?! I noticed the difference in the fact, this has flashdry product- so,
It may help us with leaks or accidents..
Perks:
‚Ä¢ these are clearly marked so, you know your putting it on correctly. When wrestling a dog who‚Äôs not in the mood to play baby diaper this is helpful! Or, if you‚Äôve accidentally put it on wrong and find out the hard way (by leakage!) then, you know how important the directional wording is!!
‚Ä¢adjustable legs are helpful in closing off the gaps that naturally occur.
‚Ä¢urine is absorbed into a gel like substance when it occurs- This drastically decreases leakage and helps to absorb liquid really well- flashdry is your friend!!

‚Ä¢ These come in sizes that are chosen by measuring the dogs girth- which is a far better gauge of fit than using an overall weight measurement!
‚Ä¢The closure tabs do a far better job at working really hard to leave pups hair out of the closing equation.. *Keep in mind- you are wrapping an animal with fur- so, it‚Äôs not full proof.. but, this does help.

Probs:
‚Ä¢These can still wiggle around- i‚Äôm not certain if that is the puppy, parent or products issue?! And may be a little combo of all three?!! But, as your pet runs and rolls around, these can find their way to slipping.
‚Ä¢When placing on puppy- it almost appears to be slipping off from the beginning.. nerve wracking for sure!

‚Ä¢Needs a no bite bitter taste strip! If your puppy wants to try and chew this off- it would be helpful if this had the bitter flavor barrier!! Anything to deter them from wanting to bite and self remove!

‚Ä¢These are absorbent for small accidents- but, I‚Äôve found that if puppy has full bladder.. the wrap can struggle to hold/contain the full amount. (Sure, I realize these arent made to be replace going potty outside-) but, a full bladder sometimes is a thing and if, so.. the wrap can leak.

If weighing perks + probs together.. One can decide if their issue could be fixed and their needs met by what these can/can‚Äôt do.. for us, they helped a lot! **One solution I had for chewing on the wrap- Is to use the bitter flavor coban (medical adhesive wrap with a flavor deterrent) bandage strip and place this around the edge that‚Äôs closest to dogs mouth reach.. if, the taste gets into his mouth- Oh, he will stop trying to chew!!! Sure, this makes one more step and item needed to buy, but in the big picture it helps stop the chewing- and can also help tighten up any lose gaps on the fit itself.. Is this an obnoxious fix to the chew problem? Sure! But, it‚Äôs also a productive fix if, having the same issues we are!! And the fact, we are trying to heal + potty post an operation.. I won‚Äôt lie- we had this extra supply on hand which made this a feasible/doable option.

Overall, these help to make things better vs. worse but, they‚Äôre not 100% potty training solutions and not meant to be! tbh, not sure anything is.. only, the sheer training of a puppy will ultimately fix things in our house- good luck to all! Cleaning puppy potty I know, is not high for fun on anyone‚Äôs to do list..!!!
I hope this info helps‚Ä¶ Feel free to let me know

title: Excellent replacement pump for the Drinkwell Platinum Pet Fountain text: I purchased this as a replacement for the Drinkwell Platinum Pet Fountain and it works beautifully as long as you do the following:

- Since it doesn't come with a flow control valve, you have to switch out the old one from your old pump.
- You have to remove the front fascia on the pump to attach the flow valve.
- You also have to remove the cap that sits over what I call "the water output hole" so that it fits with the top part of the Platinum fountain.

What I really love about this pump as opposed to my old one is the plug that goes into the wall. On my old pump I always had to detach the cord in the middle leaving a piece of cord behind (that was also attached to the wall plug) for my cats to play with until I cleaned the fountain and plugged it back in again. This pump comes with a cord that directly detaches from the base of the plug so that the only hanging cord is the piece coming out of the pump itself.

Overall, I'm very satisfied.

title: My cats do not like this; only one ate some of it but it took 12 hours for him to do so - 2.5 stars text: At the current price of $25.02 ($33.36 minus 25%), this comes to $1.04 per 3-ounce can, which is competitively priced. There are 24 cans in this package. The first several ingredients are chicken, chicken liver, chicken broth, dried egg product, fish oil, etc. This is high in protein for kittens.

I ordered this for my three elderly cats who need to put on some weight. One of my cats is so old (about 19 years) and thin that he needs to gain at least 7 pounds. Therefore, it is a good idea to use kitten food to beef up a cat's weight but only for those who need the calories. Otherwise cats should not eat kitten food because the excess calories will cause them to gain weight.

Blue Buffalo is good food in my opinion. However, two of my cats would not eat this. My oldest cat would not even try it. My other skinny cat only licked it then walked away. Only my heaviest (of the skinny cats) ate about two-thirds of the can but it took him 12 hours to do so. I had to throw out the rest. This is going to get donated to a shelter with kittens.

In summary, two of my cats' do not like this food and only one would begrudgingly eat some of it when that is all that was left. However, if one's cat needs to gain weight or a kitten likes this chicken food, then this is good food in my opinion.

title: Made in Thailand, for the price I would rather it was made in the USA text: If my money can go to something made in the USA and my dog scarfs it down you know I will pay a couple extra dollars. In an email I received from Natural Balance Pet Foods (in response to my question), "Our Delectable Delights Stews are made in Thailand by a state of the art US FDA approved plant."

Also "Please also know that Natural Balance tests every lot of our products for nine potential contaminants that have been implicated in pet food recalls in the past. In a Test and Hold Program, our products are held in the warehouse and not available for sale until all the tests for those products come back with a passing result. We enter the results on our website so that you can view the results for your product. Go to the NBPF and follow the instructions about entering product name and date code to view the testing report for you product. Also please review the video on that page that describes our lab and testing."

The final report comes from our 15 year old, ten pound, miniature fox terrier - when the the dish was empty, in less than 2 minutes, she was begging for more (bad dog!). I only had the one 8 ounce stew so I don't know if she would have tired of it after a couple weeks.

title: A Good Choice for Smaller Dogs and Cats text: I have two large cats and they tend to squabble over places to sleep. I selected this pet bed with the thought that it would reduce some of the tension between them. For the most part I was right. I will say it‚Äôs not ideal for larger house cats or for any animal much beyond 15 pounds. But, for animals in the right size range, it‚Äôs better than I expected.

This is a small octagonal bed that comfortably seats one slightly overfed house cat (who am I fooling, that cat eats like a teenage football player). It‚Äôs very soft and the cushion inside is appealing to animals that like a soft, plush surface. The sides are also padded well so even against a wall the pet will have a plush surface on which to rest.

The bottom is mostly non-slip and so far the bed has remained in place where we initially set it down.

One of our cats has adopted the bed and she can often be found sleeping in it during the day (when she‚Äôs not asking to be fed). She‚Äôs about 15 pounds and she fills the whole bed but she does indeed completely fit in it. The cushion is still relatively new so it hasn‚Äôt mashed down much yet, but I expect as she sleeps in it more the pad will crush to a thinner but still soft pad.

It has helped ease competition for sleeping spaces between our two cats which was the goal. I am pleased with it and so far they are too. It‚Äôs not a particularly expensive bed either and so far it‚Äôs holding up very well. For a smaller pet, this is a good choice.

title: Decent quality, slightly narrower straps text: We take our dogs out to deep West Texas several times a year and they all wear boots out there. The Rio Grand region has serious thorns, sharp rocks and loose shale throughout the mountains and arroyos. I don't want their paws torn up or hurting as we explore and hike.

These are a middle level quality dog boot. The soles are thick and offer a bit of grip on uneven surfaces. You do need to watch in high heat that your dog's feet don't overheat while wearing these. These fit our big old Plott Hound with his large feet. They have 2 velcro straps that hold the boot in place as the dog moves - like most. However, these straps are more narrow than our other boots and they don't seem to hold quite as strongly. I think the boots are fine for most of our needs, but not for heavy hiking in rough terrain.

title: Good crate, but quality control is an issue text: My initial review: This crate is a nice one that folds for travel. I wish it were lighter weight, but it probably wouldn't be as sturdy if it were. The handle that came with the crate was not very durable.

I first purchased one of these crates in July 2013. The paragraph above describes my experience. At year end I decided to order another one. When it arrived, the welding holding part of the front of the crate had failed and the front of the crate was lop-sided when I put it together. Also there was no handle included with this crate. Since the handle for the first one broke fairly quickly with very limited use, I am not too disappointed that the handle no longer comes with the crate. I have shipped the crate back to Amazon and am waiting for a replacement for the second crate. Am hoping it is sturdier than the one I just returned.

title: Three of my four cats keep returning to the bowl for additional servings of this kibble text: I have four indoor senior cats that range in age from 9 to 12 years old. Only my female terminally ill cat is really finicky and refuses a lot of food. However, she and two of my other cats ate this food immediately, preferring it over their usual food. All three went back for seconds and thirds.

This turkey, turkey meal, and duck formula is grain free and has no fillers, wheat, or corn. It is made in the USA but it does not say where the ingredients are sourced from. The kibble is compressed into tiny pellets.

The first 21 ingredients in order are:
- Deboned Turkey
- Turkey Meal
- Peas
- Potato Protein
- Potatoes
- Canola Oil (preserved with mixed tocopherols)
- Tomato Pomace
- Duck
- Pork Meal
- Ground Flaxseed
- Natural Turkey Flavor
- Cranberries
- Chicory Root Extract
- Vitamin E Supplement
- Choline Choride
- Taurine
- Mixed Tocopherols added to preserve freshness
- Zinc Proteinate
- Zinc Sulfate
- Calcium Carbonate
- Ferrous Sulfate
- etc. (about 32 various vitamins, minerals and amino acids...)

The Guaranteed Analysis is:
Crude Protein minimum of 38%
Crude Fat minimum of 18%
Crude Fiber maximum of 6.0%
Moisture maximum of 11%
Calcium maximum of 1.80%
Phosphorus maximum of 1.10%
Magnesium maximum of 0.12%
Vitamin E minimum of 200 IU/kg
Taurine minimum of 0.10%
*Omega-6 Fatty Acids minimum of 3.00%
*Omega-3 Fatty Acids minimum of 1.00%
*Beta-Carotene minimum of 2 mg/kg
*Total Lactic Microorganisms (Lactobacillus plantarum, Enteroccoccus faecium, Lactobacillus casei, Lactobacillus acidophilus in equal amounts) minimum of 90,000,000 CFU/lb

*These ingredients are not recognized as an essential nutrient by the AAFCO Cat Food Nutrient Profiles.

The calculated calorie content is 3,706 kcal ME/kg; 411 kcal ME/cup

In summary, this kibble gets five stars from three of my four cats. At the current price of $11.79 for a two-pound bag, I think this is expensive but then again premium foods comparable to the [[ASIN:B00QT4X1OI Blue Wilderness brand]] tend to cost more. Although the Blue Wilderness brand is always my first choice, this is definitely a cat food I would purchase to mix in with their other food and add variety to their diet.

title: Very chewy jerky treats for dogs¬† text: I gave these to my friend's two dogs and had immediate refusals until further inspections caused them to eat these. Ingredients:
- organic chicken

- Non-GMO coconut glycerine
- salt

In summary, it seems dogs love these after getting up the nerve to take the first chewy bite. At the current price of $8.99 for a 4 ounce bag, these are expensive. text: This is actually a little bigger than it looks in the picture but should still fit in nearly all small tanks (3-6 gallon). .  I had a fish company ship me 2 Betta's by mistake - of course I only had one betta tank.  Had to find another 5 gallon tank before the fish arrived and I needed heaters for both.  I bought two of these 100 watt heaters.  They work quite well esp for the price - in fact I couldn't find any other heaters that were short enough to fit in their tanks (what is wrong with these sellers and their huge heaters?).  Even my heater for my 50 gallon tank barely stays below the water line.  So these work great for most/all 5 gallon tanks.  In my opinion a betta deserves that much room - don't make them live in less space regardless of what the bet store tells you- it is just cruel if you do. Betta's are one of the smartest fish, fill their tank with things to look at and do and pay attention to them every day or don't get one.

title: Disappointed, Velcro closure does not hold up
text: I love the collar this company makes. But I am disappointed in this harness. For comfort, fit and ease of putting on and taking off - it is 5 stars. If I had written this review right after purchasing it, it would have been 5 stars. However, I've used it for maybe a year or less even - and the Velcro is worn out. Yes, there is a safety strap that buckles closed on top of the Velcro closure, but that is not adequate, in my opinion. Almost every walk, after about 20 minutes, I notice the Velcro is just about completely separated and harness is slipping around because the only thing holding it on is the safety strap. I have an 80 pound pit bull, so I can't take chances with equipment that won't hold him on the rare occasion when a bunny or kitty cat crosses our path. I'm purchasing a new harness today, going back to the Yup! No-pull harness - BEST harness I've ever used. Available here on Amazon or PetCo/PetsMart.

title: Surprisingly strong biodegradable poop bags; bags not always easy to open text: I did not expect these bags to be so sturdy because I tried biodegradable garbage bags in the past and they were horrible.

title: Helped a foster dog in combination with soy free food text: We had a foster dog who arrived with gunky, itchy ears and hot spots. She had even scratched a wound into one of the ears. In the thirty days with us, we got her on a grain/soy free diet and used this stuff for ten days. All of her hot spots and most of the yeast in her ears cleared up within two weeks - a high end, soy free food will do that every time.

She really fought these drops the first 7 days and then as her ears started to feel better, she relaxed. I continued to use this as a rub on clearer for the top and exterior ear for two more weeks. She was able to go to her new forever home clean, healthy and with itch free ears.

title: Cannot recommend - too much corn meal text: Well, we used to buy Greenies for our dog and our cats all the time. That is, until we got a cat that was allergic to corn!

These things are mostly corn meal.
If you have a pet with itchy skin, you might want to try and see if corn meal is creating a reaction. Just like with people, corn can be highly allergenic and cause gluten problems.

The small amount of chlorophyll for their breath isn't worth a tradeoff of itchy skin and bloating for our cat.
No more Greenies for us. And now that I know they are mostly corn (I admit - I never used to be a label reader), I wouldn't buy them for a dog either.

title: Nice set for foster homes text: We have 3 old dames here - ages range from 14 to 16 years old. Because of their advanced years, two have a bit of urine leakage when they sleep. I don't mind....my girls have been awesome dogs and washing bedding every morning is the least I can do after so many years together.

I use a waterproof pad on top of the super thick orthopedic dog beds and then a soft blanket on top of that for each senior dog bed. I wash and rotate those blankets and pads every single day, so I need them to be well made. This is just a single, huge rectangle pad. It has a sort of felt like top side- it's not felt, but that is what it reminds me of. It actually covers a big 48" rectangle dog bed very nicely and it stays put through the night. So far, no urine has leaked through to the bed and that is all I ask. I've run it through the washer and dryer twice now and it hasn't shrunk or unraveled. I definitely needed to use fabric softener because the material isn't as soft as I would like.

This set comes with two of those puppy feeder bowls. They have the food in a shallow space all around the bowl so puppies can do the moving circle to eat. The bowls are decent quality stainless. And there are tiny, puppy collars as well. Almost no one should be breeding for any reason at this point. However, since we foster dogs for the shelter here and sometimes puppy litters, these will eventually be used.

title: The 3 dogs love this; ingredients are good but be careful of a grain-free daily feeding text: I got this for my friend's dogs to supplement with their other food. At first none of the dogs would eat this but after about five minutes, they fell in love. In fact, one of her dogs ate so much that she threw up about 10 minutes later.

The ingredients are good except for the lentils and peas‚Äîsee my note below. The first 12 are turkey, turkey meal, lentils, peas, fava beans, canola oil, tapioca starch, dried plain beet pulp, flaxseed, natural flavor, dried alfalfa meal, menhaden fish oil, etc.

Note that unless a dog has a grain allergy, it is not a good idea to feed them grain-free foods exclusively. The reason is that vets are finding an association between heart disease (such as canine dilated cardiomyopathy) and grain-free dog foods. This disease is mostly associated with the foods that have peas, lentils, other legumes or potatoes as their main ingredients and this food has lentils, peas, and beans. Nevertheless, I feel it is okay to feed this food to a dog only to supplement a dog's diet and not as an exclusive meal.

The dogs definitely love this food. The current price of $12.99 for 4 pounds is reasonable for this type of food.

title: Ok, dog food that my dog really likes, but I prefer more all natural varieties for her text: This is one of my 4 year old Aussie Shepherd's favorite dog food. title: Questionable origin - Treats are okay though!
text: These 6 Inch Beef Cheek Rolls for Dogs (Extra Thick) come in a pack of 3 and look decent enough. However, no where in the description or offered pictures is the country of origin mentioned. I refuse to give my dogs ANYTHING edible from China and I try very hard to know where an edible item is from before I purchase it. Since the description offered no information, I turned to my fellow reviewers and saw pictures that these are from Brazil. Perfect! Well.. they arrived and while one side of my package looks like other reviewer photos and does indeed say "Country of Origin: Brazil".. the other side of my package says "Imported from Turkey". While this isn't a deal breaker for me, I would still appreciate knowing just exactly where the heck these rolls came from. I did decide to give them to my dogs and there were no incidents of stomach upset or bouts of diarrhea to report.. they were all smiles and butt wiggles (they're Pembroke Welsh Corgis, so no tail wags here LOL!). Overall, these treats seem to be okay but I thought I'd mention the dual countries of origin that are, oddly enough, both mentioned on the packaging for anyone else interested in knowing.

title: Cat really likes it, I like the ingredients text: Our Siamese is probably 6 years old, but as a rescue, it's hard to know for sure. He is a bigger cat, not chonky, but a large cat. He eats two 3 ounce cans of food a day plus free feeds dry food. These little pouches are only 1.4 ounces of food each, we have to give him 2 at a time or he won't get enough to eat.

He does really like the Broths, but they are exactly what they say...80% broth and some bits of meat. If he were truly a senior cat with dental or digestive issues, I would definitely add these to his diet on a regular basis. But having to use 4 a day is just too expensive compared to his usual canned food.

title: What's Not to Like? text: This is a copy of my review for this product but in the "Big Boyz" size.

My puppy gets one of these every day. As much as he loved the regular size, this 'Big Boyz' size make him even happier. As others have said, they don't last very long with an excited, 60 lb pit mix puppy, but they are well worth it - especially with the S & S program. Guru loves the smell and the flavor of these treats and I like that they are an alternative to his mostly meat-based food and treat diet. The facts that they help clean his developing teeth, work his gums AND are made here in the US are all added bonuses.

To quote paraphrase from another reviewer, I love my puppy and these premium treats are the perfect way to reward him, help keep his teeth clean and help him feel the love. A well-loved, healthy puppy is a happy puppy!

title: Not too bad text: I got this kitty litter for my hedgehog's litter pan because I didn't like using [[ASIN:B0002DJG0U Super Pet Critter Litter, 8-Pound]]. I don't think she liked to urinate in the CL and sometimes wouldn't poop in it either. My hedgehog didn't use the Arm & Hammer stuff the first day or two but she does now.
It clumps so-so....nothing compared to the kitty litter I use for my cats, which is [[ASIN:B004IVETL8 SCOOP AWAY Multicat Complete Performance Cat Litter, 42-Pound]] (which, btw, is heavily perfumed but totally eliminates or covers up the smell of cats, and it is pretty dusty, but we like it anyway because it works so well and the cats aren't bothered by it). Anyway, the clumping of the A&H is okay if you're delicate with the scooping and don't shake it too much.
My hedgie does track it all over her cage but I change out her fleece cage liners every-other day anyway so it's not a big problem.
I haven't noticed that this litter is dusty at all, so that's a plus. Just have to make sure you don't throw it up in the air when you're scooping which is common sense.
Besides the fact that it doesn't scoop *that* well, the real reason why I'm giving it 3 stars is because it is really perfumed (but not as much as the Scoop Away). For them saying that it isn't perfumed on the bag, it really does smell strongly. I don't mind the smell--our spare bedroom where I keep my hedgie STUNK before I got this stuff, and now it doesn't stink and instead smells a bit perfumed from this stuff. *I* don't mind the smell at all, but I guess others might and especially someone with chemical sensitivity. I don't know what they put in it to make it smell that way, but it can't just be corn fibers and baking soda! It doesn't seem to bother my hedgehog so I won't be returning it, but I might debate on switching to something else in the near future anyway that isn't so perfumed.
